loans.name: Irenia

texts.en: Irenia is a 56-year-old woman from Ormoc, Leyte. She is makes a living through her hog raising business. Irenia has been in the business for more than two years now. She is asking to take a loan to buy additional piglets to raise, animal feed and supplements. A loan will help her improve her hog raising business as well as her income. In the future, Irenia dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise, animal feed and supplements

loans.name: Nuray

texts.en:
Nuray is a widow and a mother of three. She earns a living by making and selling mantı (Turkish ravioli) at home.  With her income, she put her three children through school and secured their employment.  With her first two loans, she bought ingredients to make mantı and earned money from the mantı that she sold.  She plans on doing the same with her third loan.
  
Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Nuray hanım üç çocuk annesi eşi vefat etmiş.  Evinde mantı yaparak ve satarak evini geçindiriyor.  Üç çocuğunu okutmuş ve meslek sahibi olmalarını sağlamış.  Aldığı ilk kredi ile mantı malzemesi aldı, üretip sattı ve para kazandı.  İkinci kredi ile mantı malzemesi aldı, üretip sattı ve gelir kazandı.  Aile ekonomisine katkı sağladı.  Üçüncü kredi ile mantı malzemesi aldı üretip satarak para kazanmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make mantı

loans.name: Aysel

texts.en:
Aysel is a divorced mother of one.  For 10 years, she was a realtor but her office was sold and she had to close her business.  In the meantime, she has been working from her home.  With this loan, she plans to rent office space and use her profit to help prepare a better future for her child.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Aysel hanım bir çocuk annesi eşinden ayrı on yıldır emlakçılık yaparak geçimini sağlamış dükkân satılınca kapatmış.  Evden network sistemi yaparak evini geçindiriyor.  Aldığı kredi ile dükkân tuttu ve emlakçılık yapıyor.  Çocuğuna iyi bir gelecek hazırlamak istiyor.

loans.use: to rent an office

loans.name: Luis Geovanny

texts.es: Luis es un joven de 23 años de edad, el está divorciado y tiene 2 hijos, uno de 6 meses y una niña de 4 años, Luis se dedica  a la crianza de pollos y también se dedica a trabajar de albañil, es un año  que empezó  con este negocio de criar pollos, vive en una casa por la que paga arriendo y ahí tiene un espacio para criar animales menores, el crédito lo va  a invertir en la comprar de pollos y de este negocio espera mejorarlo teniendo mas cantidad de estos animales, la aspiración de Luis es seguir trabajando en su negocio y para de estos ingresos darles la alimentación y lo necesario para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luis, 23, is divorced and has 2 children; a 6 month old boy and a 4 year old girl. Luis makes a living raising chickens and he also works as a builder. He began his business raising chickens a year ago. He lives in a rented house and has a space there to breed small animals.

Luis will invest this loan in the purchase of chickens and he hopes to improve his business by having a larger number of animals. His ambition is to continue working on his business and use his income to provide food for his children and everything else they need.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is a 44-year-old sari-sari store owner from Ormoc, Leyte. She is married and has four children. Rowena has been operating her sari-sari or retail store business selling various  goods and items to the people in her place. Rowena is asking to take a loan to buy more stocks like canned goods, noodles, rice, bread and biscuits, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments among other items. A loan will allow her to augment her inventories, thus attracting more buyers in her store. In the future, Rowena hopes to make her business more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like canned goods, noodles, rice, bread and biscuits, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments among other items

loans.name: Rafatou

texts.fr: Rafatou est une femme veuve qui vit avec ses quatre enfants dans le quartier de Gblinkomé. Agée de 53 ans, Rafatou est une revendeuse de papiers d’emballage et des outils de décorations. Rafatou gagne sa vie grâce à ce commerce et nourrit ses enfants par le revenu qu’elle tire de son  activité. Pour commander des papiers en grandes quantités et répondre aux sollicitations des clients qui désirent emballer des colis pour des manifestations, Rafatou demande ce prêt pour financer son commerce.
texts.en: Rafatou is a 53-year-old widow who lives with her four children in Gblinkomé District. She works as a vendor, selling wrapping paper and decoration kits. Rafatou earns a living from this business and is able to feed her children with these profits. Rafatou is requesting this loan to finance her business so she can order large quantities of wrapping paper and meet her customers' demands, as they are asking for a gift wrapping service.

loans.use: to purchase 30 rolls of wrapping paper

loans.name: Sandra Rocio

texts.es: Sandra está casada, tiene 24 años de edad y su hijo tiene 6 meses de edad, el esposo de Sandra trabaja recolectando la basura en el carro recolector que recorre la cuidad diariamente para tenerla limpia, Sandra se dedica  3 años a la crianza de pollos, los cría pequeñitos y los vende cuando ya están listos para faenarlos, Sandra necesita el crédito para comprar pollos y seguir adelante con su negocio, la aspiración de Sandra es comprar mas pollos para  de esta manera mejorar su negocio, y junto a su esposo trabajan duro para darle una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sandra is married, she is 24 years old and her son is 6 months old. Her husband works as a dustman in the truck that collects garbage daily to keep the city clean. 

Sandra makes a living rearing chicken, she cares for them since they are days old and then sells them when they are fully grown and ready to be processed. She has been doing this for 3 years now.

Sandra needs the loan to buy chickens and go on with her business. Her desire is to buy more chickens and this way improve her business.

She and her husband work hard to provide good living conditions for their children.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to carry out construction work on her plot of land

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ana es una joven emprendedora de 22 años de edad, está soltera y aún no tiene hijos, ella vive junto a sus padres y hermanos.

Ana está estudiando su último año de técnico en mercadeo, pues sus padres le han dado la oportunidad de estudiar y ella lo ha aprovechado al máximo, además en sus tiempos libres le ayuda a su tío a atender una tienda de la cual obtiene ingresos económicos para sus gastos.

El crédito lo necesita para pagar los gastos de graduación pues el dinero que tiene no le es suficiente y necesita ajustar.

Ella sueña con graduarse y conseguir buenas oportunidades de empleo para superarse.
texts.en:
Ana, 22, is an enterprising young woman. She is single and has no children yet and she lives together with her parents and siblings.

Ana is in her last year of a degree in marketing. Her parents provided her with the opportunity to study and she made the most of it; she also helps her uncle with his shop in her spare time and receives income to help cover her expenses.
 
Ana needs this loan to pay for her graduation expenses because the money that she has isn't enough to cover them and she needs to meet the costs. She dreams of graduating and finding good job opportunities in order to better herself.

loans.use: to pay for graduation costs.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Oscar de 42 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta cuarto grado de educación bàsica, está acompañado y tiene tres hijos de los cuales solo dos están estudiando y el mayor trabaja.

Oscar es agricultor, desde niño le gustaba acompañar a su padre al campo y así fue como aprendió, actualmente siembra dos hectáreas de maíz y también se dedica a la crianza de cerdos.

Este crédito lo necesita para pagar el alquiler de dos hectáreas de terreno donde siembra maíz, por lo cual el crédito será de mucha ayuda para Oscar.

Su sueño es que sus hijos se preparen y sabe que con la ayuda de Dios y los créditos puede lograrlo.
texts.en:
Oscar is 42 years old. He was only able to go to school up to the fourth grade of primary school. He is married and has three children, only two of whom are in school, and the oldest works. 

Oscar is a farmer. Since he was a boy, he liked to accompany his father in the fields an that is how he learned. Right now, he plants two hectares of corn and he also raises pigs. 

He needs this loan to rent two hectares of land where he grows corn, so it will be a big help for Oscar.

His dream is for his children to be educated and he knows that with God's help and the loans, he can achieve it.

loans.use: to pay rent on two hectares of land where he grows corn.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Etant femme mariée et mère de trois enfants, Adjo est âgée de 35 ans et vit à Attiégou. Pour permettre à ses enfants de bénéficier d’une situation favorable, Adjo vend des charbons de bois pour aider son mari à sortir sa famille de la précarité. Malgré ses efforts, le revenu nécessaire pour palier efficacement ce problème ne lui est pas disponible. Adjo s’approvisionne trois fois par mois chez un grossiste du quartier. Dans le but de commander de nouveaux sacs de charbons, Adjo demande ce crédit pour rendre possible ses achats et avoir la rentabilité nécessaire afin de favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Adjo is a 35-year-old married mother to three children who lives in Attiégou. In order to give her children a better future, Adjo sells wood charcoal in order to assist her husband lift their family from below the breadline. Despite her efforts, she lacks the revenue necessary for solving this problem. Adjo gets her supplies three times per month from a local wholesaler. In order to purchase more bags of wood charcoal, Adjo is requesting this loan in order to make this purchase possible and to make it viable for her children to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase six bags of wood charcoal

loans.name: Amah

texts.fr: Amah est une mère de sept enfants et âgée 39 ans. C’est une femme mariée qui travaille dynamiquement pour l’épanouissement de sa famille et vit à  Agbokope. Amah prépare des savons à base du soda et de l’huile rouge qu’elle vend dans les marchés et sur commande de ses clients. Cette activité lui permet d’avoir un minimum de revenu nécessaire pour leur survie. Amah s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché d’Agbalepedo. Pour disposer de ses matières de préparations et réaliser encore plus de résultats, Amah nécessite ce prêt pour concrétiser son objectif.
texts.en: Amah is a 39-year-old married mother to seven children. She is a dynamic woman who works hard to see her family prosper. She lives in Agbokope. Amah makes bars of soap from red oil and baking soda then sells her wares at market or directly to her customers. This business allows her to earn the bare minimum income for her family to get by. Amah gets her supplies three times per month from the market in Agbalepedo. In order to procure the materials she needs and earn further profits, Amah needs this loan to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to purchase four containers of red oil and one bag of baking soda

loans.name: Benkadi-Ton Group

texts.fr:
Mr Bakary est l’homme qui a ses mains sur le mouton sur la photo.
Mr Bakary, âgé de 38 ans est un  Malien emboucheur des ovins. Il est marié père de cinq (05) enfants dont trois (03) Scolarisés. Bakary a fréquenté l’école Coranique niveau 8e Année. Sa femme évolue dans le petit commerce (confection et vente de pain traditionnel).
Bakary s’approvisionne dans les foires hebdomadaires de sa zone. Il engraisse les béliers et brebis pendant un certain moment et fait appel à ses clients qui viendront les acheter chez lui-même.
Au cours des ventes, il peut avoir des bénéfices variant entre 17 500 à 150 000 F CFA par trimestre.
Il exerce ce travail depuis seize (16) ans mais grâce au soutien des prêts du RMCR, il achète beaucoup de béliers et brebis pour engraisser en vue de les revendre. Ce prêt lui permet de subvenir à ses charges familiales.  Les activités de Bakary marchent sans difficulté majeure à part que souvent certains moutons meurent malgré les soins vétérinaires.
Bakary compte sur un appui renforcé de la part du RMCR pour que dans les jours à venir qu’il puisse faire de  l’embouche bovine qui présente moins de risque que celle des ovins.
texts.en: Bakary is the man holding the sheep in the photo. Bakary is 38 years old. He lives in Mali and raises sheep. He is a married father to five children, three of which are currently receiving an education. Bakary attended a Koranic school until his eighth year. His wife earns a living through small-scale retail (baking and selling traditional bread). Bakary gets his supplies from the weekly livestock market in his area. He raises rams and ewes until they are fully grown, then he calls on his customers who come and buy directly from him. Over the course of this period, he could bring in profits between 17,500-150,000 FCFA per quarter. He has been doing this work for 16 years. Thanks to the financial support from RMCR, he has purchased several rams and ewes for resale. This loan allows him to meet his family's expenses. Bakary's business has not been met with any major difficulties, apart from some of his sheep dying despite veterinary intervention.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to raise then resell

loans.name: Jonny Anibal

texts.es: Anibal  es un joven de 24 años de edad, tiene nacionalidad colombiana, vive  en un cuarto que arrienda con un amigo, Anibal se dedica  a la crianza de pollos y también trabaja al jornal,  él tiene nacionalidad colombiana y cometa que se vino a Ecuador debido a que en este país si hay donde trabajar, Anibal necesita el crédito para comprar pollos y criarlos en un corral que hay en la casa que  vive, la aspiración de Anibal es de seguir adelante en su negocio y comprar mas pollos para que así crezca  su negocio.
texts.en: Anibal is a 24 year old man. He is Colombian and he lies in a rented room with a friend. Anibal raises chickens and he also works as a day laborer. He says that he came to Ecuador because there is work in this country. Anibal needs the loan to buy chickens and to raise them in a pen in the house where he lives. Anibal's goal is to keep going forward and buy more chickens so that his business will grow.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Jhony Simón

texts.es:
Jhony de 26 años de edad, está acompañado pero aún no tiene hijos, su esposa trabaja como vendedora en una empresa de produtos lacteos, Jhony solo logró estudiar hasta noveno grado.


Él es cobrador de una comercial que vende muebles, ya tiene mas de 5 años en esta actividad y anteriormente trabajaba como agricultor.

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar dos vacas ya que tiene un potrero que su padre le ha dado para trabajarlo y entonces necesita comprar ganado.

Su sueño es tener un mejor futuro y sabe que puede lograrlo con la ayuda de los créditos.
texts.en:
Jhony is 26 years old. He is married and has no children yet. His wife works as a salesperson in a dairy products business. Jhony was only able to go to school up to the ninth grade.  

He is a collector for a business that sells furniture. He has been doing this activity for more than 5 years and previously he worked as a farmer. He needs this loan to buy two cows because he has a pasture that his father has given him to work it and so he needs to buy cattle. 

His dream is to have a better future and he knows that he can do it with the help of the loans.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Pablo Leonel

texts.es:
El cantón el Carmen posee una considerable riqueza en flora y fauna, siendo una de las fuentes principales de ingreso el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete,  aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Dios Es Amor.
En este lugar vive don Pablo,  tiene 30  años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen dos  hijos de 5 y 7  años que estudian en la  escuela. Su esposa es ama de casa.
El señor Pablo es un hombre que le toca trabajar duro para sacar adelante a su familia, el tiene un puesto  de venta de frutas y verduras. Trabaja todos los días desde las  08h00 hasta las 17h00, él se desplaza desde la madrugada hasta el mercado mayorista a comprar los mejores productos para poder ofrecerles a sus clientes, él trabaja en compañía de cuatro trabajadores y tiene este negocio ya por varios años.  A pesar de que el trabajo es sacrificado tiene que hacerlo por el bienestar de su familia.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar  frutas y verduras. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 2 años  y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos.  Sus metas son tener un local más grande con más variedad de productos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus compradores.
texts.en:
The canton of Carmen has a considerable richness of flora and fauna, and growing Barraganete bananas is one of the primary sources of income. Here, the members of the Dios es Amor communal bank group meet every two weeks. 

Pablo lives in this place. He is 30 years old, married, and from this relationship they have two children, ages 5 and 7, who go to school.  His wife is a housewife.

Pablo is a man who has to work hard to get his family ahead. He has a fruit and vegetable stand. He works every day from 8:00 to 17:00 and he goes early in the morning to the wholesale market to purchase the best products to be able to offer them to his customers. He works in the company of four workers and has had this business for some years. Despite the work being demanding, he has to do it for his family's well-being. 

This loan will be used to purchase fruits and vegetables. He has been in the communal bank group for 2 years and he likes it because the loans are fast. His goals are to have a larger retail space with more variety of products and to satisfy his buyers' needs.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Jenny Karina

texts.es: Karina  es una chica de 21 años de edad, ella vive con sus padres que se dedican a la ganadería y a la agricultura, Karina trabaja de empleada cociendo costales, también se dedica a la crianza de terneros, comenta que ella comprar los terneros y que los tiene en terrenos de su hermana y que es ella quien le ayuda a cuidarlos, Karina necesita el crédito para comprar terneros y es asi como logra obtener  mas ingresos para pagar sus estudios, la aspiración de Karina es de seguir comprando mas terneros y por medio de este negocio lograr pagar los gastos de su  educación.
texts.en: Karina is 21 years old.  She lives with her parents who work in livestock and farming.  Karina works sewing bags as well as raising calves.  She buys calves and keeps them on land owned by her sister, who helps her take care of them.  Karina is in need of a loan to purchase calves so that she can increase her income in order to pay for her schooling.  Karina aspires to continue purchasing calves and use her earnings from the business to pay for her education.

loans.use: purchase calves.

loans.name: Yony Carlos

texts.es: Carlos es una señor de nacionalidad colombiana pero reside en Ecuador ya que comenta que en Ecuador se puede tener una vida mas tranquila, Carlos vive con sus 2 hijos el mayor que tiene 14 años y una chica que tiene  12 años y que asisten al colegio,  Carlos  se dedica a trabajar al jornal y al negocio de ganado, con el dinero del crédito Carlos  va a comprar terneros para seguir en su negocio, ya que comenta que trabaja duro para mantener y educar a sus hijas, lo que Carlos aspira es mejorar su negocio y de ahí tener sus ingresos para educar a su hija e hijo.
texts.en: Carlos is a Columbian native currently living in Ecuador because he believes he can live a more relaxed life in Ecuador.  Carlos lives with his two children.  The eldest its 14 years old and the youngest is 12, they both attend high school.  Carlos works as a day laborer and raising livestock.  With this loan, Carlos will purchase calves to keep his business going since he works hard to care for and educate his children.  Carlos aspires to improving his business and his income so that he can educate his children.

loans.use: purchase calves.

loans.name: Josefa Del Carmen

texts.es:
El cantón el Carmen posee una considerable riqueza en flora y fauna, siendo una de las fuentes principales de ingreso el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete, aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Dios Es Amor.
En este lugar vive la señora Josefa, tiene 52 años de edad, es madre soltera de tiene un hijo mayor de edad e independiente, ella vive en casa de familiares.
Doña Josefa hace varios años empezó un negocio, ella tiene un pequeño puesto de comida en el cual prepara deliciosos desayunos y almuerzos, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 07h00 hasta las 17h00. Trabaja sola, aunque a veces el hijo le ayuda cuando él puede.  Tiene su comedor por 5 años y  siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que sus clientes la prefieren por la sazón que le pone a sus platos.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace año y medio  y le gusta porque los requisitos no son muy complicados. Sus metas son tener casa propia ya que vive con familiares.
texts.en:
The canton of Carmen has a considerable richness of flora and fauna, and growing Barraganete bananas is one of the primary sources of income. Here, the members of the Dios es Amor communal bank group meet every two weeks. 

Josefa lives in this place. She is 52 years old, a single mother, who has an adult son who is independent. She lives in the house of relatives. 

Some years ago, Josefa began her business. She has a small food stall where she prepares delicious breakfasts and lunches. She works from Monday to Saturday from 7:00 to 17:00. She works alone, although sometimes her son helps when he can. She has had the restaurant for 5 years and it has always gone very well since her customers prefer her for the flavoring that she uses in her dishes. 

This loan will be used to purchase rice, meat, fish and other groceries to prepare her dishes. She has been in the communal bank group for a year and a half and she likes it because the requirements are not too complicated. Her goals are to have her own house since she lives with relatives.

loans.use: to purchase rice, meat, fish and other groceries.

loans.name: Nestor Andres

texts.es: Andes es un joven de 24 años de edad, el se dedica a la agricultura, Andres vive con sus padres que también se dedican a la agricultura, son 6 años que Andres arrienda terrenos para tener donde sembrar sus productos, Andres es un joven trabajador  que necesita el dinero del crédito para comprar abono y fungicidas para tener sanos sus cultivos y de esta manera tener buenas cosechas, la aspiración de Andres es de aumentar sus ingresos mediante el mejoramiento de sus cultivos, y desea seguir trabajando  en la agricultura para formarse un buen futuro.
texts.en: Andes is a 24-year-old young man who works in agriculture. Andres lives with his parents who also work in agriculture. Andres has been renting land for 6 years to have a place to grow his products. Andres is a hard-working young man who needs the loan money to purchase manure and fungicides to keep his crops healthy and in this way have a good harvest. Andres' aspiration is to increase his income through improving his crops and he wants to continue working in agriculture to create a good future for himself.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fungicides.

loans.name: Cristina Del Carmen

texts.es:
El cantón el Carmen posee una considerable riqueza en flora y fauna, siendo una de las fuentes principales de ingreso el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete, aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Dios Es Amor.
En este lugar vive la señora Cristina, tiene 50 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad, de los cuales uno es fallecido. El marido es comerciante.
Doña Cristina es una mujer muy luchadora y que para ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, ella vende productos de Yanbal, Belcorp  (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). También le ayuda a su marido en un negocio de comida que ellos tienen por más de 25 años, allí atienden  de 8h00 a 18h00 todos los días, ella en el tiempo libre que tiene se dedica a vender sus productos, vende en el restaurante y también vende puerta a puerta, deja a crédito y cobra por semanas, a ella le encanta el comercio ya que así se gana lo suyo.
El crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porla ayuda que le brindan los créditos, sus sueños son mejorar su negocio y mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
The canton of Carmen has a considerable richness of flora and fauna, and growing Barraganete bananas is one of the primary sources of income. Here, the members of the Dios es Amor communal bank group meet every two weeks. 

Cristina lives in this place. She is 50 years old and is in a common-law marriage from which she has four adult children, of whom on has died. Her husband is a businessman. 

Cristina is a very determined woman and in order to help with the household expenses, she works in sales. She sells Yanbal and Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories). She also helps her husband in a food business that they have had for more than 25 years. There, they work from 8:00 to 18:00 every day. In the free time that she has, she works selling her products, she sells in the restaurant and also she sells from door to door. She leaves the items on credit and collects weekly. She loves the sales since, with it, she earns her own income. 

The loan is to purchase perfume, creams, and groceries to prepare the dishes. She is a founding member of the communal bank group and she likes it for the help that the loans offer. Her dreams are to improve her business and improve her economic situation.

loans.use: to purchase perfume, creams and groceries.

loans.name: Jimmy Antonio

texts.es:
El cantón el Carmen posee una considerable riqueza en flora y fauna, siendo una de las fuentes principales de ingreso el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete, aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Dios Es Amor.
En este lugar vive al señor Jimmy,  tiene 30  años de edad, está  soltero y no tiene hijos,  vive con su mamá.
Don Jimmy es un joven muy trabajador que pensando en su futuro se dedica a la agricultura, tiene cultivos de arboles de mandarinas, limón, naranja, además de cultivos de ciclo corto como maíz y maní, el trabaja  en sociedad con su papá quien es el que tiene la finca donde cultivan estos productos,  una vez que esta lista la producción el entrega los productos a comerciantes que llegan hasta el lugar a comprar las frutas. El también le ayuda a la mamá que tiene un comedor por lo cual recibe un sueldo.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar abono y fertilizantes para mantenimiento de sus siembras. En el  Grupo De Crédito tiene un año y está muy agradecido por el apoyo, la apertura  y colaboración del asesor. Sus sueños son tener una finca propia.
texts.en:
The canton of Carmen has a considerable richness of flora and fauna, and growing Barraganete bananas is one of the primary sources of income. Here, the members of the Dios es Amor communal bank group meet every two weeks. 

Jimmy lives in this place. He is 30 years old, single and doesn't have any children, and lives with his mother.

Jimmy is a very hard-working young man who, thinking of his future, works in agriculture. He has mandarin, lemon and orange trees, and also he has crops with a short season such as corn and peanuts. He works with his father who is the one who has the farm where they grow these products. Once the products are ready, they sell the crops to the vendors who come to the place to purchase the fruits. He also helps his mother who has a restaurant, for which he doesn't earn wages.  

This new loan will be used to purchase manure and fertilizer to maintain his crops. He has been in the communal bank group for a year and is very grateful for the help, the opening and the support of the adviser. His dreams are to have his own farm.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Eda De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La vida ha llevado a Eda pasar por un sin número de trabajos que le han servido para salir adelante sola con sus cuatro hijos. Esta mujer de 54 años de edad trabajó primero vendiendo ropa y calzado, al mismo tiempo que trabajaba en un colegio capitalino. Luego al salir de ambos trabajos, decidió invertir su liquidación en un nuevo negocio, en una pulpería, que le ha beneficiado por tres años. 
Al pasar lo años, Eda se siente orgullosa de ver cómo sus hijos se ha ido independizando. Ahora solo vive con su hijo menor de catorce años de edad, quien la apoya en su pequeño negocio, que tanto sueña con verlo crecer más. Por esta razón es que Eda solicita un préstamo para comprar café, verduras, shampoo, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, entre otra mercadería que tanto se necesita en las casas de los nicaragüenses. Esto le ayudará a sus ventas se eleven y sus ingresos incrementen. En un futuro considera mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Life has brought Eda to go through a countless number of jobs that have served her to get ahead alone with her four children. This woman, age 54, worked first selling clothing and shoes at the same time that she worked in a school in the capital. Later, when she left both jobs, she decided to invest her cash in a new business, in a grocery store, which has benefited her for three years. 

As the years go by, Eda feels proud to see how her children have become independent. Now she only lives with her youngest son, 14 years old, who helps her with her little business, which she dreams so much of seeing grow more.  For this reason, Eda asks for a loan to purchase coffee, vegetables, shampoo, rice, sugar, beans, and other merchandise that is so needed in Nicaraguan households. This will help her raise her sales and her income will increase. In the future, she is thinking of improving the infrastructure of her house.

loans.use: to purchase coffee, vegetables, shampoo, rice, sugar, beans, and more.

loans.name: Abida Bibi

texts.en:
Abida bibi is a 48-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and eight children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for seven years. He is the only one responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Abida bibi's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories, e.g. pieces of clothes, laces, needles and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints he is not in a suitable condition to buy the above items for his business. Therefore Abida bibi has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount she will financially assist her husband to purchase the above tailoring accessories, so that he can earn more a profitable income.

Abida bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance

loans.use: to purchase tailoring accessories for her husband's business.

loans.name: Ritchelle

texts.en:
Ritchelle is a 28-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Ormoc, Leyte. For more than two years now, Ritchelle has been engaged in the hog-raising business. This is her main source of income. Ritchelle is asking to take a loan to buy more piglets and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her business, thus augmenting her profit and income. 

Ritchelle dreams of expanding her business and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and animal feed.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin es un joven que se esta esforzando por poder ser un profesional útil, no solo a si mismo, sino también a la sociedad, el comenta que su préstamo anterior le fue muy útil para poder pagar las cuotas de su curso de refrigeración.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar una computadora lo que le permitirá poder cumplir con los trabajos de su universidad, y así poder seguir luchando por ser un profesional exitoso.
texts.en: Martin is a young person striving to be a useful professional, not only for himself, but for society as well.  He commented that his previous loan was very helpful in allowing him to pay for a refrigeration course.  He is now requesting a new loan to buy a computer, which will allow him to do his university work and continue fighting to be a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Chrotilde

texts.en:
Chrotilde is 47 years old. She is married and has four children between 5 and 12, they all go to school. 

She is a farmer and she has been producing rice for 13 years, while her husband is a businessman. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers and pay her workers. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to grow rice to sell.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 53 years old. He is married and has seven children between 4 and 25 years. They all go to school. 

He has farmed for 22 years; also his wife is a farmer. With the Kiva loan, he would like to buy fertilizers to grow rice and to pay his workers. The profits from the business will be used to buy cattle for rearing and improve his business.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to grow rice and to pay his workers.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 49 years old. He is married and has four children between 2 and 10 years old. Three of them go to school. 

He has farmed for 20 years, while his wife is also a farmer. With the Kiva loan, he would like to buy fertilizers to grow rice and to sell it. The profits from the business will be used to improve his standard of living and pay his workers.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to grow rice and to sell it.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is sari-sari or general store owner from Ormoc, Leyte. She is 33 years old, married and has three children. 

Sharon has operated her sari-sari store for more than two years now. This is the source of her income. 

Sharon is asking to take a loan to buy more stocks such as soap and detergents, bread and biscuits, coffee, sugar, cooking oil and vinegar, seasonings, sanitary napkins and others. This loan will enable Sharon to improve her inventories thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. Sharon dreams of improving her way of living and saving money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more stocks such as soap and detergents, bread and biscuits, coffee, sugar, cooking oil and vinegar, seasonings, sanitary napkins and others.

loans.name: Mukadder

texts.en:
Mukadder is a married mother of three. For many years she has contributed to her family's budget by making mantı (Turkish ravioli) at home. With her income she put her three children through school and secured their employment. 

She plans on buying ingredients for mantı with the loan, thus increasing her family's income.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Mukadder hanım evli üç çocuk annesi.  Evde mantı yaparak aile bütçesine uzun yıllardır katkı sağlamış.  Çocuklarını okutmuş ve iş sahibi olmalarına imkan sağlamış.  Aldığı kredi ile mantı malzemesi alarak, üretip satmayı planlıyor.  Ve karşılığında para kazanmak istiyor aile ekonomisine katkıda bulunmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for mantı.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks like bread and biscuits, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, canned goods, rice, cooking oil and condiments among others.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca trabaja como empleada doméstica y los fines de semana  vende carteras, colonias y cremas a cuotas, a la par que trabaja también está estudiando la carrera de kinesiología y fisioterapia.
Ella  vive  con su madre, y dice que sus metas futuras son la de recibirse como profesional, trabajar en lo que es su profesión.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos de sus útiles en la universidad. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir sus metas.
texts.en:
Francisca is a domestic worker, and on the weekends she sells purses, colognes and body lotions.  While she is working, she is also studying kinesiology and physiotherapy.  

She lives with her mother, and says that her future goals are to become a professional and work in her profession.   She is requesting a loan to be able to cover the cost of supplies for the university.  She is thankful for the opportunity to continue pursuing her goals.

loans.use: to buy supplies for university.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.es:
Fatima es estudiante de la carrera Ciencias Contables, vive con sus padres, desea terminar su carrera para un mejor ingreso, tanto para ella como para su familia, resalta que de aquí en cuatro años se ve ejerciendo su carrera como profesional  y poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Fatima está luchando por ser alguien en la vida. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar la cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir costeando sus estudios.
texts.en:
Fatima is studying for an accounting degree.  She lives with her parents.  She wishes to finish her degree in order to get better earnings for herself and for her family.  She points out that in four years she will be seen practicing her career as a professional, and she will be able to help her loved ones.

Fatima is struggling to be someone in this life.  She is requesting this loan in order to be able to make her educational payments.  This way she will be able to continue paying for her education.

loans.use: to make university payments.

loans.name: Ah Hpaung Gyi Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located in Ah Hpaung Gyi Village, Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. In this community, five CBO (community based organization) members oversee a group of 23 village customers (20 male and 3 female). This loan will help some group members purchase ducks that will boost the community's income from more duck eggs. The remaining group members will use the funds to purchase high-quality feeds such as duck food and packets of shrimp (costing $25 a week for 100 ducks).
 
Ah Hpaung Gyi village has a population of over five hundred, many of whom focus on farming. The village relies on duck raising for income and pigs for savings. Besides livestock raising, some households also annually plant fruits such as bananas and coconuts, and centrally located villagers have small grocery shops in front of their houses.

Pictured above are the CBO members from Ah Hpaung Gyi Village Group named, Zaw, Hla, Win, Htay and Htun.  Zaw, second from right in the picture, is 45 years old and married with one son, who is a secondary student. Zaw farms his two-acre crop farm and looks after his ducks. For additional income, his wife has a opened dry food store, and she also takes care of household affairs. 

With Proximity's loan, Zaw will purchase high-quality feeds that will boost his small family's income from nourished duck eggs. Part of the proceeds will help Zaw's family fund his son's increasingly expensive education.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks and high-quality feeds.

loans.name: Sevgi

texts.en:
Sevgi lives with her two children. To provide for her family, she makes booties and does tatting work on towels as well as selling underwear. 

She’ll use the loan to buy underwear, pajamas and towels. She plans to earn money from her sales. She wants to provide a good future for her children.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Sevgi hanım iki çocuğu ile beraber yaşamakta.  Ailenin ihtiyaçlarını sağlamak için evden patik, yazma, yazma oyası, havlu ve iç çamaşırı satıyor.  Aldığı kredi ile iç çamaşırı, pijama, havlu aldı.  Satışlarını yaparak para kazanmak istiyor. Çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek sağlamak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy underwear, pajamas and towels.

loans.name: Jafet

texts.es:
Jafet es de la ciudad de Caacupé, es un joven que se está esforzando, viene de una familia humilde, y trabajadora, se encuentra trabajando con pacientes en forma particular atendiendo a pacientes en estado de internación en hospitales ya que está estudiando la carrera de enfermería.
Él quiere ser un profesional útil para la sociedad y también para su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Jafet is from the city of Caacupé, and he is a young person who is striving.  He comes from a humble and hardworking family.  He is working with patients, particularly those admitted to the hospital, as he is studying for a career in nursing.  

He wants to be  professional that is useful to society and also to his family.  He is requesting the loan to invest it in university fees so that he may continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
Marco es estudiante de la carrera de Derecho, es soltero vive con sus abuelos, es militar en ejercicio, su anhelo es terminar su carrera y ejercer la misma. También seguir trabajando como militar.
Es una persona que se está esforzando por poder crecer y mejorar cada día como persona y como profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad y poder seguir luchando por sus metas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Marco is a student of Law. He is single and lives with his grandparents. He is a solder in the army. His goal is to finish his studies and work in his profession. He also wants to continue to be in the army. He is a person who is striving to be able to grow and improve each day as a person and as a professional. He is requesting this loan to be able to p[ay his university tuition and continue to struggle towards his goals as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay to defend her thesis.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Con una sonrisa honesta recibe en su tienda de ropa doña Alba a todos sus clientes. Es una mujer de sesenta y dos años, que busca como superarse cada día, su única meta es poder hacer crecer su negocio hasta donde pueda. Apoyada por su esposo, inició haciendo costuras en su vecindario, luego poco a poco compro ropa, cosméticos, shampoo y otros productos de uso personal. 
La demanda de los clientes ha aumentado en el negocio de Alba, razón por la cual solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa que este a la moda, calzado, accesorios, carteras, entre otros, entre otros productos con la ayuda de Kiva a través de MiCrédito para poder surtir su tienda y con esto crecer satisfactoriamente. En un futuro ella planea comprar una moto taxi y así poder ofrecer su mercancía de manera ambulante.
texts.en:
Doña Alba receives all the clients in her clothing store with a genuine smile.  She is a 62 year old woman who seeks to better herself each day. Her goal is to be able to grow her business as much as possible.  With the help of her husband, she started doing sewing in her neighborhood, and then little by little she bought clothing, cosmetics, shampoo and other personal products.  

Client demand has increased in Alba's business, and for this she is requesting a loan to buy to buy clothing that is fashionable, footwear, accessories, purses and others.  With Kiva's help through MiCrédito she will be able to stock her store and grow satisfactorily.  In the future she plans to buy a moto-taxi and offer her merchandise as a mobile street vendor.

loans.use: to buy clothing that is fashionable, footwear, accessories, purses and others.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes and athletic shoes to sell.

loans.name: Vasfiye

texts.en:
Vasfiye is married and the mother of three children. She sells multi-level marketing cleaning products. She uses the money she makes from this work for her children’s education and weddings. 

She sells products regularly at gatherings at her house. She has ensured her income by establishing a clear and solid customer base. With her third loan from Maya, Vasfiye will order goods wholesale to decrease her costs and earn a higher profit.

loans.use: to buy goods for resale.

loans.name: Taung Kone Village Group

texts.en:
Taung Kone Village in Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region has over 700 households and an estimated population of over 4,000 residents. In this community, there are 27 village members, overseen by five CBO (Community Based Organisations). 

This loan will help some of the members to purchase both ducks and ducklings, which will boost incomes by increasing duck egg production. The remaining members will use the funds to purchase high quality feed. 

Besides duck raising, Taung Kone Village focuses on crop farming of rice paddy and seasonal vegetables. Villagers raise other livestock, such as pigs, which are used as a source for saving money.

Pictured above are the CBO members from Taung Kone, named Tin, Win, Khin, Thu and Phoe. Tin (middle of the photo) is 27 years old and married with one child. Her husband has taken responsibility of looking after the ducks and the family also plants seasonal foods that Tin sells in the town market, one hour from the village. Proximity's loan will help Tin's family purchase more ducks, which will boost the family's income. As cash flow is tight in Taung Kone, duck raising is especially critical because duck eggs increase cash flow, allowing families like Tin's to live better.

loans.use: to purchase more ducks and high quality feed.

loans.name: Nancy's Group

texts.en:
Nancy is a group leader, representing her group of nine farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She is married and has four children. She is known in her community as a very hardworking individual.

Nancy joined One Acre Fund in 2010 because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since she joined the program, her life has improved, especially because she has been able to consistently feed her family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Nancy plans to send her children to school.

Among the nine farmers in Nancy's Group, a total of 4.5 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer purchased with the loan. In addition, six of the farmers in the group will be purchasing solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Marisela Concepcion

texts.es:
Marisela es una joven de 24 años de edad, humilde, estudiosa y con muchas ganas de superarse. Ella cursa el último año de la carrera de ingeniería telemática. Impulsada por su padre quien se dedica a ser chofer de buses y su  tía que es enfermera, ha logrado mantenerse firme aun cuando ha tenido tiempos difíciles. Ella decidió estudiar esta innovadora licenciatura porque le apasiona la tecnología y los avances que esta tiene.
Ahora que ella está a solo un paso de egresar de la carrera, está a punto de iniciar a trabajar en su tesis, por lo que necesita de las herramientas para lograrla. Por esta razón solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora portátil, la cual es vital para su desempeño académico. Ella espera ver realizado su sueño de salir de la universidad como una profesional de éxito, que pueda insertarse en el ambiente laboral para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, asimismo contribuyendo al desarrollo de Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Marisela is a 24 year old youth. She is humble, studious and has a lot of desire to excel. She is in her last year of Data Transmission Engineering. Driven by her father who is a bus driver and her aunt who is a nurse she has held firm even when she has had difficult periods.

She decided to study this innovative degree because she is passionate about technology and it's advances. Now she is one step away from entering into her field and she is ready to start work on her thesis and for this she needs tools to succeed.

For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy a laptop which is vital for her academic development. She hopes to fulfill her dream of graduating from university as a successful professional and be able to insert herself in the labor market to improve her quality of living and that of her family, as well as contributing to the development of Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 39 years old. He is married with three children aged between 5 and 13; they all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been producing for 11 years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers and to pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to buy cattle.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and to pay workers.

loans.name: Eunice's Group

texts.en:
Eunice is 57 years old and has 10 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Eunice has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Eunice also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Eunice's Group will be able to receive a total of 12 solar lights as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Mirian

texts.en: Mirian is 48 years old and she has two children. Mirian is divorced and she works as physiotherapist from Wednesday to Sunday The clinic where she works is far away so she has to spend a lot of money to get there. Mirian has had an emergency and she needs a loan to buy school items for her daughter. She hopes you can help her. Mirian will do anything to help her family.

loans.use: to buy school items for her daughter.

loans.name: Linet's Group

texts.en:
Linet, pictured above, has 5 children and is always described as a very reliable person, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Linet is representing her group of 8 farmers in Webuye District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Linet has been a farmer for 17 years and, in order to earn enough to send her children to school, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Linet is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 3.75 acres will be planted by Linet's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Joshua's Group

texts.en:
Joshua is a 52-year-old proud father of 8 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 15 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Joshua has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Joshua described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Joshua’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 14 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Marte

texts.en:
In the photograph are Marte and her husband, Ndoc, for whom she is requesting this loan. Ndoc has been running a motorcar business to transport building materials upon the request from households who build; he also then, transports inert waste from there to the waste landfill. He was doing okay until he was caught with an expired license that was taken way. Ndoc now wants to replace the motorcar and renew the license and this is the reason for this loan. 

Marte and Ndoc are parents of four children and both Marte and Ndoc are in their 40s. The children range in age from 16 to 24 years old, with the oldest working in a local restaurant as a waiter for a pay of $150/month. Thus, their family of six receives only two incomes: that of Ndoc and the one from the son.

loans.use: to replace the old motorcar that her husband uses for his transport business and to renew his license.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is a member of the ethnic vulnerable community of Egyptian Albanians. He is 47 and a father to his 22-year-old son. For six years, he has been selling frames and flower vases in the market in the city of Korca, where a majority of his community people have been residing for generations. They mostly live in suburbia and basements of apartment buildings. While Romeo does the selling, his wife works as a janitor in a nearby hotel. 

The city of Korca is known for its first Albanian beer and first ABC school. The region is known for the rich cuisine as well. Since the weather is very cold with heavy snow, heavy protein meals cooked with dried meat and dried beans are what they consume throughout the winter time in order to keep them full and warm all day. 

The loan that Romeo is requesting from you will be used to stock up on his inventory items to resell.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory items that he sells such as frames and flower vases.

loans.name: Nohad

texts.en:
Nohad is a 50-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and five children. She states that she works resolutely to provide her family with the bare minimum needs of life. 

For the past nine years, she has worked at her domicile making scrumptious bread to sell. And now, Nohad is applying for a loan through Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy more ingredients to continue production. In the future, she plans to apply for additional Kiva loans to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make bread

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 35 years old. He is married with one child who is 3 years old. He has farmed for 6 years, while his wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva,he would like to buy fertilizers so he can grow and sell rice. The profits from the business will be used to improve his standards of living.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to grow and sell rice.

loans.name: Yacentha

texts.en:
Yacentha is 52 years old. She is married with six children aged between 13 and 21; they all go to school. She is a farmer and has been a producer for 23 years. Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers and pay her workers. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to improve her business by as much as 95%

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay her workers.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 29 years old. He is not married. He is a farmer and he has been in business for 7 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who cultivate his rice fields. The profits from the business will be used to improve his standards of living and to build a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers and pay for her workers. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living.

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney is 52 years old and married with seven children aged between 14 and 22. They all go to school. He has farmed for 30 years.

He will use the loan to buy fertilizers for growing rice, and then he will sell the rice. The profits from the business will be used to pay for his workers and improve his standards of living.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow rice

loans.name: Aimable

texts.en:
Aimable is 36 years old. He is married with two children aged one and four years old. Neither children are in school yet. He has farmed for 17 years, while his wife is a businesswoman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers so he can grow and sell rice. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to grow and sell rice.

loans.name: Joel's Group

texts.en:
Joel's Group is formed by nine farmers in Webuye District and is being represented by Joel, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 32 years old, is married and has two children. Joel has been a farmer for three years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Joel isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2013, and has since noticed that his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has learned a lot from farm training since joining. 

This year, Joel will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition, since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Joel's Group will purchase a total of three solar lights and use the farming supplies received to plant a total of 4.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer in order to improve the maize harvest.

loans.name: Vangjel

texts.en:
Vangjel is a father of three, and they live in a village where he has been running a grocery store for the past 15 years. The reason he is applying for this loan is that he wants to buy inventory for the store. 

In addition to the store, he has a dairy cow, as well, and sells about 10 liters of raw milk to a nearby dairy farm at a price of 40 cents/liter; thus, he makes about $4/day for nine months/year. 

His family has about 11 dynym of agricultural land where they plant mostly potatoes and sell them, and they also plant feed for his animals such as fodder, corn and beets.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory for his grocery store

loans.name: Ratna Sari Group

texts.en:
Ni Putu and all members of Ratna Sari Group made their loan payment on time. With the full support of her husband, Ni Putu sold her pigs and earned a satisfactory profit. She sold two pigs with an average weight of 100 kg. The price per kg is 29,000 IDR. After deducting all expenses, she can save 1,500,000 IDR and will use it for her children's school needs. 

All members feel happy and have decided to continue their loan. As the goal of MUK and the group is to bring the members success, three members decided to resign when they had enough profit to continue the business with their own capital. They are grateful to the lenders, Kiva and MUK because they assisted in the improvement of their lives.

With their new loan, the Ratna Sari Group will develop their pig businesses by purchasing piglets, sows, and feed or by renovating the cages. Ni Putu will use her portion of the loan to purchase superior piglets, feed and vitamins. She wants to ensure the best growth for her piglets. She hopes in the next six months, the pigs will grow fat and healthy, with no diseases, and she can sell them in a high price. 

She wants to develop her savings and use it for business capital later.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Didas

texts.en:
Didas is 51 years old. He is married with four children aged between 12 and 23 years. They all go school. He is a farmer and has been in a business for 28 years. His wife is also a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers and to pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees of his children and to build a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay workers.

texts.en:

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is from Armavir, where she lives with her husband and two children. Her husband is an army officer and her daughter is a hairdresser. Anna herself is a doctor, working at local medical clinic in Armavir. Anna also provides individual medical services to local people by visiting their houses. 

To be able to purchase a laptop and printer needed for the medical clinic, Anna has applied for this loan. Her loan has been approved within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

Anna hopes for lenders' support as it will help to increase work efficiency and will greatly support Anna's work in the clinic.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop and printer needed for the medical clinic.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Cuarenta años de gran progreso siendo agricultor, son los que ha tenido Alberto en su siembra de maíz, trigo y frijol. Su última cosecha le trajo muy buenos ingresos en su hogar, por lo que él expresa lo agradecido con MiCrédito, KIVA y con todas las personas que le apoyaron con su primer préstamo, con el cual pudo comprar semillas de frijol y todo lo necesario para la siembra de maíz y trigo.
Para Alberto este gran avance en su trabajo como agricultor, lo llevó a seguir invirtiendo para esta próxima cosecha. Por esta razón solicitó un nuevo préstamo para comprar semilla de frijol y alambre para cerrar su finca. Esto permitirá tener una siembra exitosa y podrá asegurar más su negocio. Al cancelar de pagar este crédito piensa solicitar uno nuevamente para comprar dos vaquillas.
texts.en:
Alberto has experienced forty years of significant progress as a farmer with his fields of corn, wheat and beans. 

The last harvest brought very good income to his home, and he would like to express his gratitude to MiCrédito, Kiva, and all those who assisted him with his first loan, which allowed him to buy bean seeds and all necessary supplies to plant the corn and wheat.

This success has encouraged him to invest for the next crop production. He has requested a new loan to buy bean seeds, as well as wire to fence his farm in order to protect the crops and better secure his business.

After he's paid off this loan, Alberto plans to request another one to buy two heifers.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds and fence wire.

loans.name: Canan

texts.en:
Canan is 33 years old and has one child. She sells multi-level marketing products, a job she began with her mother’s support. She and her child used and liked the products, so she decided to sell them.  

After joining the company, she began selling products to her family and then close friends, earning income. With this loan, she will buy goods for resale.  Canan hopes to ensure a good future for her child.

loans.use: to buy goods for resale.

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.en:
Judith, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 11 farmers in Webuye District. She is 45 years old, is married and has seven children.

Judith likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012, and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Judith plans to use the profits from this coming season to buy a cow.

In total, Judith’s Group will receive farm supplies to cultivate 5.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kenneth's Group

texts.en:
Kenneth is 41 years old and has ten children. He is a group leader and is representing his group, formed by 15 farmers, in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Kenneth has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods and, although he described his last harvest as excellent, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Kenneth also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Kenneth's Group will be able to receive a total of six solar lights, as well as farming supplies to plant a total of 9.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jani

texts.en:
Jani is seeking your financial help to pay for his youngest son’s culinary schooling fees. 

Jani is 54 years old and has two children; the oldest son is helping out with the livestock that has been the activity that Jani and his family have been practicing for years now as the only source of income for his family. All in all, he's got three dairy cows, 35 goats and 30 sheep; he sells baby animals and also raw milk and other dairy products to the local market in the city of Elbasan, not far from his village.

loans.use: to pay for his son's culinary school fees

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.en: Muzaffar is 33 and lives with his family in the Spitamen district. He is married and is the father of two children. He is an active and responsible person. When he was 23, he learned how to raise livestock and helped his parents with their work. Muzaffar believes that he has experience and it is time to start a business. He wants to buy a few young calves and raise them. He applied for a loan because he does not have enough money. In the future, Muzaffar is planning to expand his business and increase his number of livestock. Muzaffar needs support. Help him achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy a few young calves and expand his business

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad, a single Lebanese man, lives independently. He owns a store where he sells used metallic tools and equipment. He has been involved in such type of business since many years ago.

Currently, and since Mohamad is in need to enhance his way of living by increasing his profits, he is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. He states that at the time when he receives the funds, he will purchase a steady winch, which he will be using to move the items easily and safely.

Mohamad intends to have more improvement in his occupation, and he states that he will borrow additional Kiva loans to attain his goals.

loans.use: to purchase a steady winch.

loans.name: Athanase

texts.en:
Athanase is 34 years old. He is married with two children ages 1 and 3; they do not yet go to school. He has been a farmer for 11 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers and pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to buy cattle.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. loans.name: Bardhok

texts.en:
This year, Bardhok has sold 150 kg of olive oil and 700 kg of olives, all from his olive groves. Some months back, he also started working in Montenegro for a pay that varies from 300-500 euros. After his son was killed, he left behind a little daughter who has since been placed in Bardhok's care. All in all, he has to provide for his family of five now, and this is what made him go to the neighbor country to work.

The loan that he is requesting from you will be used to open an irrigation system and with a very small portion, pay some previous debts.

loans.use: to open an irrigation system for watering his olive groves and to pay some debts.

loans.name: Reshit

texts.en: Reshit wants this loan to cover his green house and he is hoping that he will get some consideration from lenders. He is 47 and has two children, 18 and 11. Reshit sells tomatoes and cucumbers in large quantities. This is the primary source of income for the family in addition to about $76/month, the small pension of an elderly parent who lives with them. They are really poor and they try hard to improve their earnings. Reshit says, sighing, "We always find ourselves stuck in this little income that comes out of all that extreme hard labour; we have no other means, to add some more to the daily routine."

loans.use: to cover hisgreenhouse

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 35 years old. He is married with two children ages one and three. He has been farming for thirteen years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer to grow rice. The expected extra profits will be used to buy cattle.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). loans.name: Noong Het 13 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Thoan, 36, is a Thai lady who is married and has two small children ages 15 and 8. They live happily together in a Thai traditional house and rely on cultivating rice and raising pigs and chickens for a living. Mrs. Thoan is a hard-working farmer and has always tried to expand and increase production. She has applied for a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program to buy piglets and hopes to gain a high profit from raising pigs. Despite plenty of difficulties in agriculture such as disease or bad harvest, she believes that with the support of the Program, including financial and non-financial support such as training and consulting, she will overcome the difficulties and succeed in the investment. Mrs. Thoan dreams of a bright future for her children and hopes that her family will have a more abundant life. In the picture, she is the first person on the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 36 years old. He is married with three children between the ages of 1 and 5. They don’t go to school. He is a farmer and he has been producing rice for 15 years. His wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers and pay school fees for his children. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.name: Noviembre Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras (Andrea, Lizeth Ivania y Nazaria) de la etnia miskita que viven en la comunidad de Lamlaya (agua mansa) se localiza a 15 kilómetros de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Es un grupo nuevo que se organizó recientemente con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para accesar a préstamos en Pana Pana y tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios, aumentar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Andrea y Nazaria tienen una pequeña pulpería y Lizeth Ivania elabora artesanía de material de coco y productos del mar como caracoles, conchas. 

Andrea: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer luchadora, con deseos de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, con cualidades de líder. Tiene 44 años de edad, casada con 5 hijos: 4 son mayores de edad y la menor de 19 años estudia cuarto año de su carrera universitaria. Desde hace 10 años estableció una pequeña pulpería en el corredor de su casa de tambo de madera, de esta manera contribuye con los gastos del hogar y estudios de su hija. Solicita su primer financiamiento, con el propósito de diversificar sus productos y vender comida, comprar insumos e ingredientes para elaborar vigoron, frito, maduro con queso, refrescos y chiverías. Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three entrepreneurial women (Andrea, Lizeth Ivania and Nazaria) from the miskito ethnic community who live in the Lamlaya area (which means "gentle waters"), 15 km from Bilwi, in the Puerto Cabezas province. This is a new group which was formed recently with the aim of working in solidarity to access loans from Pana Pana and to have the opportunity to improve their small businesses, increase their earnings and therefore improve their families' quality of life. Andrea and Nazaria have a small grocery store and Lizeth Ivania makes crafts from coconut material and products from the sea such as shells.

Andrea is the coordinator of the solidarity group. She is a determined woman, with leader qualities and a desire to improve her family's quality of life.
