She is 44 years old and is married with 5 children. Four of her children are now adults, and the youngest one, who is 19, is studying in her fourth year of university. 

Ten years ago she set up a small grocery store in the hall of her home, made of wood and on stilts. In this way she contributes to the household expenses and the costs of her daughter's studies.

She is applying for her first loan, with the aim of diversifying her products and selling food. She wants to buy supplies and ingredients to make vigoron (a traditional Nicaraguan dish), deep fried snacks, plantain with cheese, soft drinks and other snacks. She dreams of being a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients to make vigoron (a traditional Nicaraguan dish), deep fried snacks, plantain with cheese, soft drinks and other snacks.

loans.name: Geyzel Eliette

texts.es:
Movida por su devoción de servir a los demás, Geysel de 23 años de edad, decidió estudiar enfermería. Actualmente cursa tercer año de la carrera. Ser mamá soltera de una bebe menor de un año, le llevo a estudiar los sábados y trabajar de lunes a viernes, sin embargo ella pone todo su esfuerzo para salir adelante y ser el orgullo de su hija. Apoyada por su mamá y hermanos, esta joven luchadora va abriéndose paso en la vida. 
Geysel está en un momento donde su carrera le demanda tener una computadora portátil, además que le facilita trabajar debido a todas sus responsabilidades como madre y sustento de su hogar. Es por eso que ella solicita un crédito para comprar este artefacto tecnológico y así poder acercarse más a su meta. En un futuro ella se ve trabajando en los hospitales de salud pública, brindando sus servicios de manera solidaria a quien los necesite.
texts.en:
Motivated by her desire to serve others, Geysel who is 23 years old, decided to study nursing. She is now in her 3rd year of her program. Being a single mother of a child not yet one year old, she studies on Saturdays and works from Monday to Friday. However she puts all her efforts into getting ahead and being proud of her daughter. Supported by her mother and siblings, this young fighter is finding her path in life.

Geysel is at the point in her studies that demands having a laptop. It also will make her work easier given all her responsibilities as a mother and provider for the home. For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy this technological tool and be able to get closer to her goal. In the future she will work in the Public Health hospitals, providing her services in solidarity with those that need them.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en:
Augustin is 29 years old. He is a farmer and he has been producing rice for 7 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers and pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to buy a cattle for rearing.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and pay workers

loans.name: Prosper

texts.en:
Prosper is 55 years old. He is married with 5 children between the ages of 7 and 18; they all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been producing rice for 33 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers and pay his children's school fees.The profits from the business will be used to buy a cattle for rearing.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay his children's school fees

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is married, and she lives in La Paz, Boliva. She and her husband not only make military uniforms to earn income, but they've also started to produce police uniforms as well. 

Nelly is 43 years old, while her husband is 69. She has been in this business for 20 years now. Thus, while she has experience, she receives a lot of help from her husband. 

Nelly needs a loan to buy fabric, zippers and buttons to make her military and police uniforms. She hopes you will be able to help. 

Nelly appears with her husband in the picture above.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers, and buttons to make military and police uniforms

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que integran este grupo llamado 8 de diciembre, formado en la ciudad de Villa Elisa, entre amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá conocer su situación de vida y conforme a ello poder ir mejorando su situación de vida.
Francisca es una persona muy luchadora y trabajadora que día a día pone todo de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante, y con ello también poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos dándoles todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones. Francisca prepara todo tipo de comidas, todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy temprano ya que se levanta a preparar sus comidas que después sale a vender de manera ambulante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carnes, condimentos, hortalizas y demás, y con ello poder seguir invirtiendo en su microemprendimiento que le ayuda a su familia.
texts.en:
17 women are members of this group called "8 de Diciembre" ["December 8"], formed in the city of Villa Elisa between friends and neighbors. They are part of a program to eliminate poverty, allowing them to understand their life situation and accordingly to keep improving it.

Francisca is a very tenacious and hardworking person who every day puts in her all to grow and succeed and to help her family and loved ones by giving them everything they need for a good life, without hardship.

Francisca makes all types of food. She starts working everyday very early to prepare meals and then she sells her food on the streets. She is asking for this loan so she can buy vegetables, meats, condiments, and other items, thereby continuing to invest in her small business that helps her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, condiments, and other items.

loans.name: Annah's Group

texts.en:
Annah's Group consists of ten farmers in Webuye District and is being represented by Annah, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 28 years old, is married and has four children. Annah has been a farmer for 12 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Annah isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2012, and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family since joining. 

This year, Annah will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Annah's Group will purchase a total of seven solar lights and use the farming supplies received to plant a total of 4.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is involved in the growing and sale of flowers. He owns an arable piece of land where he grows a large quantity of flowers and then sells them in the wholesale market. Arman lives with his parents, brother and wife in Saratak village. 

He applied for this loan to purchase flower seeds, fertilizer and to hire workers for the cultivation work. This is very important for him to be prepared for spring cultivation season and to gather a good harvest. 

His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for flower seeds, fertilizer and to hire workers for the cultivation work.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives in Gyumri with her parents. She is a young entrepreneur running a small retail business from her house. Anna receives orders of clothing and cosmetics supplies from local people. She is very nice and caring to her customers, so people prefer to purchase supplies from Anna. 

Anna, to be able to cover current orders and to purchase clothing and cosmetics supplies for resale, has applied for this loan. Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for clothing and cosmetics supplies for resale to customers.

loans.name: San Antonio Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Antonio Poty  está en su ciclo número 20  del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo antiguo donde las integrantes se ayudan las unas a las otras para poder dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener. Ellas además integran el programa de eliminación de la pobreza para poder conocer la situación de cada una y poder trabajar por mejorar.
Felicita integra este grupo, es una mujer muy luchadora y trabajadora, comenta que se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace, y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante por su barrio. Felicita todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy temprano ya que se levanta a preparar las comidas que vende y es de esta forma que se gana su vida de una manera digna y honesta.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carnes, condimentos, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo, luchando por mejorar cada día su situación de pobreza.
texts.en:
The communal group San Antonio Poty is in its 29th cycle of the women's committee program. This is an old group in which all the members help each other out to be able to give their families everything they themselves couldn't have. They also work on the "Poverty Stoplight" program to understand the situation of each member and work to improve it.

Felicita is a member of this group. She is a fighter and hard worker.

She comments to us that she dedicates herself to preparing homemade meals and then goes out into her neighborhood to sell them on foot. Every day Felicita wakes up early to start making the meals she will sell; this is how she makes an honest and dignified living.

She is requesting this loan to buy various ingredients to prepare her meals, like vegetables, meat, condiments and other, so she can continue her work, fighting her way out of poverty every day.

loans.use: buy vegetables, meat, condiments and other.

loans.name: Jotham's Group

texts.en:
Jotham is 69 years old and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual. As a group leader, he is representing his group in Webuye District, formed by 16 farmers, including himself.

Jotham has been a farmer for more than 40 years, and has worked with One Acre Fund for a while now, having joined for the first time in 2009, because he wanted to earn enough money to send his children to school. 

Not only will he get maize seeds and fertilizer with his loan, but also a solar light in order to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. He decided that he will use the profits he gains from this year’s harvest to send his children to school.

With this loan, Jotham’s Group will receive a total of nine solar lights, as well as farming supplies to plant a total of 9.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Ngan-Gnuni  Nyon-Guma Group

texts.en:
Arishetu is 50 years old and has five children. She is a member of a shea nut processing women's group from Nyon-Gumah in the northern region of Ghana. She is raising her hand up among the members who are squatting in their photo. Their group is called “Ngan-Gnuni-Nyon-Guma.”

Arishetu and her colleagues are in the business of processing shea nuts into shea butter. They have been in the business for the past 30 years. They process high premium shea butter, some of which is sold to aggregaters and exported to the European and USA markets. Arishetu sells the butter to many other customers in northern Ghana. The group is therefore requesting a loan of 6,300 GHS. Arishetu’s share of the loan would be used to buy shea nuts for her to process more shea butter.

Arishetu is able to buy school uniforms and prepare good food for her children due to the increased income from her previous loan. She hopes to keep supporting her family with providing regular food to eat, buying educational materials for the children and repaying this loan.

loans.use: to buy shea nuts for her to process more shea butter.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi est une mère de trois enfants et âgée 39 ans. C’est une femme mariée qui travaille dynamiquement pour le bien-être de sa famille et vit à  Zogbedji. Akouvi vend des friperies dans les marchés et parcoure les quartiers pour satisfaire ses clients. Pour disposer de ses articles en permanence, Akouvi s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché de Hédzanawoé. Akouvi demande ce crédit pour commander ses vêtements et augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en: Akouvi is 39 years old and the mother of three. She is married and works tirelessly for the well-being of her family. She lives in Zogbedji. Akoudi sells used clothing at markets and as a street vendor. In order to avoid running out of merchandise, she stocks up three times a month at the Hédzanawoé market. Akouvi is requesting this credit to stock up on used clothing and increase her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy a batch of used clothing.

loans.name: Linet's Group

texts.en:
Linet is 60 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Linet has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Linet decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Linet's Group will be able to receive a total of ten solar lights, as well as farming supplies to plant a total of seven acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Truphena's Group

texts.en:
Truphena is 28 years old and is often described as a very resourceful person. She has three children and is married. As a group leader, Truphena is representing her group of 13 farmers in Webuye District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Truphena's desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming supplies, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to invest in a business.

Truphena and her group will receive a total of 11 solar lights, as well as supplies of maize seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 4.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a stable for his pigs and to buy a sow.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is 26 years old and has six children. She has been a farmer for 12 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Mary is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group, formed by 14 farmers, in Webuye District, Kenya.

Mary started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2009, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family. This year, she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Mary’s Group will receive enough farming supplies to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en: Maria Teresa is 49 years old and lives in West Poblacion, Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte. She has three children, all in school. She work as voluntary day care teacher in their village, with an honorarium of 1,500 PHP monthly. Maria Teresa wants to invest in raising pigs to provide additional income for their family. She applied for a 5,000 PHP loan from Paglaum MPC to buy two sacks of feed and an additional piglet. She hopes that, someday, she can build a pig fence for her pig raising.

loans.use: to buy two sack of feeds and an additional  piglet for her business.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah has had a computer games business for three years, which earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month. Because of the increase in demand in the computer business, Hannah plans to buy additional computers and printers. She joined Paglaum MPC in June 2013, and she is applying for her second cycle loan, in the amount of 10,000 PHP, to purchase two computer printer units. In the future, Hannah can save for emergencies with Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: to purchase two computer printer units.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan, which she use to increase her stock of Jinga Natural Organic juice and to pay for fabrics to be used in making bed sheets to meet the orders of her regular customers. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her, and a good return on her investment will surely fund their everyday needs and support the education of her children. Elizabeth dreams of being the best juice dealer and seamstress in their area. She aims to send all her children to good schools. She prays for a happy and prosperous life. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for Jinga juice to sell to her customers and to buy fabric to be used in making bedsheets.

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ángela es una mujer de semblante fuerte, voz amorosa y con unas manos marcadas por el arduo trabajo que realiza día a día para salir adelante. Ella está muy agradecida con Kiva y MiCrédito quienes le brindaron un primer préstamo con el cual compro maíz, harina, chiltomas, cebollas, tomates, carne, entre otros que son la materia prima para hornear pan y elaborar deliciosos nacatamales que luego vende a los habitantes de su comunidad. Con este  préstamo su negocio se vio fortalecido y su nivel de vida mejoro notablemente. 
Doña Ángela desde muy temprano busca la leña para encender su cocina artesanal y comenzar a producir estos ricos alimentos que no pueden faltar en los hogares nicaragüenses. Ahora ella vuelve a solicitar un préstamo porque necesita abastecerse de los distintos ingredientes como tomate, cebolla, repollo, maíz, ajo, entre otros que utiliza para la preparación de sus deliciosos panes y nacatamales. Ella planea seguir saliendo adelante como una mujer de 56 años de edad, emprendedora y apasionada por su trabajo.
texts.en: Ángela has a stern look, but a soft voice.  Her hands are marked by the difficult work that she has to do day-in and day-out to support herself.  She is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito, she says, because they have provided her with the funds she has needed to buy supplies--maize, flour, chilies, onions, tomatoes, meat, etc.--for building up her food sales business.  She makes bread and delicious nacatamales and sells what she makes to buyers in her neighborhood.  This loan will further strengthen her business and significantly improve her life.  Doña Ángela starts each day early, first gathering the wood she needs to fire her oven, then preparing the delicious food that is common to every Nicaraguan home.  She will use this loan to buy tomatoes, onions, cabbage, maize, garlic and the other supplies she needs to prepare the food she sells.  For the future, this driven, enterprising woman, 56-years old, plans to keep on working and doing her best to get ahead in the world.

loans.use: Comprar tomate, cebolla, repollo, maíz, ajo, entre otros.

loans.name: Lydia's Group

texts.en:
Lydia is 46 years old and has five children. She has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Lydia is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group, formed by nine farmers, in Webuye District, Kenya.

Lydia started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family. This year, she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Lydia’s Group will receive enough farming supplies to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of four solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Chue

texts.en: Until the past few years, Chue’s life has been difficult, precarious and full of hard physical labor. Now that she is a grandmother, it is especially important to her that she contribute to her family. Without her weaving work, her options would be limited. As a prolific hammock weaver, she is able to earn money to help her family and feel independent. With her participation in the Kiva program, she is finding a steady new pace of life. In 2015, she is hoping to be able to contribute more through budgeting and savings – but she already feels very successful!

loans.use: to jumpstart her weaving operations by investing in raw materials in preparation for  busy spring and summer hammock sales. period.

loans.name: Maow

texts.en: Maow is a tenacious worker and a strong matriarch for her family! She is one of the most talented weavers and has built a network of weavers among her extended family, helping to manage their production and quality control. Maow feels responsible for maintaining a strong cushion to support her family and balance out the workload/income. She has her own cell phone and regularly calls in for updates on her next batch of weaving work! Her loan will help her maintain a positive balance throughout the year and keep her income growing.

loans.use: to jumpstart her weaving operations by investing in raw materials in preparation for the busy spring and summer hammock sales period.

loans.name: Adoude

texts.fr: Adoudé est une femme mariée âgée de 55 ans et vit à Attiégou avec ses quatre enfants. Adoude a entrepris une boutique de mercerie pour soutenir son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Adoude s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé. Adoude demande ce financement pour équiper sa  boutique et faire plus de bénéfice. Adoude souhaite devenir la plus grande boutique de mercerie dans son quartier et nécessite ce prêt pour atteindre ses objectifs.
texts.en:
Adoude, age 55, is married with four children. She lives in Attiégou. She opened a notions store to help her husband provide for their family’s needs. 

Adoude buys her stock twice a month at the Grand market of Lomé. 

Adoude is seeking this loan to buy merchandise for her store and bolster her profits. She wants to have the largest notions store in her neighborhood, and she needs this loan to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to buy three bolts of fabric and three boxes of thread.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Mujeres Unidas está en su ciclo número 4° del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en un esta do de pobreza extrema.
Oilda es una de las que integra este grupo, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir en un nivel medio de ingreso, que a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de sus ventas en su despensa quiere ir mejorando. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, que con mucho esfuerzo ha podido montar y desarrollar su modesta despensa y el cual es su modo de mantener a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos varios para poder surtir su negocio con verduras, frutas, carne, leche, pan y otros, de manera a seguir dando a sus clientes lo que piden.
texts.en:
The communal group is called "Mujeres Unidas" (Women United) and is in its fourth cycle of the women's committee program. They are all involved in the "Poverty Stoplight" program and two of the members find themselves under the line of poverty; that is to say, in a state of extreme poverty.

Oilda is a member of this group and in the latest poll that measures poverty, she was at level two; that is to say, a level of mean income that she hopes to improve with hard work and continuous effort through sales at her store. She is a fighter and a hard-working person, who has, with much effort, been able to start and run a modest store that has helped her take care of her loved ones.

She is requesting this loan to buy ingredients to stock her business with vegetables, fruit, meat, milk, bread and other, so she can continue to supply her customers' demands.

loans.use: buy vegetables, fruit, meat, milk, bread and other.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married and has a teen-aged daughter. 

Oksana has owned her own business selling  women's shoes at the market for 15 years. She rents two kiosks and has one hired employee. Oksana has some difficulties because of the bad economic situation in Ukraine. But she doesn't give up and does her best. Oksana is a hard-working and friendly person.

Oksana is asking for a loan of 20 000 UAH to buy women's shoes for the spring season. She hopes to increase the assortment of shoes and have more clients.

loans.use: to buy women's shoes for the spring season

loans.name: Martha Gladys

texts.es:
Martha tiene 47 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en esta comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales principalmente.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, cuenta con más de 8 años de experiencia en el negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus clientes, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más animales como pollos, patos, cuyes, entre otros, para incrementar el stock de su negocio, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio, con esto Martha espera incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender los diversos gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Martha is 47 years old. She is in a relationship and has two children. She and her family live in the Oyotún district, a rural area located in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region of the northern coast of Peru. Life is calm in this community, where people work mainly in agriculture, animal farming and commerce.

Martha raises and sells animals such as chickens, hens, ducks, and turkeys. She has been in business for more than eight years and has good personal and professional references. She works at home.

Martha is requesting a loan to buy more animals such as chickens, ducks, and guinea pigs, and in this way increase her stock. With this investment, she will have a wider variety of animals and her productivity will increase, which will impact positively her business. Martha hopes to be able to fulfill her customers’ demands and increase her income, which will result in better living conditions for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy animals such as chickens, ducks, and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia used her previous loan to make improvements to her apartment which she operates for business. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

Sonia requested another loan for 27,000 PHP, which she will use to pay for the maintenance and repairs needed for the apartment. She can sustain the needs of her family if the apartment is regularly maintained and in good condition.

Sonia is hoping that she can manage possible new business opportunities. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her apartment units and to buy sacks of rice

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Oñondivepa está en su ciclo número 21 del programa de comité de mujeres, cada una pone todo de sí para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Son 17 mujeres muy sacrificadas que quieren dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Tania quien con su esfuerzo y su sacrificio constante está luchando para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas que hace de manera ambulante y con ello tiene los medios con los cuales ayuda a su familia. Se define a sí misma como una persona que lucha y se esfuerza por poder mejorar cada día en todo lo que hace. 
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar remeras, jeans, camisas, pantalones y demás, de manera a poder surtirse y tener mejor variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben de poder ir mejorando en cada emprendimiento que hacen.
texts.en:
This is the 21st round of funding for the Oñondivepa community bank.  Its members, all women, started the group to improve their lives and provide their families with a living that they wouldn't otherwise be able to provide.  
Sra. Tania is one of the group's hard-working members.  She works as a street vendor, selling clothing, to help her family.  She describes herself as someone who struggles and perseveres day-in and day-out, giving everything she has for the good of her family.  She is applying for this loan so that she can stock her business with t-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, etc.  The investment will allow her to provide a wide range of products to her customers.   
All of the group's members are grateful for your help because your loans provide the capital they need to improve and maintain their businesses.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El comité está conformado  por 23 mujeres entusiasmadas por mejorar su calidad de vida, es por ello que se unieron y se ayudan las unas a las otras.
Una de las integrantes es la Señorita Diana,  quien se encuentra muy agradecida y conforme por formar parte del comité,  y de esta forma  puede realizar su actividad de Venta de Comestibles y Cría de Animales para la venta con el apoyo de sus familiares, dichas actividades le ayuda a generar ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para poder hacer comestibles, como ser verduras, condimentos, carne, hortalizas y otros, de manera a seguir luchando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The 23 members of this community bank, all women, hope to build better lives for themselves and their families.  The women are united and committed to supporting one another.  
One of the group's members, Srta. Diana, says that she is grateful to be a part of the group because it has helped her to grow and maintain her family's food sales and livestock businesses.  Earnings from the businesses support her family.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy supplies--vegetables, condiments, meat, etc.--for carrying on her food sales business.  The investment will allow her to continue working for the good of her family.

loans.use: to stock her food sales business.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose tiene 47 años de edad, vive en casa de material rústico con su cónyuge y su menor hija de 15 años de edad en el distrito de Colasay que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y comercio.

El se dedica al cultivo de café, cuenta con 15 años de experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El crédito será utilizado para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, con esto Jose espera ofrecer un producto de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir mejorar su nivel de ventas y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 47 years old. He lives with his wife and his 15-year-old daughter in a house made of rustic materials. They live in Colasay, which is located in the Jaén province, Cajamarca region of the northern mountains of Peru. Locals work in agriculture, animal farming and commerce.

Jose grows coffee. He has worked for 15 years in this business and has good personal and professional references.

He will use the loan to buy fertilizers for the maintenance of his coffee plantations. Jose hopes that this will result in a better product to offer to his customers, and thus in better sales. This will in turn result in better living conditions for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the maintenance of his coffee plantations.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen, 30, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Ruel and they have three children. She manages their household while operating a business selling DVDs. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Helen buys volumes of DVDs which she sells at a low price. Her ability to please people gives her many loyal customers.  She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to buy more DVDs to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Helen hopes to have other sources of income. She dreams of giving all her children a good quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional DVDs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in his business.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is from Melitopol and is married with a grown son, Roman. Natalya works at the local marketplace selling men's and women's clothing. She owns her vending location. Natalya has been in this business for 10 years. 
Natalya is planning to use a loan of 50 000 UAH to buy additional t-shirts, robes, cardigans and lingerie for retail sales. Natalya is hoping that re-stocking her merchandise with a variety of new items will help her diversify her clothing inventory, attracting new customers this spring season and leading to further expansion of her trade in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional t-shirts, robes, cardigans and lingerie for  retail sales.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
Santa Librada está conformado en total por 17 mujeres con aspiraciones, sueños y propósitos por lo cual se esfuerzan y ponen el maximo empeño, ellas son mujeres sacrificadas.Ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder esforzarse para salir adelante.
La Sra. Elva en su última encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, se encontró en el nivel dos, es decir en un nivel medio,  pero que mediante el trabajo está mejorando. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropas, frazadas artesanales, hamacas. Ya tiene varios clientes,  pues sus productos siempre son muy buenos.
Pide este préstamo para poder compra prendas variadas, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo y sacrificio para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The 17 members of the Santa Librada community bank, all women, started their group to support their goals and dreams.  These selfless women work hard for themselves and their families and are part of a program to eliminate poverty here.  The women are united and committed to supporting each other's effort to build better lives. 
Sra. Elva was interviewed for the poverty program and found to be at Level Two, a medium-level of poverty.  Her situation is improving, though, thanks to her retail business.  She sells clothing, bedding, hammocks, etc. and has many customers who value the quality of the products she sells.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy clothing for resale.  The investment will allow her to carry on her business and provide for her family.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Artyom

texts.en:
Artyom is from Kamenka and is married with a newborn son. Artyom owns two land lots. There are two big greenhouses on one lot where he grows tomatoes and cucumbers. Recently, he installed a heating system in them. Last year, Artyom bought a house for his young family. He is planning to construct greenhouses on this new property as well. He also is planning to buy a vehicle for his small farming business. 
Artyom is planning to use 23 000 UAH to buy coal and plastic film to cover greenhouses, to upgrade the irrigation system and to buy new pumps for the heating system because they burst due to freezing cold temperatures.

loans.use: to buy coal and plastic film to cover greenhouses, upgrade the irrigation system and to buy new pumps for the heating system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing materials like nets, hooks, lead weights, outriggers and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Rhodessa Mae

texts.en: Rhodessa Mae is a married mother of three children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has been engaged in the fishing business for more than six years now with her husband. This is the sole source of their income. Rhodessa Mae is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters. A loan will help their fishing business and increase their income. Rhodessa Mae hopes to expand their fishing venture to generate more income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en: Jimmy is a 48-year-old fisherman from Concepcion, Iloilo. He is a married father of two grown-up children. Jimmy has been in the fishing business for more than 15 years now. This is the sole source of his income. Jimmy is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets and a new boat engine. He believes that a loan will help him improve his fishing venture and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and a new boat engine

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan is a fisherman from Concepcion, Iloilo. He is married and has four children, ages 5 to 15. Jonathan has been in the fishing business for more than 15 years now. Jonathan would like a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other equipment. A loan will help him improve his fishing business and increase his income. He wants to save enough money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other equipment.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 49 year old married woman and a mother of two children from San Dionisio, Iloilo. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now. This is the source of their income. 

Gemma is asking for a loan to buy materials -- such as plywood, nails, and paint -- and labor to repair their fishing boat. This loan will help improve their business and raise their income. In the future, she hopes to make their business sustainable and more productive.

loans.use: to repair a fishing boat.

loans.name: Delecia

texts.en:
Delecia is a 53-year old dried fish vendor from San Dionisio, Iloilo. She is married and a mother of three adult children. She has been in this business for almost 30 years.

Delecia needs a loan to buy more fish to dry and sell. The loan will help improve her business and increase her income and profit. She hopes to save money so she can reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock.

loans.name: Julpha

texts.en:
Julpha is 31 years old, married, and has four children. She is a dried fish vendor from San Dionisio, Iloilo. 

Julpha requested a loan, which she will use to buy more fish to dry and sell. She believes that a loan will help improve her fishing business as well as her income. Julpha dreams of expanding her fishing venture in order to generate more revenue. She wants to save money to pay for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish to dry and sell

loans.name: Petrona Del Carmen

texts.es:
Con el sonido de la máquina de coser y distintos tipos de tela en su piso, recibe doña Petrona a sus clientes. Ella es una mujer de sesenta y cuatro años de edad, quien desde hace diez años se dedica a arreglar y confeccionar ropa. Así mismo hace nacatamales y cuenta con su pensión de adulto mayor. En sus inicios vendía enchiladas, tacos y refrescos naturales, además hacia trabajos de costura, actividad que le apasiona desde su juventud. Siempre apoyada por su hija, ha ido creciendo poco a poco.
Esta responsable mujer, desea hacer su negocio más variado, aparte de diseñar ropa quiere establecer una tienda. Es por eso que ella recurre a Kiva a través de MiCrédito para comprar cosméticos, calzado, accesorios, perfumes entre otros productos para poder llevar a cabo su sueño que es tener una tienda con productos de calidad.
texts.en:
With the sound of the sewing machine and different types of fabric around her apartment, Petrona receives her clients. She is 64 years old and for the last 10 years has dedicated herself to repairing and designing clothing. She also makes nacatamales (maize, meat and rice wrapped in a banana leaf) and relies on her senior's pension.

When she started, she sold enchiladas, tacos and refreshments, as well as having her sewing work, which has been her passion since she was young. Always supported by her daughter, she's been able to grow her business little by little.

This responsible woman would like to make her business more varied: apart from designing clothes, she'd like to establish a store. This is why she is requesting a loan from Kiva through MiCrédito to buy cosmetics, shoes, accessories and perfumes, among others, so she can realize her dream of having a store with good quality products.

loans.use: buy cosmetics, shoes, accessories and perfumes, among other products.

loans.name: Zamiri Group

texts.fr: Esperance est commerçante, conseillère de la banque communautaire «Zamiri», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 39 ans, mère 5 enfants tous étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des poissons fumés dans un marché de la ville depuis 14 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en poissons. Elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Esperance, age 39, is a merchant, an advisor to the Zamiri community bank, and a client of the Hekima MFI. She is married with five children who all go to school. 

Esperance has been selling smoked fish at a local market for the past 14 years. She initially launched her business with funds given by her husband. She plans to stock up on fish. 

Her goals are to build a house, support her children’s studies and ensure that they are fed. 

She thanks Hekima for helping entrepreneurs who cannot use the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to stock up on smoked fish to sell.

loans.name: Niva

texts.en:
Niva is a 55-year-old married mother of 3 children from the Philippines. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now.  

Niva is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets and lead weights, as well as materials for the repair of her fishing boat such as plywood, nails, and paints. 

A loan will help Niva and her husband improve their fishing business, thus augmenting their income and profit. In the future, she hopes to make their fishing venture a sustainable one.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and lead weights, as well as materials for the repair of her fishing boat such as plywood, nails, and paints.

loans.name: Makanga Group

texts.en:
Alefa thanks Kiva for the previous loan that she used to buy more goats which helped her to increase her profits. She used the profits to pay school fees for her children and provide them with other basic needs. 

She is requesting another loan to diversify her business as she wants to open a restaurant. 

She hopes to further expand her business and plans to build a better house for her family

loans.use: to diversity her business and open a restaurant

loans.name: Jorlan

texts.en:
Jorlan is a resident of San Dionisio, Iloilo. He makes a living through his motorcycle transport service. He earns additional income as a fisherman. 

Jorlan requested a loan, which he will use to buy more spare parts for the motorcycle such as wheel tire, nuts, bolts, and gasoline. A loan will help him improve his business as well as increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en:
Nieva is a 55-year old married woman and mother of three children from San Dionisio, Iloilo. She earns a living through a fishing business she operates with her husband. This business has been their source of income for the last 20 years.

Nieva needs a loan to buy a new fishing boat. A loan will help them improve their fishing business as well as their income.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is a 44-year-old married mother of 2 children from Iloilo, Philippines. 

Carmela has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now. This is their sole source of income. 

Carmela is requesting a loan to buy a new boat engine. This loan will help Carmela and her husband improve their fishing business as well as their income.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine.

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is a 46-year-old woman living in the town of San Dionisio, Iloilo. She is married and has three children. 

Lani has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now. This is their main source of income. Lani is asking to take out a loan to buy fishing materials like nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters. This loan will help her and her husband to improve their catch and thus give them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Lani dreams of making their business more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters

loans.name: Yo Si Puedo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está integrado por cuatro mujeres emprendedoras (Shanda, Nuvia, María Sanders y María Mercedes). Son mujeres que luchan día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de pulpería y venta de nacatamales. Se organizaron hace 6 meses, con el propósito de tener acceso a créditos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana y así mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida de sus familias. Decidieron nombrar al grupo YO SI PUEDO, porque son mujeres que pueden salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños.

Shanda: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una  mujer amable, vive en Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Tiene 40 años de edad, casada con 6 hijos: tres son mayores de edad, dos independientes y el de 18 años estudia su primer año de carrera universitaria y tres adolescentes que estudian su primaria. Desde hace 3 años estableció  una pequeña pulpería en el corredor de su vivienda de tambo de madera, con el objetivo de contar con su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos. Solicita financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, chiverías. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero y vender productos lácteos, pollo, carne molida.
texts.en:
The four members of this community bank (Shanda, Nuvia, María Sanders and María Mercedes), all women, work hard day-in and day-out to support and grow their small businesses.  They started their group 6 months ago to access loans, guaranteed by Pana Pana, that they will use to fund their businesses and, in turn, increase their incomes and better support their families.  They named their group YO SI PUEDO ["Yes, I Can"] because they are women who know they can succeed and fulfill their dreams.

Shanda is the group's coordinator.  She is a friendly woman, born and raised here in Bilwi, a town in Puerto Cabezas.  She is 40-years old and married with 6 children.  Three of her children are grown, including an 18-year old who is in college now, and the other three are still in elementary and high school.  Shanda cleared a space in her house 3 years ago to start a corner grocery.  She wanted an income of her own and a means of helping with household expenses and paying for her children's educations.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her grocery with basic commodities.  For the future, she wants to expand the range of products she sells and see the business grow.

loans.use: to stock her corner store.

loans.name: Medel

texts.en:
Medel is a 32-year old married woman and mother of two children from San Dionisio, Iloilo. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than seven years. This is the source of their income. 

Medel needs a loan to buy a new fishing boat. This loan will help improve their business and their income. In the future, Medel hopes to make the business sustainable and more profitable. She also wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is a dried fish vendor from San Dionisio, Iloilo in the Philippines. He is 48 years old, married, and has 4 children. 

Ramil has been running his business for more than 20 years now. This is his sole source of income. He would like to take a loan to buy more fish and shrimp to dry and sell at the market. 

Ramil is hopeful that someday he will be able to improve his way of living and live a more comfortable life with his family.

loans.use: to buy more fish and shrimp to dry and sell at the market.

loans.name: Jesie

texts.en:
Jesie is a 48-year-old woman living in the town of San Dionisio, Iloilo. She is married, and has 6 children. 

Jesie is engaged in the fishing business, with her husband, for more than 20 years. This is their main source of income. Jesie is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing boat. This loan will help Jesie and her husband to improve their, catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Jesie dreams of making their business more productive and stable.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat

loans.name: Susa

texts.en:
Susa is a 40-year-old married woman, and a mother of  four children, from San Dionisio, Iloilo. She has been engaged in the fishing business, with her husband, for almost 20 years. Fishing is their main source of income. 

Susa is asking for a loan to buy materials for the repair of their fishing boat, such as plywood and nails, paint and epoxy adhesives, and nylon and bamboo, and also to pay for labor to have the boat fixed. A loan will help them improve their fishing venture, thus augmenting their profit and income. Susa hopes to improve their livelihood in the future. She also wants to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat, such as plywood and nails, paint and epoxy adhesives, and nylon and bamboo, and also to pay for labor to have the boat fixed.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a 56-year-old woman living in the town of San Dionisio, Iloilo. She is married, and has 6 children. 

Teresa is engaged in the fishing business, with her husband, for more than 30 years now. This is their main source of income. Teresa is asking for a loan to buy crab nets and fishing nets. This loan will help Teresa and her husband to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Teresa dreams of making their business more productive and stable.

loans.use: to buy crab nets and fishing nets

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy vegetables, like tomatoes, peppers, onions, cucumber, and others.

loans.name: Dora Jean

texts.en:
Dora Jean is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of San Dionisio, Iloilo. She is married and has 4 children. 

Dora Jean has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 10 years now. This is their main source of income. She is asking to take out a loan to buy a new fishing boat. This loan will help her and her husband to improve their catch and thus give them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Dora Jean dreams of making their business more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of San Dionisio, Iloilo. She is married and has 6 children. 

Lourdes has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 10 years now. This is their main source of income. She is asking to take out a loan to buy a new boat engine. This loan will help her and her husband to improve their catch and thus give them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Lourdes dreams of making their business more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine

loans.name: Rogrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is a 55-year-old fisherman from San Dionisio, Iloilo. He is married and has been in the fishing business for more than twenty years now. Fishing is a very lucrative business in his place. Rodrigo also earns an additional income through his snack food selling business.

Rodrigo is asking to take a loan to buy new fishing nets and gasoline for the boat. A loan will help him improve his business as well his income.

In the future, Rodrigo hopes to make his business more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and gasoline for the boat.

loans.name: Loma Linda Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está conformado por tres mujeres de la etnia miskita (Maura Violeta, Aidaly y Runalina) viven en Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. Maura Violeta tiene una pequeña pulpería en eñ corredor de su vivienda de tambo de madera, Aidaly vende mariscos y bastimestos en las paradas de buses y Runalina vende ropa usada. Son mujeres que  luchan día a día con el propósito de tener acceso a crédito con garantía solidaria con Pana Pana se organizaron hace 6 meses para mejorar su nivel de ingresos y mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias.

Maura Violeta: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer alegre de 26 años de edad, casada con 3 hijos: El mayor de 8 años estudia su cuarto grado de primaria y dos menores de edad. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal como pescador y carpintero. Con el objetivo de contar con su propia fuente de ingresos y aportar con los gastos del hogar desde hace un año estableció una pequeña pulpería. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar: granos básicos, chiverías, gaseosas entre otros productos. Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa.
texts.en:
This group consists of three women from the Miskito ethnic group (Maura Violeta, Aidaly y Runalina). They live in Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. 

Maura Violeta has a small grocery store in the veranda of her wooden house built on stilts. Aidaly sells seafood along with bread and other staple items     at bus stops, and Runalina sells second-hand clothes. They are women who fight day after day and, with the aim of accessing a Pana Pana joint guarantee loan, they set up their group 6 months ago to improve their revenues and improve their standard of living and that of their families.

Maura Violeta is the coordinator of the group, she is a cheerful woman of 26 years of age, married with 3 children: the eldest, who is 8, is in 4th grade in primary school and she has two younger children. Her husband does informal work as a fisherman and carpenter. 

With the aim of having her own source of income and contributing to the household costs she set up a small grocery store a year ago. She is asking for financing to buy: staple foods, dairy products, fizzy drinks and other products. She dreams of becoming a successful shopkeeper.

loans.use: to buy staple foods, dairy products, fizzy drinks and other products

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is a sari-sari store owner form San Dionisio, Iloilo. She is 43 years old, married, and has five children. Maria Fe has been in the business for more than five years now.

Maria Fe is requesting to take a loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, rice, bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries, among other items. This loan will enable her to improve her inventory, thus attracting more buyers in her store.

In the future, Maria Fe dreams of making her sari-sari store business more sustainable and productive. She also wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, rice, bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries, among other items.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a dried fish vendor from San Dionisio, Iloilo. She is 58 years old, married, and has two children. Helen has been in the business for more than twenty years now. Her husband is a fisherman.

Helen is asking to take a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, outriggers, and plywood. A loan will be of a great help for Helen and her husband, thus allowing them to improve their fishing business as well as their income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, outriggers, and plywood.

loans.name: Adeline Group

texts.fr: Shabani est une commerçante, trésorière du groupe solidaire «Adeline», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 34 ans, célibataire responsable. Elle est  propriétaire d’un magasin et vendeuse des souliers hommes dans le centre ville depuis 3 ans. Elle va acheter 20 paires se souliers. Ainsi, elle souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et devenir grossiste. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien  apporté aux femmes entrepreneuses exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Shabani, age 34, is a merchant and client of the Hekima MFI. She is the treasurer of the Adeline group. 

Shabani is a responsible single woman who owns a store downtown where she has been selling men’s footwear for three years. She plans to buy 20 pairs of shoes. She wants to bolster her sales and become a wholesaler.

She thanks Hekima for helping business women who are not given access to the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy 20 pairs of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Adih

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Adih. Adih and his family live in Bogor, a suburban area located about an hour from Jakarta. Adih is married and has six children.

He runs a grocery shop that also sells mobile phone airtime credits. He began working with Ruma because he wanted to try the mobile airtime business. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments, as he sees sales opportunities around his neighborhood.

Adih joined Ruma in 2013, and this is the third time he is asking for a loan from Kiva. The previous loan helped him to process more transactions, especially on weekends when more people come to his shop.

As the business grows, he hopes to get another working capital loan from Kiva. Having known about the importance, Adih will find your loan very useful to help him improve his business and accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services.

In the photo, Adih is the one who is sitting in his grocery shop. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for his community.

loans.name: Mardiyah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Mardiyah. Mardiyah lives in Cibubur, located about a one-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her two children (one son and one daughter). Mardiyah owns a stall where she sells cheap clothes and flip-flops, and provides mobile payment services for her community. She joined Ruma in 2013. She feels happy because she learnt a lot about how to improve her business from Ruma. 

As the business grows, Mardiyah is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Your loan will be very useful to help Mardiyah improve her business, as well as her community, which needs access to such services. Mardiyah is shown in the photo. She will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services to her community

loans.name: Lilybel

texts.en:
Lilybel is a 38-year-old, married woman and a mother of a four-year-old child, from Concepcion, Iloilo. 

She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than ten years now. This is their main source of income. She also operates a small sari-sari store business.  

Lilybel is asking to take a loan to buy new fishing nets and lead weights for fishing. She also wants to buy additional stocks for the store, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, toiletries, condiments, and other items. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and lead weights for fishing.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria vive con sus padres, ella es  sostén tras la separación de sus padres, ella luego de recibir su título de técnico en administración cooperativa.
Ella comenta que su aspiración es llegar a la licenciatura. De aquí a un tiempo se ve en el cargo de gerente de alguna sucursal de la empresa donde está trabajando.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas y comprar sus materiales de estudios.
texts.en: Maria lives with her parents. She provides support after her parents' separation, after receiving her two-year degree in cooperative administration. She says that her dream is to get a four-year degree. For now she is a manager of a branch office of the business where she is working. She is asking for this loan in order to be able to pay her fees and buy her study materials.

loans.use: to pay for university fees and study materials

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 57 years old and married. She lives in Buenavista, Pagadian City. 

For the past ten years, Shirly has been a farmer. She earns PHP 2,000 each month and is a new member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). 

Shirly is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent. She has a business producing school uniforms and carrying out clothing repairs. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive.

She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow her to generate more income and be able to cater to her tailoring services.

loans.use: buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies

location.town: Pagadian - Balangasan District,  Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира, 40 лет, замужем, мама 4 детей. Образование у Замиры- среднее. Она начала заниматься сельским хозяйством в 2004 году. На сегодня в хозяйстве имеет: 3 коровы, 16 овец. Также Замира выращивает клевер для реализации на участке мерою 1,0 Га. Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет до 15,000 сом (KGS). Замира в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров и овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в расширение хозяйства, что позволит Замире дать образование ее детям и расширить сарай.
texts.en:
Zamira is 40 and married with four children. She has a high school education and has been working as a farmer since 2004. She currently has three cows and 16 sheep as well as 1 hectare of land where she grows clover for sale. Her monthly income is about 15,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Zamira has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase cows and sheep. She plans to put profits from the loan into further expanding her farm, which will allow her to pay for her children's education and to expand her barn.

loans.use: to purchase cows and sheep in order to increase her head count of livestock

loans.name: Aidai

texts.ru: Айдай, 29 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. В поиске источника доходов для своей семьи, она с 2004 года стала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе Айдай достигла хороших успехов и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме до 15,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеется 4 коровы, 2 лошади, 6 овец. На участке мерою 5,0 Га, выращивает ячмень, клевер. Айдай обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS), который она направит на покупку коров и овец. Доходы от кредита Айдай планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Aidai is 29 and married with four children. In the search for a source of income for her family, she started working in agriculture and animal husbandry in 2004. Thanks to her hard work and constant effort, she has achieved great success and now receives a monthly income of about 15,000 KGS. She currently has four cows, two horses and six sheep on her farm as well as 5 hectares of land where she grows barley and clover.

Aidai has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS, which she will use to purchase cows and sheep. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy cows and sheep in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella is 57 years old and lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is a widow with six adult age children. She had loved doing her farming activity when her husband was alive. She requested a loan to pay for harrowing their land for seedbed preparation. She has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Estrella hopes to renovate her house to make them more comfortable.

loans.use: to pay for harrowing their land for seedbed preparation

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda has always had the enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated their corn land in Alegria and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the corn field is ready for planting. Luzminda knows that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season. In the future, Luzminda hopes to buy a hauling truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Yessica es una persona que se esta esforzando por poder salir adelante, ella esta estudiando la carrera de nutrición, comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
Ella lucha por poder ser una profesional y por medio de sus estudios poder ayudar a sus familias y a sus seres queridos. Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar nuevamente las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma seguir luchando por sus metas.
texts.en:
Yessica is a person who is working hard to be able to move ahead. She is studying for a nutrition degree. She notes that she used her previous loan to pay school fees, and with it she covered that expense that she had.

She is fighting to be able to be a professional and to be able to help her family and her loved ones by means of her studies. She is asking for this new loan in order to be able to again pay for her school fees, and in that way continue fighting for her goals.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 65 years old, single, and lives in Nangca-an, Rizal, ZDN. She is engaged in gardening and planting a variety of vegetables. Some of her vegetables are ready for harvest, while the other portion of her garden is still cultivated.

Beatriz joined Paglaum MPC because of the benefits offered to their members. Beatriz applied for a loan from Paglaum in the amount of 10,000 PHP to buy fertilizer for her vegetable garden; the remaining amount will be used as starting capital for buying vegetables to deliver to the market.

Beatriz dreams that someday she will see her nephews and niece finish their studies, and that she will have some savings for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Burlay

texts.ru: Бурлай успешно погасила кредит, она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Бурлай имеется: 4 коровы, также имеется 1,0 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает хлопок для реализации. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бурлай обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для закупа удобрений, семян арбузов и перца для посевных работ. Бурлай является лидером группы "Айым", в которой кроме нее состоит еще 3 человека, всего их четверо. Доходы от кредита Бурлай планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса, она планирует построить большой дом для ее семьи.
texts.en:
Burlay successfully paid off her previous loan. She is thankful to Kiva and to everyone who supported her financially. She currently has four cows on her farm as well as 1 hectare of land where she grows cotton for sale. Her total monthly income is 20,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Burlay has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase fertilizer and watermelon and pepper seeds for planting. She is the leader of the Ayim group, which consists of three people besides herself. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business and intends to build a big house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and watermelon and pepper seeds in order to grow organic vegetables

loans.name: Kunduzoi

texts.ru: Кундузой, 37 лет, замужем, 5 детей. Образование средне-специальное, на протяжении многих лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав бизнес с суммы с 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Кундузой в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы, 2 овцы, на участке мерою 1,0 Га она выращивает арбузы. Кундузой обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений и семян для парника.  Кундузой является одной из 4 участников группы "Айым". На полученные доходы от кредита Кундузой планирует и дальше увеличивать ее бизнес и хочет накопить на покупку авто.
texts.en:
Kunduzoi is 37 and married with five children. She has a specialist high school education and has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture for many years, a business she started with 5,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work she currently has four cows and two sheep on her farm as well as 1 hectare of land where she grows watermelon.

Kunduzoi has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 70,000 KGS to purchase fertilizer and seeds for her greenhouse. She is one of four members of the Ayim group. She plans to use profits from the loan to further develop her business and wants to save toward buying a car.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds in order to grow organic produce in her greenhouse

loans.name: Gulaiym

texts.ru: Гулайым успешно погасила свой кредит, она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Гулайым на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы, 15 овец, также имеется 1,0 ГА земельной доли, на которой она выращивает арбузы для реализации.  Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 22,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для закупа семян и удобрений для парника. Гулайым является участником группы "Айым", в которой кроме нее состоит еще 3 человека. Доходы от кредита Гулайым планирует вложить в развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Gulaiym successfully paid off her previous loan. She is thankful to Kiva and to everyone who supported her financially. She currently has four cows and 15 sheep on her farm as well as 1 hectare of land where she grows watermelon for sale. Her total monthly income is about 22,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Gulaiym has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her hothouse. She is a member of the Ayim group along with three other people. She plans to put profits from her loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow organic vegetables in her hothouse

loans.name: Diah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Diah. Diah lives in Cibubur, located about one hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her three children (two sons and one daughters). Diah owns a stall where she sells small snacks and provides mobile payment services for her community, including selling airtime credits. 

She joined Ruma since 2013 and this is the second time she is applying for a loan from Kiva. A previous loan from Kiva helped her to try another business opportunity and she thanks all of the lenders because of it. She told us as well that she feels happy to join Ruma because Ruma always pays attention to improving its agents.

As the business grows, Diah is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Diah improve her business and accordingly serve her community, which needs access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Diah is standing in front of her small stall. She will be thankful for your endless support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile phone services for her community

loans.name: Evi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of the Ruma agents, Evi. Evi lives in Bogor, a suburban area located about an hour from Jakarta. She lives there with her husband.

Evi owns a small stall where she sells soft drinks, snacks, and cell phone accessories, and provides mobile payment services for her community. She joined Ruma because she was interested in expanding her business. Previously, she took a working capital loan from Kiva, and she already paid it back on time.

As the business grows, Evi is hoping to get another loan from Kiva because she sees sales opportunities on weekends, as more customers come to her small stall. Having known about the importance, Evi will find your loan very useful to help her improve her business and accordingly, her community, which needs access to such services.

As seen in the photo, Evi is the one who is standing in her own small stall. She will be thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for her community.

loans.name: Mulyadi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma agents, Mulyadi. Mulyadi and his family live in Bogor, a suburban area located about an hour from Jakarta. Mulyadi is happily married and has two sons. He owns a stall where he provides mobile payment services, including selling airtime credits.
