Mulyadi joined Ruma in 2013, and this is the third time he is asking a loan from Kiva. The previous loan helped him to process more transactions, especially on weekends, when more people come to his shop. 

As the business grows, he hopes to get another working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital for process more mobile payment services on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Mulyadi improve his business and, accordingly, serve his community, which needs access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Mulyadi is the one who is sitting. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for his community

loans.name: Miel Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario esta conformado por tres mujeres luchadoras (Úrsula, Silvia Mercedes y Jiaribeth) de la etnia miskita que viven en Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. Úrsula, Silvia Mercedes tienen una pequeña pulpería en sus viviendas de tambo de madera y Jiaribeth vende nacatamales. Las tres se han propuesto luchar para hacer crecer sus negocios, con el deseo de llegar a tener una mejor calidad de vida personal y de sus familias; se organizaron hace 4 meses para poder acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana.

Con el primer crédito recibido de Pana Pana y financiado por KIVA, les permitió a Usurla y Silvia Mercedes comprar inventario para surtir sus pequeños negocios de granos básicos, leche, detergentes, jabón y otros productos básicos.

Jiaribeth: Es nueva integrante del grupo solidario, es una joven alegre de 20 años de edad, soltera, con deseos de superación y apoyar a su mama en cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar y asegurar la educación de sus hermanos y de ella que estudia su cuarto año de secundaria. Desde hace un año, elabora nacatamales y pan artesanal los fines de semana, los vende en su vivienda de tambo y madera, también los vende de manera ambulante. Esta solicitando su primer crédito para comprar insumos e ingredientes para vender nacatamales y pan artesanal: masa, sal, tomate, hierba buena, papas, pollo, carne de cerdo, zanahoria, levadura, aceite, harina, coco, azúcar entre otros productos.  Ella sueña con establecer una pulpería para aumentar sus ingresos y de esta manera ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
This solidarity group consists of three hard-working women (Ursula, Silvia Mercedes, and Jiaribeth), who belong to the Miskita ethnic group and live in Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. 

Ursula and Silvia Mercedes each have their own small grocery stores in their wooden stilt-houses and Jiaribeth sells nacatamales (steamed corn cakes filled with meat and vegetables, and wrapped in banana leaves). The three women are determined to work hard in order to grow their businesses, with the purpose of improving their quality of life and that of their families. Four months ago, they organized as a group to have access to loans with joint and several guarantee from Pana Pana. 

The first loan—granted by Pana Pana and funded through Kiva—allowed Ursula and Silvia Mercedes to stock up their small grocery businesses with basic grains, milk, detergents, soap, and other basic products.

Jiaribeth is the newest member of the group. She is a cheerful young woman. She is 20 years old, is single, and has the desire to improve herself, to help her mother to cover the basic necessities at home, and to ensure her education and that of her siblings. She is in her fourth year of secondary school. 

She has been making nacatamales and artisanal bread on weekends for a year now. She sells her products at her home and also on the streets. 

She is requesting her first loan to buy ingredients and supplies to make and sell nacatamales and artisanal bread such as dough, salt, tomatoes, mint, potatoes, chicken, pork, carrots, yeast, oil, flour, coconut, and sugar, among other products. 

Her dream is to set up a grocery store to increase her income and, in this way, help her parents to cover the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients to make and sell nacatamales and artisanal bread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a new oven for her house.

loans.name: Gulzhaina

texts.ru: Гулжайна, 49 лет, замужем, 5 детей. У Гулжайны среднее образование, она на протяжении многих лет занимается сельским хозяйством, начав этот бизнес в 1994 году почти с нуля. На сегодняшний день прибыль Гулжайны составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. У нее в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 10 овец, также на земельном наделе мерою 3,0 ГА она выращивает фасоль, она реализует ее оптовым покупателям. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулжайна обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 20 овец и корма для скота. Доходы от кредита Гулжайна планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Gulzhaina is 49 and married with five children. She has a high school education and has been working as a farmer for many years, a business she started in 1994 from almost nothing. Her current income is about 10,000 KGS per month and she has three cows and 10 sheep on her farm as well as 3 hectares of land where she grows beans, which she sells to wholesale buyers. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Gulzhaina has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 120,000 KGS to purchase 20 sheep and livestock feed. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sheep and livestock feed in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Zuniati

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma agents, Zuniati. Zuniati lives in Bogor, a suburban area located about an hour from Jakarta. She lives there with her husband her five other family members. 

She runs a small stall that provides mobile payment services for her community, including selling airtime credits.. This is the second time she is asking a loan from Kiva. The previous loan helped her to expand her business, and she thanks all of the lenders because of it.

As the business grows, Zuniati is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Zuniati improve her business and accordingly serve her community, which needs access to such services.  

As seen in the photo, Zuniati is the one standing. She will be thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for her community.

loans.name: Aishake

texts.ru: Айшаке, 64 года, вдова, воспитала 4 детей. У Айшаке высшее образование, сейчас она на пенсии, но много лет проработала учителем физики. На протяжении 18 лет Айшаке занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 15 овец. На участке мерою 11,0 Га она выращивает фасоль. Благодаря упорному труду Айшаке, ее ежемесячная совокупная прибыль составляет до 20,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь, поэтому Айшаке решила развить ее бизнес и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита позволят ей улучшить благосостояние ее семьи.
texts.en: Aishake is 64 years old, a widow and raised 4 children. Aishake has a college education. She is now retired, but spent many years working as a physics teacher. Aishake has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for 18 years. She has 3 cows and 15 sheep. She also grows beans on 11.0 hectares of land. Thanks to Aishake's hard work, her combined monthly profit amounts to about 20,000 som (KGS), but this money is not enough for a decent life. This is why Aishake decided to develop her business and requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to increase her livestock headcount. The earnings from the loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her income

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma landed at a right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when she went broke after her first business went bad. PMPC came to Emma as a rescue for lending her money when she needed it the most.

Now, she availed herself of another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation.

Emma perseveres and always believes that she will reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is 31 years old and married, from Gaza city. He lives with his wife and three kids in a small house. 

Six years ago, Amer started his own project, a band for folkloric dance called Dabke.  He loves this kind of art, and he is very talented. His band plays at social and cultural events.
 
Amer has taken a USD loan from FATEN.  This loan will help him to get uniforms for his band members.

loans.use: to get uniforms for his band members.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is 23 years old and single, from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a small house. 

Hasan works as an employee in a clothing store, where he gets a limited income.  He wants to improve his family's living conditions and buy all the needed stuff. 

Hasan took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new solar system for heating water, instead of the old one. By taking this loan, Hasan will be able to provide hot water for the house without using electricity.

loans.use: to buy a new solar system for heating water, replacing an old one.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, meats, vegetables, charcoal, and other supplies.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is a 20-year-old single man from a village near Jenin City. He lives with his family in a small house. Adel's father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. Adel wants to improve the family living conditions and buy all the needed stuff.

Adel took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new solar system for heating water and a tank. By taking this loan, Adel will be able to provide hot water for the house without using electricity.

Adel appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new solar system for heating water and a tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new solar system for heating water and a tank.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 62 years old and lives in Alegria, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with 11 adult age children. She has been doing her farming activity with her husband and has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan to buy five sacks of fertilizer for more produce. She has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Gloria wants to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Shuru

texts.ru: Шуру, 57 лет, замужем, есть 4 взрослых детей. У Шуру среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода, она занимается сельским хозяйством. На 1,40 Га собственной земельной доли Шуру с супругом выращивают фасоль. В хозяйстве также есть 2 коровы, 10 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль Шуру составляет до 10,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для увеличение объемов реализации экологически чистого, вкусного молока. Шуру является является лидером группы "Райкан", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их трое. Доходы от кредита Шуру планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение продаж молочных продуктов.
texts.en: Shuru is 57 years old, married and has 4 grown children. Shuru has a secondary education and, to provide the primary income, is involved in agriculture. Shuru and her husband grow beans on 1.40 hectares of their own land. Their farm also contains 2 cows and 10 sheep. Shuru's monthly profit amounts to about 10,000 som (KGS). She requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy a dairy cow in order to increase the sales volumes of ecologically clean, delicious milk. Shuru is the leader of the "Raykan" group that, besides her, consists of two more persons, with three members all together. Shuru plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing the sales of her dairy products.

loans.use: to purchase one cow in order to increase the volume of organic milk sales

loans.name: Wajida Al- Waytat Group

texts.en:
The members of Wajida Al- Waytat Group are five women from Sana'a, Yemen. They know each other through friendship and neighborhood ties. They requested a loan of 230,000 YER from AMB.

Wajida is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of eight children, who lives with this large family in a very small house which consists of only one floor. Wajida's family feels very inconvenienced because the house is not enough for all the members of the family. Her husband has a small shop in the area where he lives and that is the sole source of income for the family. His income is small and not enough to expand the house as well as cover the necessary expenses of the children. Wajida and her husband believe that expanding the house is a very important thing and it is one of their priorities. Therefore, Wajida applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction materials to build a second floor, hoping to expand the house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials in order to expand the house.

loans.name: Julio Andres

texts.es:
Julio es un hombre de 26 años de edad, que a pesar de su corta edad paso por una separación, de su matrimonio quedo un pequeño de 3 años por el cual responde y cada 15 días manda el dinero para su sostenimiento es muy responsable y trabajador.
Julio tiene un campo de cultivo, en anteriores historias siempre se ha recalcado el alto costo de los insumos agrícolas, él es muy joven y esta apenas levantando su negocio y la responsabilidad de mandar dinero a su hijo muchas veces lo deja sin dinero para comprar insumos, esta es la razón por la cual se encentra solicitando un préstamo para comprar insumos de levante como lo son semillas, abonos y riegos, pensando en un futuro tener grandes campos de cultivos suficientes para generar recursos para él y su hijo.
texts.en:
Julio is a 26 year old man who in spite of his young age is separated. He has a small 3 year old son from the marriage for whom he is responsible and to whom he sends money every 15 days. Julio is very responsible and hard-working.

Julio has a field of crops and as in past stories the high cost of agricultural supplies is stressed. He is very young and has only started his business and the responsibility of sending money to his son leaves him without the money to buy supplies. This is the reason that he finds himself requesting a loan to buy growing supplies such as seeds, manure and irrigation. He is thinking in the future of having large fields of crops, big enough to generate resources for him and his son.

loans.use: to buy inputs like seeds.manure and irrigation for his fields. He is a responsible father who send money to support his son.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more goods and food materials for her small shop.

loans.name: Amka Tujenge Group

texts.fr: Badhera est propriétaire d’un cabinet de change de la monnaie dans le centre ville depuis 10 ans, vice présidente du groupe de crédit «Amka Tujenge», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 38 ans, mère de 6 enfants tous vont  à l’école. Elle commença avec de fonds de reçu  de son mari. Elle va acheter la monnaie locale. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Badhera, age 38, is a client of the Hekima MFI and the vice-president of the group Amka Tujenge. She is married with six children who all go to school. 
Ten years ago, she opened a currency exchange office located downtown with funds given by her husband. She plans to use this loan to purchase local currency. 

Her goals are to obtain additional loans, bolster her sales, support her children’s education and ensure that they are fed. 

She thanks Hekima for helping entrepreneurs who are not given access to the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to purchase local currency.

loans.name: Yakutkhan

texts.ru: Якутхан, 57 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Якутхан среднее образование, много лет она занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть земельный надел мерою 1,0 ГА собственной и 1,0 Га арендованной земли, где Якутхан выращивает рис. Супруг помогает Якутхан в ведении ее бизнеса. Ежемесячный доход Якутхан от ведения бизнеса около 15,000 сом (KGS). Якутхан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, семян и полеводческих услуг, часть средств Якутхан планирует потратить на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Yakutkhan is 57 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. Yakutkhan has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture for many years. She has 1.0 hectare of owned and 1.0 hectare of leased land, where she grows rice. Yakutkhan's husband helps her with running this business. Yakutkhan's monthly income from running this business amounts to about 15,000 som (KGS). Yakutkhan requested a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy fertilizers, seeds and farming services, and to buy livestock with some of this money. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and farming services in order to grow organic rice, and also to buy livestock

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina is a 36-year-old married woman with two children. They live in a very poor area in Taiz city, Yemen. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family and his income is very limited and not enough to cover the necessary expenses of the family. His wife doesn't have a mobile to connect with other people, her children, or her husband when he is outside of the house. Sina believes the mobile phone is very important for her. She doesn't  have enough money to purchase it. As a result, she applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a mobile phone for her.

Sina looks forward to opening a saving account in a bank for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone for her.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité Oñondivepa es un grupo antiguo, bastante unido, están en el sexto ciclo con 17 integrantes. Todas con espíritu emprendedor y ganas de superación.
Sostienen que salir adelante es un desafío motivador, el poder  progresar a través del esfuerzo propio. Todas son mujeres rurales, que trabajan la tierra y crían animales ya que sus condiciones así lo permiten, entre ellas encontramos a la Sra. Cantalicia quien cultiva todo tipo de productos y comercializa su producción en diferentes barrios aledaños a su los casa. Ella es una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora, que quiere dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de semillas y abono, lo que le permitirá poder seguir con su siembra de todo tipo de productos agrícolas. Esta agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe de ir mejorando cada día.
texts.en:
The committee named “Oñondivepa” is a long-time group that is unified. The group has 17 members who are participating in their sixth loan cycle. They all have an enterprising spirit and the drive to succeed.

The members believe that getting ahead is a motivating challenge, so they must put in the effort to make progress. All of these women live in rural areas and work by cultivating the land and raising animals as the conditions allow. One of the women in this group is Sra. Cantalicia. She cultivates all types of products and then sells them in different neighborhoods around her house. Cantalicia is a determined and enterprising woman who wants to provide her loved ones with everything that she was not able to have.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds and compost, which will allow her to continue growing all types of agricultural products. Cantalicia is grateful for the opportunity she has received so that she can improve each day.

loans.use: to buy seeds and compost.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 32-year-old married man from Deir El Balah city. He lives with his wife and one son in a small house. He works at transferring goods using his rickshaw. Mohammad wants to improve the family's living conditions and buy all the needed stuff.

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new solar system for heating water and a tank. By taking this loan, he will be able to provide hot water for the household without using electricity.

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new solar system  and a tank for heating water.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 29-year-old single man from Deir El Balah city. He lives with his family  in a small house. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a very low income. Ahmad wants to improve the family's living conditions and buy all the needed stuff.

Ahmad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new solar system and a tank for heating water. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to provide hot water for the household without using electricity.

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new solar system and a tank for heating water

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 40 years old and runs a hotel business selling and supplying food to his customers. He is married to Betty and they have been blessed with 3 children and they live in Nyahururu town in Kenya. He also cares for one additional dependent in his home.

Wilson has run his hotel business in this area for the last 2 years and it has been profitable. Besides the hotel business, he is also a farmer. He grows maize and potatoes to sell.

He has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya to expand his business. He would like to buy more stock of cereals, maize flour, vegetables and cooking oil among other food stock for use in the hotel. 

This will help Wilson serve more customers which will increase his overall income so he will be able to provide food and clothing to his children and also educate them by paying for their school fees.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cereals, maize flour, cooking oil, vegetables.

loans.name: Reyzel

texts.en:
Reyzel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of groceries to sell for her general store business.

Reyzel has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from a passenger tricycle (three-wheeled transport vehicle).

Reyzel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business  in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria es una residente de la zona de turbo, zona bananera por excelencia con muchos problemas de orden público, tiene una miscelánea, muy importante para sus vecinos pues negocios como este son poco visto y la seguridad que se ve en las rejas blancas recalcan los problemas de seguridad que hay en la zona. 
En una zona rodeada de campesinos las tiendas son poco comunes y ella quiere crear un negocio para el beneficio de todos por eso con un crédito quiere darle un servicio de más el cual es la venta de productos de papelería pero parte del crédito será para abastecer su tienda con frutas, abarrotes, verduras y refrescos.
Impulsa a está morena que busca crear un negocio en el cual  muchos habitantes de la zona saldrán favorecidos .
texts.en:
Gregoria is a resident of the neighborhood of Turbo, an excellent banana producing region with many societal problems. She has a variety store, which is very important to her neighbors since these types of businesses are rarely seen. The white security bars are an indication of the security problems that exist in the area.

In rural areas, shops are not very common, so Gregoria wanted to create a business that would be a benefit to everyone. For this reason, she needs a loan so that she can provide more service. Gregoria sells stationery products, but part of her loan will be used to restock her shop with fruits, groceries, vegetables, and soft drinks.

Encourage this woman who wants to create a business that many of the local residents will find favorable!

loans.use: to buy stationery goods, fruits, groceries, vegetables, and soft drinks.

loans.name: James Ferney

texts.es:
Él es James un joven de 24 años de edad, residente de la zona de planeta rica, un sector humilde pero que tiene personas que buscan mejorar sus condiciones de vida, James de momento se encentra desempleado, él quiere estudiar, ser alguien en la vida, ser productivo no quiere ser un estorbo en su casa, en pocas palabras un mantenido, por ello y gracias a la ayuda de Interactuar quiere iniciar su negocio de cría de y venta de aves, una actividad que le enseño de pequeño su madre y en la cual depositara todas sus esperanzas de estudios.
Con el crédito construirá un estadero y comprara pollos y gallinas.
Ayuda a este joven desempleando que quiere hacer algo por su vida.
texts.en:
James is a 24-year-old young man and a resident of the Planeta Rica area, which is humble, but has people who are looking to improve their living conditions. At the moment, James is unemployed. He wants to study, to be someone in life, to be productive. He does not want to be a nuisance in his home; in short, a freeloader. This is why, and thanks to the help of Interactuar, he wants to start his business raising and selling birds, an activity that his mother taught him from the time he was young, and in which he will place all of his hopes of studying.

With the loan, he will build a coop and will buy chickens and hens.

Help this unemployed young man who wants to do something with his life.

loans.use: , an unemployed young man who wants to do something with his life, to build a coop for chickens and hens

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is an ambitious and hardworking man. He is 29 years old and he has been running his business for a few years. 

Despite the difficulties faced by Ibrahim, he was able to get a diploma in business administration, but he did not find a suitable job so he decided to start his own business, which is a cafeteria for the sale of cold and hot beverages.

The project became successful and famous so he decided to expand the project based on the needs of population of the region. He decided to purchase new inventory and add corn, ice cream and fried potatoes to what he sells in the cafeteria. 

Because of the lack of financial liquidity, he decided to ask for a loan to be able to buy the necessary tools and equipment for the expansion project.

loans.use: to buy the necessary tools and equipment for the expansion project.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy some tools, more kinds of birds and more chickens so as to increase her products.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 35 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Fatima runs a general store in her house to help her husband with household expenses. Lately they faced financial problems which led Fatima to think about expanding her store to increase her income. That is why she has asked for a loan to help her buy more products to sell.

In the future, Fatima would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college, and open a big store in her region.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the tools which he needs to develop his store.

loans.name: Waad

texts.en:
Waed, a 21-year-old single lady, lives with her family in Zarqa. Waed is in her third year studying for her Bachelor's degree in x-ray technology. Her father is retired and works part time .

Because of financial problems, Waed has applied for an education loan to help her cover fees for the rest of the semester as she works to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees.

loans.name: Sandra Yaneth

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer perseverante, luchadora una dama de admirar ella es madre soltera, cabeza de familia a sus 34 años de edad levanto, alimento, vistió le ofreció estudio a sus dos hijos de 13 y 5 años de edad y lo sigue haciendo, para ella ha sido muy complicado desempeñar el papel de padre y madre, tener que atender su negocio de tienda de abarrotes sin descuidar su oficio como madre.
Ella quiere brindarles estudio a sus hijos pero su sueño más loco y más anhelado es convertir su negocio en una mini-mercado y trabaja mucho para ello.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de un congelador, surtido de productos de refrigeración como carnes, refrescos, productos lácteos, entre otros.
texts.en:
Sandra is a persevering, fighting woman, a lady to admire. She is a single mother, head of household at her 34 years of age. She gets up, feeds, dresses, and offers education to her two children, aged 5 and 13, and she will continue to do so. It has been very complicated for her to play the role of father and mother and to have to take care of her grocery store business without neglecting her work as a mother.

She wants to give her children an education, but her craziest and most desired dream is to convert her business into a mini-market, and she works hard for that. She is asking for a loan to buy a freezer and a supply of refrigerated products such as meats, soft drinks, and dairy products, among others.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, dairy products, meats, and soft drinks, among other items

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase an amount of henna to resell to women.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is a 35-year-old married man and a father of three children. His oldest child is 11 years old and the youngest one is 5 years old. He lives with his family in the capital city of Yemen, Sana'a. 

Abdullah studied till secondary education. Unfortunately, he couldn't complete his studies. Abdullah has been involved in an electrical materials store for more than four years. This business can be regarded as the main source of income for Abdullah and his family. Abdullah sells some construction supplies alongside electrical materials to increase his capital. 

Abdullah works very hard to meet the needs of his customers but he doesn't have enough money to do this. Therefore, he applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase some electrical materials as lamps, cables, switches and some construction supplies for his store.

Abdullah looks forward to expanding his store through opening another branch besides the first one.

loans.use: to purchase some electrical materials such as lamps, cables, switches and some construction supplies for his store.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina es estudiante de la carrera de bioquímica  y está por culminar sus estudios, comenta que proviene de una familia  humilde y su meta es poder ayudar a su familia una vez que termine sus estudios.
Ella comenta que se está esforzando bastante para poder ser una buena profesional y con ello poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, de manera a poder cubrir los gastos de sus estudios.
texts.en:
Karina is a biochemistry student who is about to complete her studies. She says that she comes from a humble family and that her goal is to help them once she finishes her degree.

Karina indicates that she is striving to become a successful professional so that she can help her loved ones. She is requesting this loan so that she can pay her university fees. This will allow her to cover the cost of her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is a 56-year-old married mother of 10 children, three of whom are still in school. She works hard to provide for her family, having operated a general store in the Philippines for the past 30 years and also earning income from farming sugarcane.  

Caridad has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase an amount of perfumes and incense to resell them.

loans.name: Zakereya

texts.en: Zakereya, an ambitious 22-year-old, lives in Irbid with his family, which consists of six members. In his fourth year studying for his bachelor's degree in finance, Zakereya is applying for an education loan to help him cover the rest of the semester's fees.

loans.use: To cover the rest of the semester's fees

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 39-year-old married man and the father of four children, living with his family in their own poor house in the capital city of Sana'a, Yemen. The oldest child, who is 10 years old, is enrolled in school and the youngest one is 3 years old. Ali is employed as a soldier in the army with a very small salary. In truth, that salary is not enough to cover the necessary expenses of his family. It is very difficult for him to meet the demands of his family, especially since his children still are very small and neither of them works. Ali strives strongly to provide his family with a suitable living condition, but he found himself incapable due to his very limited income and the hard situation in the country these days.

Ali couldn't afford this situation and decided to find an income source for him and his family. He believes the best thing he can do is to purchase a taxi for him to work as a driver. This taxi will cover some of the necessary expenses of the family. The only problem that Ali faces is the capital and the financial support to buy the taxi. He heard of AMB, the Kiva partner in Yemen, which gives loans to anyone who wants to start or improve a business, especially poor people and people who have a limited income. So he applied for it and asked for a loan of 1,200,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to purchase a taxi.

Ali looks forward to expanding his house more by building another floor.

loans.use: To purchase a taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Sarwa Wiguna Group

texts.en:
As the head of the Sarwa Wiguna group, Ni Ketut has set a good example to their members. She combined raising pigs with a canteen business at a school. It has increased her family's income so she is able to save and repay the loan. Other members want to pursue new businesses, such as agriculture, services and trading. Therefore, the group decided to continue borrowing through Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil..
With the new loan, they will still buy piglets but also support their new ventures. Ni Ketut bought piglets with her profits from her last loan. This loan will enable her to purchase merchandise for her canteen business, such as snacks, soft drinks, candy and school supplies. She wants to develop her canteen business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her canteen business

loans.name: Tegal Badeng Indah Group

texts.en:
The Tegal Badeng Indah group succeeded in raising pigs they sold to a major buyer for a good price. They are able to save the money earned to use as business capital or to support their families" needs.
Ni Made sold her pigs to earn a satisfactory profit. Now she and other members of Tegal Badeng Indah group are requesting a new loan from Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil. Ni Made wants to try a new business running a small kiosk. Her husband helped her to build a small, simple building in front of her house. She will sell daily needs, such as rice, coconut oil, kitchen needs, and snacks. Her target customers are people around her house. Her husband works as a driver. Ni Made hopes for the best from her efforts, both raising pigs and operating the kiosk.

loans.use: to purchase rice, coconut oil, kitchen needs, and snacks

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is 22 years old and single with two children. Her two children are still in school, She works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Rose runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, bread, canned goods, milk, coffee, etc.

Mary Rose has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, bread, canned goods, milk, coffee, etc

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 41 years old and married with eight children.

Leonora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Leonora has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and charcoal-retailing businesses.

Leonora aspires to save enough money for building and expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Jesusa

texts.en:
Ma. Jesusa is 33 years old and married with one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Ma. Jesusa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Ma. Jesusa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising livestock. Gina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional wheels and spare parts for her tricycle passenger vehicle.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional wheels and spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Kulmira

texts.ru: Кулмира, 49 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У Кулмиры среднее образование, она работает секретарем в школе, также занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Кулмиры, ее хозяйство на сегодняшний день насчитывает 2 коровы, 6 овец. Также есть 2,0 ГА поливной земли, где она выращивает фасоль для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулмира обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки коровы. Доходы от кредита Кулмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, чтобы построить новый сарай для скота.
texts.en:
Kulmira is 49 and married with four children. She has a high school education and has a job as a school secretary. She also works in agriculture and animal husbandry. Thanks to her hard work, she now has two cows and six sheep on her farm as well as 2 hectares of land where she grows beans for sale. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Kulmira has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 45,000 KGS to increase her head count of livestock by purchasing a cow. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing the number of animals on her farm, and wants to build a new livestock barn.

loans.use: to buy a cow in order to increase her livestock head count

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 56 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ligaya has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Ligaya has been in this business for 31 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 64 years old, widowed, and the mother of four children.

Lorna is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lorna has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 33 years old, married, and has one child in school.

Myrna is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. 

Myrna requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Myrna has been farming vegetables for five years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Othman

texts.en:
Othman is a soldier who is a 27-year-old married man and the father of two children, living with his family in a rented house in Sana'a city, Yemen. The oldest child is five years old and the youngest one is one year old. Inside their house, most of the home appliances are very old and are traditional. The family suffers from those appliances because they do not work well. Unfortunately, Othman's salary is small and not enough to make some of the necessary improvements inside the house. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase some of the necessary new home appliances such as a refrigerator and washing machine for the house.

Othman's dream is purchasing all new and stylish home appliances and purchasing a piece of land on which to build his own house.

loans.use: To purchase some of the necessary new home appliances for the house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a washing machine for his home

loans.name: Om Mosa Group

texts.en:
Om Mosa is a group which consists of five hardworking women from Sana'a city, Yemen. They have requested a group loan of 210,000 YER from AMB and will hold each other accountable for the loan repayment.

One of these members is Amat, who is a very active woman from a poor family who lives with her family in a humble condition. By time, she shared her husband in building a small house. In the beginning, they started by building three rooms with a small kitchen as well as a bathroom. That business cost them a lot of money. Now, they work hard to prepare the house for living through making a necessary renovation for the rooms from the inside as well as to build a small wall around it. In truth, they need financial support and their income doesn't allow them to do that. As a result, Amat turned to Al- Amal Microfinance Bank and took out a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase some construction materials to make the necessary renovation for the house as well as to build a small wall around it.

Amat hopes to build a second floor and rent it with a monthly payment.

loans.use: to purchase some construction materials to make the necessary renovation for the house as well as to build a small wall around it.

loans.name: Antin

texts.en:
Good day, lenders!  Meet one of Ruma's clients, Antin, a young lady who lives in Bogor, a suburban area located about an hour from Jakarta. She is a factory worker and joined Ruma a year ago. She learned about Ruma from one of Ruma's sales executives who came to her house. She joined Ruma because she wants to learn how to become an entrepreneur as well as how to increase her savings. Now, after a year, she finally has a small stall where she provides mobile payment services for her community. 

With her business growing, Antin has asked for a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. This loan will be very useful in helping Antin improve her business and, in turn, her community which needs access to such services. Antin is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for her community

loans.name: Abdurozik

texts.ru:
Абдурозик  трудолюбивый мужчина 44 лет. Он родился в семье колхозника. Он женат и имеет шестерых детей. Он занимается животноводством. Покупает на рынке района Рудаки животных по дешевле, откармливает их и продаёт немного увеличив цену. 
 Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, поэтому Абдурозик хочет расширить этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Для этого он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скота. Абдурозик заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Abdurozik is a hardworking man of 44 years. He was born in a farming family. He is married and has six children. He works with livestock breeding. He purchases livestock cheaply at a market in the Rudaki region, breeds them and sells them at a somewhat higher price. 

The livestock breeding business brings in a good income, and therefore Abdurozik would like to expand this business by increasing the number of livestock. To do this, he turned to Arvand in order to get a loan to purchase livestock. Abdurozik thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Cariño Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario CARIÑO, está conformado por 4 mujeres emprendedoras (Aurelia Magdalena, Laura, Santa y Verónica) viven en la ciudad de Bilwi; se unieron hace 6 meses con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para poder tener acceso a préstamos en Pana Pana, que les permitiera incrementar el inventario de sus pequeños negocios de: Venta de ropa usada y pulpería. También tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar poco a poco las condiciones de vida de sus familias.

Con el primer crédito otorgado por PANA PANA y financiado con KIVA, le permito a Aurelia Magdalena, Laura, Santa comprar una paca de ropa mixta en Managua y con las ganancias mejorar su calidad de vida y a Verónica le permitió surtir su pequeña pulpería con productos básicos del hogar.

Santa: Es integrante del gripo solidario, es una joven amable de 26 años de edad, soltera, con deseos de superación. Desde hace 2 años vende ropa usada, con el propósito de apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hermanos que estudian su secundaria. Este solicitando financiamiento para comprar en Managua una paca mixta y venderla a precios accesibles a su clientela en Bilwi. Ella sueña con establecer una tienda donde ofrezca artículos y utensilios plásticos y de vidrio para el hogar.
texts.en:
The CARIÑO solidarity group is made up of 4 enterprising women (Aurelia Magdalena, Laura, Santa and Verónica). They live in the city of Bilwi. They got together 6 months ago with the aim of working together in order to be able to access loans from Pana Pana. This will allow them to increase the inventories of their small second-hand clothing and corner store businesses. It will also allow them to have the opportunity to increase their income and improve their families' living conditions bit by bit. 

The first loan granted by Pana Pana and financed by Kiva allowed Aurelia Magdalena, Laura and Santa to buy a mixed bundle of clothing in Managua and to use the earnings to improve their quality of life. Meanwhile, it allowed Verónica to stock her small corner store with basic home products. 

Santa is a member of the solidarity group. She is a kind, single 26-year-old with a desire to succeed. For 2 years she has sold second-hand clothing with the aim of helping her parents with the household costs and her siblings' secondary education costs. She is asking for a loan to buy a mixed bundle of clothing in Managua and sell it at affordable prices to her customers in Bilwi. She dreams of setting up a shop selling plastic and glass items and utensils for the home.

loans.use: to buy a mixed bundle of clothes in Managua

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a salesman for iSmart bringing clean cookstoves and other products to Kenya's slum communities. 

Each day he attends a morning sales meeting at 8 a.m. and then spends his day as a door-to-door salesman.  

Joel sells eco-friendly products like solar lamps and clean cookstoves that can benefit his community. 

Please support this loan and help Joel earn an honest living and gain valuable sales experience.

loans.use: to pay for clean cookstoves to sell in Nairobi's slums

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita is 51 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Edita works very hard to provide for them.

Edita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Edita has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Edita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 57 years old and the hardworking mother of two children. She earns a living by selling various items in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan from NWTF to buy more goods to sell. Erlinda has been in this line of work for two years. Her goal for the future is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 31 years old with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like coffee, canned goods, beverages, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Estela has been in this business for 3 years now. In the future, Estela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like coffee, canned goods, beverages, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Vie Nouvelle Group

texts.fr: Madame  Nsimire  est vice presidente de l’association d’affaire  Vie nouvelle à  l’âge de 37 ans. Mariée  à un homme sans emploie, elle est  mère  de 7 enfants qui vont tous à l’école.   Vendeuse de farine de manioc au marché central depuis 2006, elle se lançant dans le petit commerce  grâce au fonds reçu de son mari. Elle vient solliciter un nouveau prêt pour acheter 50kg de farine de manioc. Elle rêve devenir grossiste et  ouvrir un grand dépôt commercial. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour sa mission noble de lutte contre la pauvreté.
texts.en:
Madame  Nsimire  is the vice-president of the business association called "Vie Nouvelle" at the age of 37. Married to a husband who is jobless, she is the mother of seven children who all attend school. Since 2006 she has been selling manioc flour at the market. She got into small-scale retailing thanks to funds she received from her husband. 

She has just asked for a new loan to buy 50 kilos of manioc flour. She dreams of becoming a wholesaler and opening a big commercial warehouse. In conclusion, she would like to thank Hekima for its noble mission of struggling against poverty.

loans.use: to buy 50 kilos of manioc flour

loans.name: Ronesa

texts.en:
Ronesa is 62 years old and widowed with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ronesa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ronesa has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Ronesa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia is 54 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan from NWTF to buy more items to sell, including bread, eggs, canned goods, and sugar. Amalia has been in this business for three years and her goal for the future is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Ann Catherine

texts.en:
Ann Catherine is 31 years old and married with one child.

Ann Catherine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like eggs, milk, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Ann Catherine has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear.

Ann Catherine aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like eggs, milk, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Joan is 32 years old and both of her children are in school.

Joan has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Joan has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Muhidin

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Muhidin. Muhidin lives with his family in Bogor, a suburban area located about one hour's drive from Jakarta. He owns a small stall where he sells computer accessories and provides mobile payment services for his community.

Muhidin joined Ruma in 2013, and he is applying for his second loan from Kiva. The previous loan helped him to process more mobile transactions on weekends, and he thanks all of the lenders because of it. 

With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Muhidin has been seeing improvements in his business. His community sees him as a trusted and friendly mobile payment service provider. As the business grows, he hopes to get another working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services to his community, especially on weekends.

It is important to know that your loan will be very useful for helping Muhidin to improve his business and, accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services. In the photo, Muhidin is sitting in his own small stall. He will be thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for his community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials for making furniture to sell

loans.name: Nurali

texts.ru:
Нурали молодой и жизнерадостный мужчина 34 лет. Он женат и имеет трех детей. Он занимается торговлей. Он продает металл. Его жену зовут Маъмура. Нурали трудолюбивый мужчина и старается для благополучия своей семьи. 
Он хочет провести мероприятие по обрезанию своего сына. Для этого он обратился в Арванд за кредитом. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Nurali is a young and happy man of 34 years. He is married and has three children. He works with trade, selling metal. His wife is called Mamura. Nurali is a hardworking man and he strives for his family's well-being. 

Nurali would like to arrange for his son's circumcision. In order to do this he turned to Arvand for a loan. He thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to purchase gifts for his son's circumcision ceremony

loans.name: Almurat

texts.ru:
Алмурат  родился в семье колхозника.  Ему 48 лет. Он женат и имеет четырех детей. Алмурат живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Жена Алмурата также не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей.
Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Алмурат занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. От данного бизнеса он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Алмурату в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота.  Сейчас Алмурат хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Алмурат очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Almurat was born in a farming family. He is 48 years old. He is married and has four children. Almurat lives with his family in the countryside. He does not have higher education, as it was not possible for him to study at the university due to his family's financial problems. Almurat's wife does not have an education either, and she is a housewife. She does housework and raises the children. 

In order to have an income for food, Almurat has his own business. He works with fattening and reselling cattle. He gets a good income from this business. Almurat's wife also helps him with the business. She sells the milk they get from the cattle. 

Currently, Almurat would like to increase the number of livestock and expand  his business. Therefore he turned to Arvand and would like to get a loan to purchase cattle. Almurat hopes very much for a positive result and thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Endang

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Endang. Endang lives in Bogor, a suburban area located about one hour's drive from Jakarta, with his wife and daughter. He owns a small stall where he sells daily-use consumable products and provides mobile payment services for his community.

Endang joined Ruma in 2012. He feels happy that he joined Ruma because over the past three years he has learnt a lot about how to manage another business opportunity. He told us as well that the Ruma sales executive is really helpful and informative to him.

With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Endang has been seeing improvements in his business. His community sees him as a trusted and friendly mobile payment service provider. As the business grows bigger, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services for his community, especially on weekends.

It is important to know that your loan will be very useful in helping Endang to improve his business and, accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services. In the photo, Endang is standing in front of his own small stall. He will be thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for his community

loans.name: Abdumanon

texts.ru: Абдуманон  родился в семье колхозника. Ему 46 лет. Он женат, но не имеет детей. У него очень дружная семья. Живут они в сельской местности. Основным и стабильным бизнесом Абдуманона является животноводство. Он разводит и продаёт скот. В этом деле ему помогает жена. Она ухаживает за скотом, а также продаёт полученное от скота молоко. Бизнес животноводства приносит Абдуманону хороший и стабильный доход. Поэтому он желает расширить этот бизнес. Ему необходимо купить ещё несколько голов скота для выращивания и дальнейшей продажи. Для этого он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он надеется, что этот бизнес будет успешно расширяться и приносить больше прибыли, чтобы качественно удовлетворять нужды семьи. Абдуманон заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Abdumanon was born in a farming family. He is 46 years old. He is married, but does not have children. He has a very tight family. They live in the countryside. Abdumanon's main and most stable business is livestock breeding. He breeds and sells livestock. His wife helps him with this business. He looks after the livestock, and also sells the milk he gets from them.

The livestock breeding business brings Abdumanon a good and stable income. Therefore he would like to expand it. He needs to purchase some heads of livestock for breeding and selling. In order to do this, he turned to Arvand and would like to get a loan to purchase livestock. He hopes that his business will be expanded successfully and bring in a larger income, in order to meet the needs of his family in a good way. Abdumanon thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Cielo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está conformado por tres mujeres (Jordina, Lucrecia y Rosa María de Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan  por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de venta de bastimentos. Se organizaron con el propósito de acceder a créditos con garantía solidaria en PANA PANA, para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y asegurar la educación de sus hijos. 

Jordina: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer amable con cualidades de líder, tiene 38 años de edad, casada con 6 hijos: 2 son mayores de edad e independientes y 4 que estudian su secundaria y primaria. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar, desde hace 6 años estableció su negocio de venta de verduras y frutas en un tramo que tiene en uno de los mercados de Bilwi. Solicita financiamiento para comprar verduras y frutas en Managua y venderlas a precios accesibles a su clientela. Ella y su esposo sueñan con establecer una pulpería.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 3 women from Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas: Jordina, Lucrecia and Rosa María. They are enterprising women, struggling to build their small businesses selling supplies. They organized with the purpose of accessing a loan with a joint liability through PANA PANA, to improve their living conditions and ensure the education of their children.

Jordina is the coordinator of the group. She is a kind woman with leadership qualities. She is 38 years old and married with 6 children. Two children are older and independent, while four children study in primary and secondary school. In order to have her own source of income and contribute to the household expenses, she established her business 6 years ago, selling vegetables and fruits in one of the markets of Bilwi.

She is asking for financing to buy vegetables and fruits in Managua and then sell them at affordable prices to her customers. She and her husband dream of establishing a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits in Managua.

loans.name: Sauom

texts.en:
Sauom, 45, lives in a small community of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She is the lovely mother of four children. 

To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. 

So far, she has been in this type of business for ten years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. 

Therefore, she is applying for a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. 

By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao is a 55-year-old married mother of four children. She lives in Kampong Chhnang, a province in Cambodia. She and her husband, who is 56 years old, earn income from making decorative objects and clay piggy banks to sell at a market, and they have been in this business since 1990.

One of their four children is working in a factory, one is a teacher, and two attend school. The family can make approximately $17 each day. One of the children has just gotten married, so Mao would like a loan to buy lumber to build a house for her child. With the loan, she will have enough money to build a house for her child.

In the future, Mao hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy lumber to build a house

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is grateful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan which she used to buy chicken, pork and seasonings for her food business. 

Her earnings helped support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like to apply for another Php 20,000 which she will use to buy dozens of chickens and more kilos of pork needed to cook and sell at her stand. 

She is thanking God for the financial help that will be given her. 

She is also encouraged by a good customer turnout at her business which greatly helps fund their everyday needs and the education of her children.

Arlene dreams that all her hard work will bear fruit to give her family a bright future and enable her to send her children to the best schools. 

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase pork and chicken to cook and sell.

loans.name: Maica

texts.en:
Maica is 20 years old and has one child. She works hard to provide for her daily needs.

Maica is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. 

She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in this business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maica would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is 48 years old and has two children. She is married and one of her children is in school.

She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Maria Fe has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maria Fe would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is 21 years old with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, beverages, etc..

Marlene has borrowed and paid off 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from a buy and sell ready to wear business.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 32 years old and married with three children.  With two children in school, Janice works very hard to provide for them.

Janice runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, groceries, etc..

Janice has been in this business for 1 year now. 

In the future, Janice would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Josephine is 41 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

Josephine has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 35 years old and has three children. Jovelyn is married and her children are all in school.

Jovelyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in this business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jovelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Lilia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.

Lilia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell through her buy and sell rice business.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Sherzod

texts.ru:
Шерзод молодой парень 25 лет. Шерзод женат и имеет 3-их  детей. Шерзод очень жизнерадостный мужчина и любимый  отец. Шерзод живет в доме,который  построил сам. Для того, чтобы иметь доход на проживание Шерзод занимается своим любимым делом. Шерзод работает таксистом. У него имеется для этого собственный автомобиль. Но эта машина служит ему уже долгое время и много раз приходилось её чинить. Поэтому сейчас он планирует купить новую, более улучшенную машину для ведения и расширения своего бизнеса. Этот бизнес приносит Шерзод хороший доход, но его хватает только на проживание.
 А для того, чтобы купить новую машину требуются денежные средства.Поэтому Шерзод обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку машины для ведения своего бизнеса. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Sherzod is a young man of 25. He is married and has three children. He is a very cheerful person and a loving father. He lives in a house he built himself. To earn a living, he runs his own business as a taxi driver. He has his own car for this, but he has had it for a long time and he has had to repair it many times. Therefore he is now planning to buy a new, better car to operate and expand his business with. This business brings in a good income, but only enough to cover his living expenses.

In order to buy a new car, Sherzod needs money. Therefore he has approached Arvand and wants to receive a loan to purchase a car for his business. He hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy a new car for his taxi business

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis Fernando es todo un veterano de 66 años de edad, un hombre muy independiente que siempre le gusto valerse de sí mismo, tener su propio medio de sostenimiento, manejar sus tiempos, y no depende de un jefe.
Luis Fernando se desempeña como transportador informa de personas, ofreciendo un servicio muy importante pues el llega donde ninguna ruta de transporte va.
La razón que tiene a Luis Fernando ante ustedes preciados lectores es que como conductor necesita con urgencia un cambio de motor para su vehículo, por eso implora su ayuda pues de momento no tiene conque trabajar y el cambio retendrá su vehículo por un tiempo, mientras le instalan el nuevo motor y sus ahorros e acaban y la necesidad de comprar alimento está muy latente.
texts.en:
Luis Fernando is an experienced 66 years old man. He is a very independent man who  has always liked to work for himself. He's always had his own job, he likes to manage his own time, and not to depend on a boss.

Luis Fernando is a driver. He offers an important service, because he gets to areas where  public transportation doesn't get.

Luis Fernando needs to change the engine of his vehicle immediately. He is begging for your help, because he can't work right now; and changing the engine will hold the vehicle for a while. He is depleting his savings and there is an urgent need to buy food.

loans.use: to buy an engine. He needs it asap to be able to keep working.

loans.name: Jati Indah Group

texts.en: The ten members of the Jati Indah group are committed to pay back this loan. During the loan period, they plan to earn enough money to do this by carefully raising and feeding their pigs, and following instructions from their veterinarian. Ni Wayan, who leads the group, plans to sell her three pigs and earn a net profit of 1.500.000 IDR. She's very committed to increase the size of her herd and earn enough money to meet her family's daily needs and pay her children's school fees. Her piglets are high-quality because she cares for them, and gives them nutritious food and adequate vitamins. She currently has a sow and is committed to provide it with a better enclosure. She has become an example to other breeders not only in her group but also in her village. Her husband works as a carpenter, and they are committed to support their children's education so they can have a bright future. After being evaluated by MUK’s staff, Jati Indah has been approved for an increased loan size.

loans.use: to buy superior quality feed and renovate a cage.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fuel

loans.name: Dalias De Achocalla Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “DALIAS DE ACHOCALLA” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Olga es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de masitas, venta de mantas, venta de pan, venta de verduras, venta, venta de ropa. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Olga es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ganado; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió desde niña, de sus padres a quienes apoyaba porque era el negocio familiar, con el pasar del tiempo decide implementar un negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de las comunidades de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en los pueblos aledaños. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “DALIAS DE ACHOCALLA” will begin its fifth cycle with Pro Mujer, as a part of the Exaltación focal group in Villa Exaltación. The group is comprised of 9 members and is directed by a board on which Olga is the treasurer. The members of this communal bank run a variety of businesses, such as: Selling vegetables, selling masitas (a type of pastry), blankets, bread and clothing.  

The loan that they will receive will benefit small micro-businesses of which Olga is a member. She indicates that she became a member of Pro Mujer two years ago when a promoter from the institution came to her house to visit her and invited her to join. Now she has her own business of selling livestock. She learnt how to do this from her parents when she was a girl as she helped them with the family business. Over time she decided to form her own independent business. 

The loan that she will receive is for increasing capital by purchasing livestock from wholesale vendors in the communities of the city of La Paz and later selling the livestock in neighbouring villages. As Olga lives with her common-law partner and has a son, this form of work will enable her to generate income to support her family financially

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Jati Sari Group

texts.en:
The Jati Sari group has repaid loans by the due date.  During the period of the loan, they maintain the pigs well because they always feed them good food and vitamins. 

Pig growth can be maximized, but in this period many farmers sell their pigs, the pigs prices become unstable and the price of feed is very high, and it can affect their profits. Although they earn little profit, they keep the spirit to pursue this venture and still expect progress for their efforts.
 
The Jati Sari group received their third loan and continued their business. Now they can receive a higher loan size. This time they plan to manage pigs which can be sold.

Ni Putu, as the treasurer, used her loan to purchase 4 piglets and feed. She plans to sell them after 2 months and buy new piglets again. The price for local pigs is more stabile than the superior piglet, because lots of restaurants in Bali sell pig barbeque (or “Babi Guling” in Bahasa Indonesia). Babi Guling is a favorite food in Bali. She hopes her plan runs smoothly and she can have more profit.

loans.use: to purchase four piglets and feed

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Pech is a widowed mother of three children who lives in a village in the province of Takeo, Cambodia. 

She is a farmer and she has cultivated rice and fattened animals since 1980. Among the three children, the oldest one is working in a hotel, the second one is a factory worker and also a student and the youngest one attends school. 

Pech and the two children can make around 11.00 USD each day. The child who works in the hotel needs a motorcycle to commute to work, but she does not have enough money, so she has decided to request a loan. With the loan she will have enough money to buy a motorcycle for her child and the child will have better traveling conditions.
