In the future, she is going to build fences around her house and to help her two children in earning bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her child to commute to work

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina, aged 58, is married to a farmer and they are blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost 30 years, earning a net income of PHP 1,000 daily. 

Due to insufficient capital, Josefina would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 40,000 to purchase rice grains and grocery items to sell. She hopes that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase rice grains and grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for more vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 51 years old, married, and has ten children. Three of her children are in school.

Merly is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Merly requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Merly has been in this business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Merly would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Raheela

texts.en: Raheela is 41 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. Her husband has been running a general store for past ten years and is the family's sole breadwinner. Her husband wants to buy different kinds of commodities to sell, including rice, sugar, tea bags, and milk, but due to financial constraints he cannot afford them. Therefore Raheela has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will allow her husband to buy these commodities and also help him earn a good income, which he can use to manage his household and business. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: to help her husband expand his business.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 39 years old, married, and has two children.

Raquel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like snacks, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Raquel has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear clothing.

Raquel aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like snacks, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 53 years old, and she is married with 5 children. 2 of her children are in school.

Marlyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 8,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marlyn has been in this business for a year now, and she has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF in order to sustain it.

In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann is 31 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan from NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, including canned goods, eggs, and beverages. Mary Ann has been in this line of work for three years and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 48 years old and has four children. With children in school, Mercedita works very hard to provide for them.

Mercedita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like cigarettes, bread, candies, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Mercedita has been in this business for 4 years now. 

In the future, Mercedita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like cigarettes, bread, candies, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Genie

texts.en:
Genie is a 39-year-old married woman and has three children, two of which are in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Genie has a buy and sell movie Tapes-DVDs business in the Philippines. Genie requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more DVDs movies to sell.

Genie has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more dvd movies to sell

loans.name: Caliente Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario, está integrado por 3 mujeres luchadoras (Celsa, Ana María y Glenda) viven en Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Se unieron hace 8 meses, con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para acceder a préstamos con Pana Pana, para tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios de venta de bastimestos y pulpería. Gracias al primer crédito que recibió de Pana Pana con financiamiento de KIVA, les permitió a cada una cumplir con sus objetivos y así comenzar a mejorar sus ingresos y resolver algunas necesidades básicas en sus hogares.

Ana María: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una mujer afable, tiene 47 años de edad, casada con cinco hijos: 3 mayores de edad e independientes y dos que estudian su secundaria. Desde hace 3 años vende bastimentos, granos básicos y chivería en un tramo en uno de los mercados de Bilwi. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar verduras, frutas entre otros productos básicos de uso domésticos. Ella sueña con establecer una pulpería.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three strong women, Celsa, Ana Maria, and Glenda. The women love in Bilwi, a municipality of Puerto Cabezas. The group was formed eight months ago, with the aim of working together in solidarity to access Pana Pana loans, and thus have the opportunity to improve their small businesses comprised of selling basic food supplies and accompaniments. 

Thanks to the first loan that they received from Pana Pana financed by KIVA, each of the group members was able to increase their earnings and afford some basic necessities for their homes. 

Ana Maria is a member of the solidarity group, she's an affable woman, 47 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are grown up and independent and two of them are in secondary school. 

For the last three years Ana Maria has been selling basic food accompaniments and dairy products in a stall on one of the markets in Bilwi. 

Ana Maria is seeking a loan to buy vegetables, fruits and other basic products for domestic use. Her dream is to open a corner store.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits and other basic products for domestic use.

loans.name: Nyuh Gading Group

texts.en:
After 6 months of raising pigs, Kadek sold all of her piglets and made a profit of 500,000 IDR per month. Her loans were deducted from these profits.  Together with her husband, who is a farmer, Kadek was able to raise pigs to increase the family income.

Although the price of pig feed is currently expensive, Kadek remains passionate for the business of raising pigs with the group she leads.

After successfully repaying the previous loan, the Nyuh Gading group decided to request another loan and each get 1,500,000 IDR. Kadek is still trusted as the head of the group. 


Kadek will receive 1,500,000 IDR of this loan and use this loan to buy 3 superior piglets for fattening and also to renovate the pens in preparation for the coming birth from her sow. 

Kadek is hoping to gain more profit than she earned with the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy 3 superior piglets and renovate the pig pens

loans.name: Cosmos 79 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “COSMOS 79” iniciará el décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Salome es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, servicio de construcción, venta de lentes, venta de comida, venta de gelatina, venta de joyas, venta de papas fritas. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Salome es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que en su niñez ella se dedicaba a la crianza de cerdos, al generar ahorros decide invertirlo en la apertura de otro negocio que en la actualidad es su tienda de barrio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tarjetas telefónicas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros  y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución y la atención de la Asesora.

En la imagen se identifica la ausencia de una las clientes, la misma se marcho por acudir con premura a su negocio; sin embargo acompaña al grupo el esposo de una de las clientes conjuntamente su bebe, él esta ubicado en el fondo de la sala vestido con una chaleco negro.
texts.en:
The “COSMOS 79” communal bank is starting their first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Juan Pablo II branch office, It is made up of 8 members lead by a board of directors with Salome as Secretary. The businesses are the members of the communal bank do are varied and amongst them are: a neighborhood store, a construction service, sales of eye glasses, selling food, selling jello and the sales of french fries.

This loan will be of benefit to all these small micro-entrepreneurs of whom Salome is one. Today she has a neighborhood store. She says that as a child she raised pigs. Generating savings she decided to invest in another business which is now her neighborhood store. The loan that she is now getting is to augment her capital (buying telephone cards wholesale) that she will acquire at vendors in the city of El Alto and later sell them in her commercial space. This method of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically as she is married and has a son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes the savings and the training provided by the institute and the service provided by the advisers. One of the clients is missing in the photo. She had to leave due to being busy with her business. Also one of the husbands of the group is with the group accompanied by his baby. He is located at the back of the room dressed in a black vest.

loans.use: to buy telephone cards wholesale.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally, 63, lives in rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a mother of four children. She is a grocery seller and earns an average income of 5.00 USD a day. She has been involved in this business for around twenty years. 

Her grocery store has been earning poorly since it lacks a variety items to satisfy the clients. Due to this reason, she is applying for a KIVA loan to buy more grocery items. 

She hopes that this loan will help her store become more popular and make more income as well. 

She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items

loans.name: Renita

texts.en:
Renita is 41 years old, married, and has one child in school. Renita works very hard to provide for them.

Renita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like cigarettes, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Renita has been in this business for 2 years now. 

In the future, Renita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like cigarettes, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Bilqees

texts.en:
Bilqees is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan.  She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is 43 years old and the mother of one daughter. Her husband has been working in a wood shop for 6 years.  He is the sole provider of the family, responsible to feed the entire family and manage the house hold. 

Bilqees's husband wants to buy pieces of wood and other tools for his business, but due to insufficient financial means he cannot afford to buy these items. Therefore, Bilqees has applied to Kiva for a loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan her husband can purchase the relevant items for his business and earn income to meet the daily needs of the family and business.

Bilqees is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase wood and tools for her husbands business

loans.name: Mikheil

texts.en: Mikheil lives in Eastern Georgia in the village of Shashiani. He earns a living by running a small farm with different crops. Last autumn, he invested in barley seeds and sowed them on his field, which is shown in the photo. Now he must attend to the field again, and has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, reap and thresh the barley in summer, and make bales of straw. Then he will transport these items to the local market to sell. The repayment schedule for this loan is scheduled in a way that allows Mikheil first to sell his barley and straw and then repay with the money he earns.

loans.use: to grow grain to sell in the local market.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is a responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transportation services by driving a Taxi for 15 years. He is responsible for providing for the needs of the entire family. 

Her husband needs to do maintenance to his Taxi because his Taxi is not in good condition. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to do the maintenance to his taxi. Therefore, Sobia has applied to Kiva for a loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Sobia's husband will be able to afford the maintenance cost of the vehicle, and provide better transportation to his clients.  This will help him earn income. Sobia  also plans to put aside savings from the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Sobia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of her husband's taxi

loans.name: Villa Esther Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VILLA ESTHER” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pan, servicio de transporte,  venta de sombreros, venta de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que es el tercer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de pan; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia al observar la carencia de personas que trabajen en este negocio decide implementarlo. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de horno industrial) que adquirirá de tiendas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de trabajo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal group “VILLA ESTHER” is starting its fifth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal Santiago II. The group comprises eight members and is directed by a board of directors of whom Virginia is the President. The members own varied businesses, including bread sales, transportation services, hat sales and blankets.

The loan they are requesting will benefit Virginia and the micro businesses that are part of the group. She indicates that this is the third year she is part of Pro Mujer, since being invited by a client of the institution and becoming a member.

Currently, she runs a bread business. She began her business many years ago, on her own initiative, when she saw the lack of people running this kind of business; that made her decide to start her own.

The loan she is requesting is to increase capital to buy an industrial oven that she will acquire in stores in the city of La Paz and then implement into her own work space. This kind of work allows her to generate the means to support her family financially, as she is a single mother of one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she enjoys the training the institution provides.

loans.use: buy an industrial oven.

loans.name: 29 De Enero Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “29 DE ENERO” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de marcos, venta de mantas, tienda de barrio, venta e colchones, venta de salchipapas, venta de calzados, venta de polleras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que es el primer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su cuñada que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio elaboración de cuadros; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia, al observar a su esposo desarrollar pinturas decide implementarlo como fuente de generación de recursos económicos. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de aluminio por mayor) que adquirirá de tiendas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el trato que ofrece las asesoras de la institución.
texts.en:
The communal group "29 DE ENERO” (29 of January) will initiate its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II. This group comprises eight members and is directed by a board of directors of which Juana is the President. The communal group's members run various business, including frame sales, blanket sales, corner store, mattress sales, salchipapa (sausage and potatoes) sales, shoe sales and sweater sales.

The loan they are requesting will benefit Juana and the small businesses that are part of this group. She indicates that this is the first year she is a member of Pro Mujer, since being invited by her sister-in-law, who is a client of the institution. Currently, she runs a framing business. She learned this business years ago, on her own initiative, while observing her husband painting and decided to implement this business as a source to generate income. The loan will be used to increase capital in order to buy wholesale aluminum that she'll acquire in stores in La Paz and then she'll make the frames and sell them in her space. This type of work helps her generate the means to support her family economically, as she's married with three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she enjoys the treatment she gets from the advisors at the institution.

loans.use: buy wholesale aluminum.

loans.name: Amigas Inseparables Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMIGAS INSEPARABLES” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ofelia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de enaguas, venta de plásticos, servicio de construcción, venta de batidos, venta de comida, venta de tenis y calzados, venta de bodones.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ofelia es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de enaguas (faldas tradicionales); da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su familia, quienes desde niña le enseñaron el negocio, al ahorrar un pequeño capital decide independizarse.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Amigas Inseparables communal bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata regional center.  It is comprised of eight members, and it is led by a board of directors.  Ofelia is the president.  The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied and include selling petticoats, selling plastics, construction services, selling smoothies, selling food, selling tennis shoes and shoes, and selling containers.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small businesswomen where Ofelia is a member.  She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for three years.  She joined by invitation from a friend who is a client of the institution in the area.  She currently has a business of selling petticoats (traditional skirts).  She says that she learned this business from her family.  They taught her the business when she was a girl.  Upon saving a small amount of money, she decided to become independent.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital (to buy fabric wholesale).  She will get the fabric from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz.  She will later sell it at her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family financially.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the savings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale.

loans.name: Daya Pertiwi Group

texts.en:
Daya Pertiwi group makes their payment, represented only by their head, Dewa Ayu. Two members could not attend the meeting because of a religious ceremony.

Dewa Ayu is a 50-year-old mother who makes a living via her pig business and also sometimes as a tailor. She succeeded in maintaining and fattening six pigs. She sold them and earned 1,200,000 IDR profit for 6 months.

According to Dewa Ayu, all of the members have been successful with their pig businesses. The pigs were able to grow fat and healthy, with no diseases, and the members were able to sell them at a satisfactory profit. The group sends their gratitude to the lenders, Kiva and MUK.

The group proposed taking a new loan. The group decided to continue the loan, because MUK provides a special loan for pig breeders without collateral, and so they can do their business well.

Dewa Ayu will use her loan to purchase piglets and also to fix her sewing machine. With her two businesses, she hopes to increase her family income and put aside savings for her future needs.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and also to fix her sewing machine

loans.name: Quisirmitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “QUISIRMITAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Beatriz es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de CD’s, venta de salchipapas, venta de ropa, salón de belleza, venta de frazadas, venta de verduras, venta de frutas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Beatriz es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de masitas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años en una institución técnica, posteriormente decide implementar un pequeño negocio con un capital básico.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de harina y huevos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta que el crédito sea accesible, él área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal group “QUISIRMITAS” will initiate its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Collpani. This group comprises 8 members and is directed by a board of directors of which Beatriz is the President. The communal group's members run varied businesses, including corner store, CD sales, salchipapa (sausage and potatoes) sales, clothing sales, beauty salon, blanket sales, vegetable sales and fruit sales.

The loan they are requesting will benefit Beatriz and all the micro empresarios that are part of the group. She indicates that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for seven years, since being invited by a friend who is a client of the institution.

Currently, she runs a dough business. She learned this work many years ago in a technical institution and then decided to start a business with basic capital.

The loan she is requesting is to increase capital to buy wholesale flour and eggs that she'll buy wholesale from the sellers in the city of La Paz and after preparing the dough, will sell it at her stall. This type of work permits her to generate the means to support her family economically, as she's married with two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she enjoys that the loans are accessible, the health area and the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: buy wholesale flour and eggs.

loans.name: Mayaki Sartasiñani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MAYAQUI SARTASIÑANI” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Luisa es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, tienda de barrio, venta de perfumes, venta de ropa deportiva, venta de salchipapas, servicio de construcción, venta de juguetes, venta de enaguas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Luisa es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de trenzado y venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio aprendiendo el trenzado de flecos, posteriormente decidió ampliar su negocio y aprendió la elaboración de mantas con el cual ahora realiza su negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela e hilos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y los ahorros que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen se encuentra la hija de una de las clientes que acompaña al grupo, ella tiene un sombrero blanco.
texts.en:
The Mayaqui Sartasiñani communal bank will begin its sixth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela regional center.  It is comprised of eight members, and it is led by a board of directors.  Luisa is the secretary.  The businesses of the members are varied and include selling blankets, neighborhood store, selling perfume, selling sportswear, selling French fries and hot dogs, construction services, selling toys, and selling petticoats.

The loan they will take out will benefit small businesswomen where Luisa is a member.  She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for seven years.  She joined by invitation from a big promotion that the institution conducted in her area.  She currently has a braiding business, and she sells blankets.  She says that she started this business by learning to braid fringes.  Later, she decided to expand her business, and she learned how to make blankets, which she now does for her business.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital (to buy fabric and thread wholesale).  She will get the fabric and thread from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz.  After making the blankets, she will sell them at her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family financially.  She is married and has one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the health services and the savings that the institution offers.

In the photo one of the member’s daughters accompanies the group.  She has on a white hat.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread wholesale.

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika is a communicative woman. She was born in 1958, and lives in a small town. She is divorced, has one child, and has raised her child alone. 

Her son is sick. He has problems with his eye. Now, he needs to be operated.

Malika is seeking financial support to treat her son. She requested a KIVA loan for 3,000 TJS to pay for the operation on her son's eye. She hopes it will make him better. 

Malika is thankful for KIVA members' mercy.

loans.use: to pay for the operation of her son's eye

loans.name: Emprendedoras Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Giovana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, tienda de barrio, venta de perfumes, venta de ropa deportiva, venta de salchipapas, servicio de construcción, venta de juguetes, venta de enaguas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Giovana es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de shampoo; da a conocer que este negocio lo implementó con la ayuda de su amiga, quien le enseño donde y como comprar este productos, y con un pequeño capital decide implementar un negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de shampoo por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
As past of the central focus on Los Andes, this group is made up of eight members and is directed by a group of directors, in which Mrs. Giovana is the president. The businesses that the members of the group take forward are varied. They include selling blankets, a neighborhood shop, selling perfumes, selling sports clothing, selling sausages, construction services, selling toys, and selling women’s slips. 

The loan that was given will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs in the group in which Mrs. Giovana is a member. She says that it is the first time that the group has been included in Pro Mujer, and the group joined by invitation from a massive promotion that the institution did in the area. At present, she has a business selling shampoo. She established this business with the help of her friend, who taught her where and how to buy these products. With a small amount of capital, she decided to start her business. 

The loan will be used to increase capital (by buying shampoo wholesale); she will acquire the shampoo from wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz. Then, she will sell the products in her sales location. This type of work allows her to earn resources to support her family financially, since she is single and has a son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the health and training services the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy shampoo wholesale.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a 47 year old married woman from Ormoc, Leyte. She earns a living through the hog raising business. Ana has raised pigs for more than 10 years now.

Ana is asking to take a loan to buy animal feed and more piglets to raise. A loan will help her improve her hog raising business thus augmenting her profit and income.

In the future, Ana dreams of making her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more animal feed and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
Shoira was born in 1979. She is married, and lives in a small town with her three children.  

She is a seamstress. Shoira sews traditional dresses for women. She has been in this business for twelve years. She sews her dresses and sells them at wholesale prices in the domestic market. 

Shoira wants to expand her business and teach new students how to sew. She needs to buy textile materials for sewing dresses. 

She requested a 6,500 TJS loan to expand her business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy textile materials

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 44 years old and has four children. With four children in school, Rita works very hard to provide for them.

Rita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy grocery items to sell like rice, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Rita has been in this business for 2 years now. 

In the future, Rita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell like rice, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rowena is 47 years old, and has four children who are in school.

Rowena has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional coconut wine for her business.

Rowena has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional coconut wine for her business

loans.name: Valens

texts.en:
Valens is 30 years old. He is not married. He has been farming for 9 years. With the kiva loan, he would like to buy more fertilizer to grow rice to sell. Profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer to grow rice to sell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 44 years old with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, rice, beverages, groceries, etc..

Wilma has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and also earns an income from food vending.

Wilma aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, rice, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 59 years old, married, and has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has run the general store for the last five years, and earns additional income from electronic loading of mobile devices.

Wilma has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock -- beverages, coffee, shampoo, candies, groceries, and other items. She has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF already. She aspires to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy stock for sale.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 53 years old, married, and has five children. She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store for 24 years. She also earns  income from buying and selling beauty products.

Adelaida has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items for her store: condiments, junk foods, soap, groceries, and more. She has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF so far.

Adelaida aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 31 years old, married, and has two children.

Catherine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, beverages, coffee, etc.

Catherine has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns addtional income from fish vending.

Catherine hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, beverages, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Angella And Kelvin Group

texts.en:
Angella and Kelvin are a sales team working for iSmart Kenya, an organization with a mission to create jobs for youth and women in slums.  Angella and Kelvin have each completed iSmart's sales and marketing training, and are beginning to work as door-to-door sales agents in Nairobi's slum communities.  Their best-selling product is the clean cookstoves, which has an efficient design that saves the customer's money by reducing the amount of charcoal needed by half.  These cookstoves also reduce the toxic smoke emissions, and are better for the customer's health as well as the environment.  

Please help Angella and Kelvin to earn a living and bring these beneficial products to others in their communities.

loans.use: to pay for the upfront costs of purchasing clean cookstoves to sell in their community in Nairobi's slums.

loans.name: Sreynath's Group

texts.en:
Sreynath is a resident of Keo Seima district, Mondulkiri province. She is 34 years old and a widow. She has two young kids that are dependent on her. To support the family, she has been a government official for 3 years. She can earn around 5 USD a day.

This is her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. As a leader of her group, she is seeking a 1,400,000 KHR loan for repairing her house. She hopes that with the improved home, her family can feel happier and be healthier.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is a 33-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband owns a printing shop; he is the guardian of the family, and responsible to fulfill the needs of all family members. 

Fozia has been running her own beauty salon for the past four years; she also contributes her income with her husband's to manage the household. 

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics, i.e creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty saloon, but due to financial constraints, she is not capable of buying these items for her business purposes. Therefore Fozia has applied for a Kiva loan. 

This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purposes so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also be helpful for her to earn the maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and her family.

For this financial assistance, Fozia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of cosmetics, i.e creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon

loans.name: Edith's Group

texts.en:
Edith and John are working as sales agents for iSmart Kenya. iSmart is a social enterprise with a mission to create jobs for youth and women in slums.  To achieve this, we train and hire unemployed youth and women to sell environmentally friendly and socially transformative products in their communities. 

Most families in Nairobi's slums use charcoal for cooking.  Edith and John are holding a clean-burning cookstove.  These cookstoves have an advanced design that uses less charcoal than traditional cookstoves and emits less toxic smoke, saving the customer money and improving their health.  

Please support Edith and John in bringing these beneficial cookstoves to families living in Nairobi's slums.

loans.use: to pay for clean cookstoves to sell in Kenya's slum communities

loans.name: Kerta Jaya Amerta Group

texts.en:
The Kerta Jaya Amerta group made the payment of 9,000,000 IDR to MUK on time. They told us that they earned an increased profit during the loan period of six months. The pigs were able to grow fat and healthy. They were able to sell the pigs at a high price because there is lots of demand from the market. This situation stimulated their spirit to run their businesses. The group hopes the cooperation between MUK, Kiva and the clients will continue smoothly and last longer.

Ni Nengah, as the head, controls and monitors the members of her group. She was helped by other boards. She sold all her pigs and earned a satisfactory profit. She saved all the profit to use it for business capital later. One member had enough profit to continue the business with her own money, and she decided to resign from the group.

The Kerta Jaya Amerta group received a new loan of 7,500,000 IDR with five members left. The loan will be used to increase the number of piglets they raise, renovate the barns, and purchase superior feed. The group members still need a loan until they have enough capital to run their businesses by themselves. Now they already have savings to use for capital.

Ni Nengah and the members feel happy receiving the support all this time from the lenders, Kiva and MUK. She will use the loan to purchase two superior piglets and feed. She hopes she can have enough savings soon to continue the business by herself.

loans.use: to purchase two superior piglets and feed

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica  la venta de camarones, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda repellando y afinando las paredes y colocando piso cerámico, pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, cerámica y pago de mano de obra, asi ella y su familia puedan vivir cómodos y en limpio.
texts.en: This young woman's face has been pixelated because she's 28 years old and lives in a high-risk area. She runs a shrimp selling business and with what she earns she is able to cover some of the household expenses. This young woman lives in her own house with her family. She wants to fix up her house, plastering and refining the walls, and adding a ceramic floor, but she doesn't make enough to do it. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy cement, sand, ceramic and pay manual labor, and that way, she and her family will live comfortably and in cleanliness.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, ceramic and pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.en:
Rafoat is a hospitable woman. She was born and grew up in a rural area, and now lives in a small town. She is widow and has four children. 

She works as a seamstress. She is a very responsible, brave, patience and cheerful person. 

She requested financial support to buy carpet and blinds. 

Rafoat is thankful for KIVA's support and awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy carpet and blinds

loans.name: Mercy

texts.es:
Mercy es una mujer de 35 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos varones de 12 y 8 años y una hija mujer de 15 años, y trabaja como asalariada.
Ella es buena madre, honesta, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo desarrolla en el ‘Chapare’ que se caracteriza por una gran riqueza en fauna y flora, y por ser además es una de las zonas más lluviosas de la Tierra, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 19-34 grados centígrados.
Mercy es de tez morena, baja estatura, ojos obscuros, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español en el trabajo. Su vida la realiza junto a su pareja que se dedica al transporte y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina y cuenta con los servicios de electricidad y agua de pozo. Hace 10 años atrás adquirió un lote de tierra donde comenzó a construir su casa que consta de 2 habitaciones una cocina, un baño y una lavandería, la casa no cuenta con agua potable porque las casas del lugar son antiguas y no usan el servicio, “llevo 10 años construyendo mi casa y quisiera darles a mi familia la comodidad de usar agua potable…” comenta. Su sueño es termina de construir su casa, ella desea realizar la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para darle a su familia una vida cómoda. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene construyendo su casa.
Es por esos motivos que Mercy solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para que sus hijos vivan en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Mercy is a woman who is 35 years old. She lives with her partner and has two sons, who are 12 and 8 years old, and a daughter, who is 15 years old. She works as a salaried employee. 

She is a good mother and is honest, persevering, responsible, and hard working. She works in the Chapare province, which is characterized by a great richness in plants and animals. It is also one of the rainiest areas in the country, with a temperature that varies during the day between 19 and 34 degree Celsius. 


Mercy has brown skin, short stature, dark eyes, long black hair that she wears tied in a ponytail, and a thin physique. Her mother tongue in Quechua, which she speaks in her place, and she speaks Spanish for work. She shares her life with her partner, who is dedicated to transportation, and with her children, who are studying in school. 

They live in their own house, which is built of brick with a corrugated iron roof; their house also has electricity and well water. Ten years ago, she acquired a lot of land, where she began building her house, which has 2 rooms, a kitchen, a bathroom, and a washing room. The house doesn’t have drinking water because the houses in the area are old and don’t use the service. She says that she spent 10 years building her house, and she wants to give her family the comfort of having running water. Her dream is to finish building her house. She wants to install running water in her kitchen, bathroom, and washing room to give her family a comfortable life. This is her first sequence of loan with the institution in the 10 years she has been building her house.

It is for these reasons that Mercy requests a loan to install running water in her kitchen, bathroom, and washing room so that her children may live in better conditions.

loans.use: to install running water in her kitchen, bathroom, and washing room so that she children may live in better conditions.

loans.name: Al- Mawaheb Al- Wohda Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Mawaheb Al- Wohda which consists of four women from Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB.

Rabab is the leader of the group and its coordinator.  She is married and lives with her family in their own house which consists of just one small room, a  kitchen, and a bathroom. 

Long ago, Rabab's husband had a small amount of money and he decided to purchase a piece of land to build his own house on that land. His money was  not enough, so he sold most of his wife jewelry and bought a piece of land and built a small room on it. In truth, he needs to expand the house, but his income doesn't allow him to do that. For this reason, Rabab decided to help him by asking for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks to build an extra room.

Rabab hopes to complete all the expanding of the first floor and hopefully to build the second floor.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks to build an extra room

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 48 years old and a married woman with six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Rosemarie has a used clothing business in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of used clothing to sell.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Shaheena Bibi

texts.en:
Shaheena Bibi, age 53, is a mother of eight children. She owns an embroidery shop in the market, and she helps her husband manage the household. She needs to purchase new variety of embroidery material to sell. This will help her to offer more variety to her customers and to continue to work efficiently and professionally. However, due to lack of money she finds it difficult. 

For that, Shaheena Bibi is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of helping her husband to manage the household. She will purchase an embroidery machine and new variety of embroidery materials. Shaheena Bibi is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her embroidery business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Zakria

texts.en:
Zakria is a 24 year old single man who lives with his parents in Sana'a city, Yemen. They live in a humble and very old house, as you can see in the photo.

Zakria studied up to the Secondary education level. Now, with his Secondary school certificate, he is employed with a small salary. Most of the money he receives goes to cover the necessary expenses of his family. The house where he lives with his family lacks a lot of furniture. His father couldn't furnish the house, as with Zakria's small salary, there is not enough to do it. For this reason, he asked for a Youth loan of 200,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank in order to purchase some of the necessary furniture for the house.


Zakria hopes to open a savings account at the bank to help him in starting his own business.

loans.use: to purchase some of the necessary furniture for the house.

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en:
Rafia is a 30-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and five children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 2 years.  He alone is responsible to provide for the needs of the entire family.

Rafia's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories such as pieces of cloth, needles, and sewing machine accessories. But due to financial constraints he is not able to buy these items for his business. Therefore, Rafia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will financially assist her husband to acquire these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that he can increase his income.

Rafia is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of tailoring accessories for her husband's tailoring business

loans.name: Roselyn And Brian Group

texts.en: Roselyn and Brian are sales agents for iSmart Kenya, an organization working to create jobs for youth and women in slums. Roselyn and Brian were looking for work and attended iSmart's sales and marketing training.  They are now working for iSmart as door-to-door sales agents, bringing green products like solar lamps and clean burning cook stoves to Nairobi's slum communities. Each day they attend an 8 AM sales meeting and then spend their day selling products door-to-door. They earn a commission on each sale they make. Please support Roselyn and Brian and help them earn a living while gaining valuable job skills.

loans.use: to pay for green energy products to sell in informal settlements in Nairobi.

loans.name: Mavuno Group

texts.en:
GODRIVA, who is in her early 20s, is married with two children who are still in school.  She has been running a butcher business for five years now.  She works from 08am to 06pm daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be GODRIVA's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to  increase the meat stock and met her customer's demand.  She dreams of opening another butchery in a different area.  

GODRIVA will share this loan with her loan group, "MAVUNO GROUP", which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the meat stock and met her customer's demand

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad  y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de verduras, camarones y punches,  desde hace 4 años, la joven es madre soltera y vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, por esa razón esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de todos los materiales necesarios para la construcción de dicho cuarto, asi ella y su hija puedan vivir mas cómodas en su casa.
texts.en:
This young woman’s face has been pixelated because she is 24 years old and lives in a high-risk area. She has been dedicated to selling vegetables, shrimp, and popcorn for 4 years. The young woman is a single mother and lives in her own house with her family. 

She wants to improve her home by building a room in the place shown in the picture. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy all of the necessary materials for building this room. Thus, she and her daughter will be able to live more comfortably in the house.

loans.use: to buy all the materials needed to building another room in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon equipment and cosmetics to meet her customers' demands

loans.name: Gulsunoi

texts.en:
Gulsunoi is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1972 and lives in a small town. She is married and has two children. 

Gulsunoi opened her own business, buying and selling jewels. Every year she takes a loan to access capital and improve her business. She loves her activity. Gulsunoi has permanent, satisfied customers. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 TJS in order to buy jewels. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy jewels.

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.en: Muhabat is a clever woman. She was born in 1961. She is living in a rural area. She is married. She has three children. Her husband is an emigrant in the Russian Federation. She is an experienced woman. Her startup business was selling oil. Time passed by and she became a business woman. Now, she has a business of buying and selling women's wear. She has not had a permanent place before and is very satisfied that she has one now. Muhabat decided to buy different assortment of women's wear because she has a very good place for trading. She requested a 9,000 TJS loan to buy clothes. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy different assortment of women's wear.

loans.name: Saodatjon

texts.en:
Saodatjon is a long experienced person. She was born in 1977. She is living in small town and she is married with three children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Saodatjon has her own business. She is buying and selling textile materials. She has five years of experience in this field. She gets orders of customers and sells at wholesale prices. She is well known among sellers, relatives and neighbors. 

Saodatjon is an honest and respectable woman. She is planning to enlarge her business and buy women textiles. She is asking for financial support of a 1,000 USD loan and hopes she will be supported.

loans.use: to buy women's textiles.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 39 years old and married with five children.

Evangeline works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like beverages, groceries, etc.

Evangeline has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Evangeline aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a widowed woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 48 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Mercy has a dried fish business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell. Mercy has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 27 years old, married, and has four children. With three of her four children in school, Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, etc.

Josephine has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, biscuits, noodles, candies & etc.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goats

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a winner, a woman who has faced huge adversity and overcome many obstacles. At the age of 56, she is responsible for three children. She lives with her husband in a remote village in Thika, in the central region of Kenya. 

Jane passionately loves farming. She has been farming for the past 15 years and has always managed to provide for her family. Feeding her family requires a lot of hard work and determination. Her other sources of income are crops and some personal business that she conducts in order to provide food for her parents and family. In farming, she enjoys the returns she obtains but it is challenging for her to maintain a good standard of living. 

Jane is seeking a loan to buy a generator that she would use to pump water from the river to her farm. This loan will enable Jane to irrigate her farm, which will result in higher crop production. She will use the profits from higher crop production to improve her life. Jane awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a generator.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a widowed woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 36 years old and has four children who are in school.

Marlyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Milagros works hard to support her family.

She has a pig raising business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling feeds. Milagros is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pig raising business.

Milagros has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosidin

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of the Ruma agents, Rosidin. Rosidin lives in Bogor, a suburban area located about one-hour drive from Jakarta. He lives there with his wife and his son. He owns a small stall where he provides mobile payment services for his community. Rosidin joined Ruma in 2013 and this is the third time he is applying for a loan from Kiva. The previous loan helped him to process more mobile transactions on weekends and he thanks all of the lenders because of it. 

With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Rosidin sees improvements in his business. His community sees him as a trusted and friendly mobile payment service provider. As the business grows, he hopes to get another working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services for his community, especially on weekends. 

Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Rosidin improves his business and accordingly, his community, who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Rosidin is the one who is sitting in his own small stall. He will be thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for his community.

loans.name: Montaña Camapara Group

texts.es: Jose, tiene 20 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo, reside en una aldea del municipio de San Marcos, Lempira junto a su esposa, hijo y su madre. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura de maíz y frijoles con su familia y con su propio cultivo de café lleva 4 años. El café lo vende en grano seco y lavado en el mercado local de la zona. Jose pertenece al grupo Montaña Camapara y esta solicitando un segundo prestamo por 3,200 lempiras para comprar abonos y fertilizar su finca de café para mejorar la producción. Su plan es seguir cultivando y mejorando la finca. El grupo esta integrado por 8 personas quienes viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura. El prestamo grupal es por 28,600 Lempiras para comprar abonos y fertilizar sus cultivos. En la foto se identifican a la izquierda está Serbando, Antonio, Jose, Natividad, Ismael, María Marina, María Celestina y Maria Suyapa a la derecha.
texts.en:
Jose is 20 years old, is married, and has a son. He lives in a village in the municipality of San Marcos, Lempira with his wife, son, and mother. He has always worked in agriculture, growing corn and beans with his family, and he has had his own coffee crop for 4 years. He sells the coffee as washed and dried coffee beans. 

Jose belongs to the “Montaña Camapara” group and is requesting a second loan for 3,200 lempiras to buy manure and to fertilizer his coffee crop to improve his production. His plan is to continue growing and improving his crop. 

The group includes 8 people who live in the same community and are dedicated to agriculture. The group loan is for 28,600 lempiras to buy manure and to fertilize their crops. In the photo, from the left, you see Serbando, Antonio, Jose, Natividad, Ismael, María Marina, María Celestina and Maria Suyapa at the right.

loans.use: to buy manure to fertilize his coffee crop.

loans.name: Naeema Bibi

texts.en:
Naeema Bibi is a 28-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her 5 children. Her husband has been working at a public sector organization for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of family. Naeema Bibi is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.
 
She needs different kinds of goods, e.g., needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these items. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these items and will also help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Naeema Bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: help her husband to rent a shop for tailoring purposes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new Juki sewing machine for sewing clothes.

loans.name: Naheeda

texts.en:
Naheeda is a 42-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. Her husband has been running a general store for past five years. He alone is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. 

Naheeda's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities (e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk, and other consumer items) for his business, but due to financial constraints, he is not in a suitable position to buy all the above products for reselling purposes. 

Therefore Naheeda has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also help him to earn the maximum profitable income to manage his household and business.  Naheeda is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband purchase different kinds of commodities (e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk, and other consumer items) for his general store

loans.name: Jose Ines

texts.es: Jose de 40 años de edad vive con su grupo familiar en casa propia, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la agricultura por lo que se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en el rubro, es muy conocido en la zona cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en sacos asi como muestra en la fotografía  y ya tiene buena clientela pues obtiene las mejores cosechas, Jose le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para seguir con sus cultivos y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jose is 40 years old and lives with his family in their own house. He is dedicated to growing corn. He has spent 20 years dedicated to agriculture, so he has a lot of experience in the field, and he is known in the area. When his harvest is ready, he collects it in sacks, as is shown in the photo. He has a good clientele, since he has the best harvests. 

Jose requests a loan from Integral that will allow him to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, disease controls, etc. to continue with his crops and, thus, to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, disease controls, etc.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es: Juan de 53 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 30 años, de esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, y es la única forma que conoce de cómo ganarse la vida, Es un hombre muy trabajador, honrado y responsable. Vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, cuando ya está su cosecha la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarla en los pueblos aledaños, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, fertilizantes etc.  y así poder tener mejores ingresos para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is 53 years old and is an extremely honest, responsible, and hardworking farmer, who has grown corn for more than 30 years. Farming is the only way Juan knows to earn a living, and it's allowed him to provide for his family. Juan works from season to season, planting, cultivating, and harvesting his crop, which he then stores in the granary that appears in the photo. He then sells his crop to customers in neighboring towns.

Juan is applying for a loan for the purchase of of manure, pesticides, seeds, fertilizers, and other supplies. These investments will allow him to boost his income and provide his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: for the purchase of manure, pesticides, seeds, fertilizers, and other supplies.

loans.name: Jamaica - Kibaha Group

texts.en:
Mwatano, who is in her late 50's, is married with three children; two of them are grown up and one is still at school.  She has been a food vendor for four years now.  She works from 6 AM to 6 PM daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mwatano's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase the mamalishe stock and has paid back her loan successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees and household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy the out of stock items in the food stock.  She dreams of owning a Hotel.

Mwatano will share this loan with her loan group, Jamaica-Kibaha, which consists of six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the out of stock items in the food stock.

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.en:
Bashorat is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1963. She has grown up and lives in a rural area. She is married. She has three children. 

She is a seller. She has a business of buying and selling women's and kids' wear. For about eighteen years, she has been busy with this activity.  She has a permanent place and clients. 

Bashorat is planning to enlarge the assortment of clothes as the season comes. She is asking for financial support from Kiva for buying a new collection of clothes.

loans.use: To buy a new collection of clothes

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: Salvador de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la apicultura desde hace 20 años y también a la siembra de granos básicos, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados y con lo que obtiene logra salir adelante, Salvador esta solicitando un crédito para poder darle mantenimiento a las colmenas que muestra en la fotografía y asi poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Salvador, 65, lives in his own house with his two children.  He has been making a living from beekeeping for 20 years and also from planting basic grains.  He sells his products in different markets and, with what he obtains, he is able to come out ahead.  
Salvador is requesting a loan in order to maintain his beehives, which can be seen in the photograph, and in this way be able to continue with his work which is his only source of income.

loans.use: to maintain his beehives.

loans.name: Ferlyn

texts.en:
Ferlyn is 30 years old and married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount \NWTF to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

Ferlyn has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, Ferlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase new perfumes and incense for resale.

loans.name: Salam Al-Baidha Group

texts.en:
Salam Al-Baidha group is comprised of the same members that took out its first loan from Kiva lenders. This group consists of Hanan, Hesa, Jawhra and Amina. They fully repaid the first loan and have applied for another loan of 200,000 YER from Kiva lenders.

 Amina is the leader of the group. She is married and the mother of four children who live with them in their own house. Her husband is an immigrant who works outside of the country and the money he sends for her and her children is a very small amount. So, Amina decided to sell ice cream in the streets to meet her children’s needs. She found that this business is not profitable for her and decided to seek another profitable business, selling clothing, incense, and perfumes to women door-to-door. Unfortunately, she does not have enough money to start this retail business. For this reason, she has asked for a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase clothing, perfumes and incense to resell.

Amina hopes to expand in her business. All the members of the group thank Kiva lenders warmly for their first loan and hope this loan will be funded too.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, perfumes and incense for resale.

loans.name: Raquiza

texts.en:
Raquiza is 59 years old and widowed with three children. She earns a living by operating a poultry business in the Philippines. Raquiza is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her chickens. Raquiza has been in this business for 1 year and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds & vitamins for her chickens

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for ten years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to make maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of it is not good; it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. 

Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. Therefore, Yasmeen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Yasmeen's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily, and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Yasmeen also plans to make savings with the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future. Yasmeen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband repair his taxi.

loans.name: Alkhadher

texts.en:
Alkhadher is a father of three children, living with his family in his own house in Aden city. Yemen. He is the sole breadwinner of the family. 

Alkhadher works in the private sector for a humble salary. His house's yard is without a wall around it, so he needs to build a wall around the yard of the house, but with his small salary he couldn't save any money for this purpose. 

As a result, Alkhadher applied for a loan of 88,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction materials to build a wall around the yard of his house.

Alkhadher hopes to improve his family's living and renovate the whole house.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build a wall around the yard of his house.

loans.name: Kimchhan

texts.en:
Kimchhan is a 28-year-old junior nurse who is working in a hospital and he is also a nursing student. Kimchhan is married with a child and lives in Siem Reap province in Cambodia. He has worked in the hospital since 2012. His wife is a 26-year-old professional cook. Both Kimchhan and his wife can earn around USD 16 each day. 

He is lacking the finances to cover his tuition fees from the first to the third year; therefore he has decided to secure a loan. With the loan, he will be able to earn an associate’s degree successfully. After graduation, he is going to find a job in another hospital with a decent salary, so he will be able to save money to build a proper house and also send his child to school.

loans.use: to cover his tuition fees from the first to the third year

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 32-year-old, married man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his wife and two kids in a small house. Hasan works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He wants to improve the family’s living conditions and buy all the necessities.

Hasan took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new solar system for heating water and a water purification machine. By taking this loan, Hasan will be able to provide hot water for the house without using electricity and also clean water. Hasan appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new solar system for heating water and a water purification machine.

loans.name: Hadiya

texts.en:
Hadiya is married with two children. She is a wise woman who was born in 1972 and lives in a rural area. For the past four years, Hadiya has run a business buying and selling clothing for women and children. She has a permanent place to trade and she is attracting a great number of satisfied clients. 

Hadiya is requesting a 5,000 TJS loan to buy a new assortment of clothing to sell before the spring and a national holiday. She awaits mercy from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 46 years old and has seven children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Lucena is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.
