The leader of the Dúo Luz en Mi Camino group is Señora Estefana, who has owned her business in the main street of her neighbourhood for more than 25 years. She relies on the unconditional support of her husband and teamwork of her two adult daughters.

Estefana tells us that she wants to buy several quintales (each 100 lb) of corn valued at 150 quetzals each, but she does not have enough money for her order. She needs to buy the corn because tortilla sales are excellent and she has several deliveries to make at some factories. So Estefana needs this loan to continue moving forward with her business and take advantage of the low prices of the corn during these months.

loans.use: to buy corn to make and sell tortillas.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a kitchen, supplies and furniture.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa used her previous loan for 15,000 PHP to purchase several packs of dried fish to sell. With her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

Felisa requested another loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy large quantities of dried fish which she sells at retail. Aside from selling dried fish, she also makes doormats and has a repair shop for additional income.

Felisa hopes to be more successful to give her family a better life. She also aims to give her children the best education. Every week, she meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from God which she studies. 

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Delia is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy additional charcoal to sell.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Roxelyn

texts.en:
Roxelyn is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She has a business of selling nipa (palm) roofing in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling firewood. Roxelyn is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stock of nipa roofing to sell.

Roxelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of nipa (palm) roofing to sell.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Estelita is 45 years old now.

Estelita has a meat shop business in the Philippines. Estelita requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy meat to sell.

Estelita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Estelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell

loans.name: Nayi Isabel

texts.es:
Nayi es una mujer de 39 años de edad, muy correcta, honesta con una gran responsabilidad la cual es atender una tienda escolar de un sector muy pobre de turbo, pero a pesar de que es una zona muy golpeada por el conflicto armado y la pobreza trata de que en su tienda se venda productos saludables para los niños.
Nayi pro la preocupación por los niños, por brindarles un espacio cómodo y placentero quiere solicitar un préstamo con el ánimo de comprar surtido de frutas para vender jugos naturales, comprar sillas y mesas para que tengan un espacio para consumir sus alimentos.
Su sueño es formar un cafetería y con tu ayuda esta mujer puede crear con poco un ambiente diferente para el bien de los niños, apoyala!
texts.en: Nayi is a very proper, honest 39 year old woman who has the great responsibility of taking care of a school store in a poor area of Turbo. In spite of the fact that it is an area affected greatly by the armed conflict and poverty she sells the children products that are good for them in her store. Nayi because she is concerned about the children and to provide them with a comfortable and pleasant space wants to request a loan with the aim of supplying an assortment of fruits so she can sell natural juices. She will also  buy chairs and tables so that they have a space to consume her foods. Her dream is to open a cafeteria and with your help this woman can create a different environment for the good of the children. Support her!

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables and toys to make her space more agreeable for the students as she is a woman who offers food services at at humble school.

loans.name: Nely Marisol

texts.es:
Nely tiene 28 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está acompañada y tiene dos hijos, el primero está estudiando en kinder y su segunda hija es una bebé.

Nely es comerciante, realiza venta de golosinas y refrescos en la radioemisora donde trabaja su esposo ya que él es locutor.

Ella necesita el crédito para realizar mejoras al equipo de radio de su esposo, pues tiene desperfectos y necesita mejorarlo.

Sus sueños son que su venta crezca, ayudar siempre a su esposo y que sus hijos se desarrollen bien y logren ser profesionales en un futuro.
texts.en:
Nely is 28 years old and studied up to Grade 6. She is married and has two children. The first is studying in kindergarten and the second only is still a baby. Nely is a businessperson, she sells sweets and soft drinks at the radio station where her husband works as an announcer.

She needs a loan to make improvements on her husband's radio equipment as it is damaged and needs to be attended to. Her dream is for her sales to expand, always help her husband and that her children grow up well and become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to make improvements to her husband's radio equipment as it has problems and needs attention.

loans.name: Tania

texts.en:
Tania is 59 years old. She lives in Gori district with her 26-year-old daughter. Her daughter is a nurse at a local hospital and gets a small monthly income.

Tania is unemployed nowadays and wants to restart her trading business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,500 USD to restart her trading business. With the received credit, she will purchase a stock of dishes and will resell them with the price markup to generate income. 

Tania is experienced in this business and thinks that it will be profitable and will be able to increase family income and help her daughter in covering expenses. Tania awaits your support.

loans.use: to restart her trading business in order to generate income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new solar system for heating water and a tank.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 35-years-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and two kids in a simple humble house. Ayman appears in the photo.

He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Ayman would like to improve the family living conditions so he took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for his house. This will enable him to provide clean water for his family.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his house.

loans.name: Awad

texts.en:
Awad is a 26-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and three sons in a simple, humble house. Awad works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Awad would like to improve the family's living conditions so he took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for his house. This will enable him to provide clean water for his family.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his house.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 32-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and one son in a simple humble house. Mahmoud works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Mahmoud would like to improve the family's living conditions, so he took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water-purification machine for his house. This will enable him to provide clean water for his family.

Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water-purification machine for his house.

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en:
Eyad is a 39-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and five kids in a simple humble house. Eyad works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Eyad would like to improve the family's living conditions, so he took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water-purification machine for his house. This will enable him to provide clean water for his family.

Eyad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water-purification machine for his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his house.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
In the picture, Sokha, 40, is with her husband, Tou, 43. The couple lives in a remote area of Takeo province, Cambodia. This couple has given birth to two children who are currently in school. Sokha is a weaver with an earning of USD 5 a day while her husband is a construction worker with an earning of USD 6 a day. 

Sokha would like to improve her living standard by having clean energy for household use. Because of the lack of capital, she is asking for a loan to build a biogas digester under the project of NBP (National Biogas Program) partnering with HKL. 

After an initial investment in this system, she hopes that she won’t spend much money on fuel and lessen the smoke from wood or charcoal. She is very happy and thankful, because with this kind of loan product, HKL has offered a special interest rate better than its general loans. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a biogas digester.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima is a business woman who was born in 1974. She is living in a remote district. She is married and has two children. 

She is a nurse, working at central medical clinic. She is a hardworking, gentle, patient, and bright person. She is experienced, challenging, and knows well her job. Fotima is well known among colleagues and friends. 

She bought an apartment. She is planning to buy additional equipment to her home. She requested financial support to buy needed equipment for making comfortable her apartment.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment for her home

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds and an irrigation machine to water his vegetables in his garden.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his house.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita, is aged 55, married to a tricycle driver and they're blessed with four children. 

She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost eight years and earns a net income of PHP 200 daily. 

Due to insufficient capital in her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase coffee, milk, eggs, noodles, purified water, charcoal, and gasoline to sell. 

She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase coffee, milk, eggs, noodles, purified water, charcoal, and gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Flor works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell fruits and vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Flor is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables like eggplant, okra, etc. to sell for her buy and sell fruits and vegetable business.

Flor has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetables like eggplant, okra, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Hanny

texts.en:
Hanny, 30, is a woman with one child, who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Hanny has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. 

Hanny requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish, ice and plastic bags.

In the future, Hanny would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish, ice and plastic bags.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marites is 37 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy flour and other ingredients for her business.

Marites has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy flour and other ingredients

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 45 years old. She is married with five children, one of whom is in school.
Victoria is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Victoria requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.
Victoria has been farming vegetables for five years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lelia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell used clothes business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Lelia is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy used clothes like pants, shorts, etc. to sell in her used clothes business.

Lelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy used clothes like pants, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 55 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Myrna is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Myrna has been in this business for 25 years and also earns additional income from dealing coconut wine.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 50 years old and has three children. She is widowed and has one child in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Marieta requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Marieta has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 62 years old and married with five children.
She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Paulina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.
Paulina has been in this business for 15 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.
She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Vilen

texts.en:
Vilen is a taxi driver from Kapan, Syuniq region. Using his own car, Vilen has been providing a taxi service for already five years. Vilen is a father of two. His children attend local secondary school and his wife is unemployed and takes care of the household. 

To be able to purchase four tires and renovate damaged parts of the car, Vilen has applied for this loan. His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for four tires and renovate damaged parts of the car.

loans.name: Kakhaber

texts.en:
Kakhaber is 38 years old and from a small village of Ozurgeti district. He is married and lives with his wife and mother. Kakhaber is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a plot of agricultural land where he grows maize and mandarin trees. Kakhaber sells the harvested products locally. 

He decided to expand the agribusiness and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2,400 GEL. With the received credit, he will build a greenhouse and will grow greens there. This will increase his family income, and with increased income, he will be able to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse and grow greens

loans.name: Flor Alba

texts.es:
Flor es una mujer de 38 años de edad, entregada a las labores del hogar y la crianza de sus dos hijos, al ser una mujer baja de recursos busco una alternativa de entrada de dinero que le permitiera seguir desempeñando sus actividades y al mismo tiempo ser útil económicamente para su familia.
Esto la conllevo a vender ropa, una actividad en la que ha encontrado gran ayuda para apoyar a su esposo en el sostenimiento del hogar y de los hijos.
Vende ropa para hombre, dama, niño y niño y ahora se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de surtido de todo tipo de ropa con el fin de promover más su actividad aprovechando que sus hijos se encentran estudiando y tiene un poco de tiempo.
Su sueño es tener en un futuro su propio almacén de ropa y prosperar junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Flor is a 38 year old woman committed to taking care of her house and raising two children. Being a woman of low resources she was looking for an alternative to make money which would allow her to continue to carry out her activities and at the same time be economically helpful to her family. This led her to sell clothing, a business that she has found to be very helpful in helping her husband in supporting the household and the children.

She sells clothing for men, women, girls and boys and now she finds herself requesting a loan to buy an assortment of all kinds of clothing with the aim of promoting her business. She will take advantage that her children are studying and she has some time. Her dream is to have her own store in the future and prosper together with her family.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of clothing for girls and boys.

loans.name: Narek

texts.en:
Narek is from Kapan and is living with his parents. For two years Narek has been involved in providing taxi services in Kapan and nearby villages.
To earn additional income for his family's living, Narek is also involved in the buying and selling of metal and wood scraps. Now, to be able to pay for renovation of his car as well as new tires, Narek has applied for this loan. Narek's loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for renovation and new tires for his taxi.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine and her husband own a taxi service business in Qajaran town. Their service includes seven cars providing taxi service in the Qajaran-Yerevan direction. 

Because one of their cars is not functioning well and needs to be repaired, Narine has applied for this loan. She needs the loan to pay for the repairs of the damaged car and purchase tires. 

Narine's loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to a damaged car and purchase tires

loans.name: Elda Maria

texts.es:
Elda es una joven de 27 años de edad, que se siente aprisionada el cuidado de sus dos hijos y la monotonía del hogar, los problemas financieros  han causado una depresión en ella, pero gracias a su venta de mercancía como lo es ropa para niños y niñas ha ido saliendo de estos problemas y ha encontrado una fuente tanto de ingresos como de entretenimiento.
Su propósito con el negocio es mejorar sus condiciones de vida, vivir dignamente, comer mejor.
Con la ayuda de un préstamo que se encuentra solicitando quiere mejorar su oferta a los clientes, darles más posibilidades más estilo para asegurar una venta, comprara surtido de ropa para niño y niña en general.
Apoya a esta mujer que con esfuerzo, trabajo y los recursos que tiene a la mano busca una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Elda, 27, is a young woman who feels she is trapped by a monotonous life at home, since she has to stay and take care of her two children. She has felt depressed due to financial problems, but thanks to her business, she has found a source of income and a way to occupy herself. She sells clothes for children. Her goal with this business is to improve her living conditions, live a dignified life and eat better.

With the help of this loan she is requesting, she wants to be able to offer better things, more choices and more designs to her customers. To improve her sales, she will buy clothes for boys and girls.

Support this woman, who works hard and makes the most of the resources she has to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ien

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, Ien is aged 49 years and married. He has four children. 

To support the family, he and his wife have been in farming rice for thirty years. The current business earns him family about 57,000 KHR per day to meet his family’s needs. 

This is the first loan for Ien with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now he is applying for a loan to buy a solar panel. He hopes this loan will enable him to have it for his family's use.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase some of home appliances for her house as well as larger amounts of women´s clothes, perfume, and incense to increase her business

loans.name: Sidra

texts.en:
Sidra is the age of 45; she is mother of three children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, so he is unable to generate any amount of income. 

He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Sidra has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Sidra is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the repairing cost of her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase some carpentry items, cement, sand, and iron steel to complete the building of the house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance on her sons lathe machine.

loans.name: Hmaw Ei Village Group-1

texts.en:
This community is located in Hmaw Ei Village at Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region and consists of five CBO (Community Based Organization) members overseeing a group of 20 village customers. The loan will help to group members to purchase high-quality feeds costing $200 that last for a month for 100 ducks. Raising ducks has become one of the main income sources in this village.

Hmaw Ei village is estimated of having over 400 households, and many of them focus on livestock and farming. While ducks are the most popular livestock, families also raise chickens for income and pigs as a source of savings. Some families plant seasonal or yearly fruits and vegetables such as betel, coconuts and bananas. These vegetables are sold to nearby markets or villages. Additionally, centrally located households have opened small sweet shops in front of their houses. 

Pictured above are the CBO members from Hmaw Ei group-1 named Zin, Than, Sa and Aye. The picture was taken in front of a small snack shop of the secondary school in the village.  

Zin, first from right in the picture, is 26 years old and married with one child who is a primary student. The couple have been raising ducks for over two years. They now have 120 ducks. For additional income, Zin's husband works on other farms as a daily laborer.  

Proximity's loan will help Zin purchase high quality feeds that will nourish her ducks and enable more duck egg production. This income boost will enable the family income to pay for necessary household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase high quality feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his house.

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.en: Munavvar is a responsible woman who was born in 1968. She is living in remote district and is divorced. She has three children who she has raised alone. She is a nurse and works at a medical clinic. The salary that she earns from her job is not enough to cover family expenditures. She left her job and started a business. For almost a year, she has been selling fast food. She needs to renovate her counter, in order to attract more clients. She prepares delicious fast food. She is asking for a 2,500 TJS loan for renovating her counter.

loans.use: to renovate her counter.

loans.name: Msasani Group

texts.en:
Anna, who is in her late 30's, is married with three kids who are still at school.  She has been a food vendor for seven years now.  She works from 5 AM to midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Anna's sixteenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to sell chips with meat balls, with eggs, and with chicken, and also sold drinks and started selling mamalishe.  She is doing fine and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.  

She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a plot of land, saved for loan repayments, and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to  restock the out of stock items in her mamalishe business.  She dreams of owning a hotel.

Anna will share this loan with her loan group, Msasani, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in her mamalishe business.

loans.name: Savang

texts.en:
Savang is a married woman from Kampong Speu Province, who is 48 years old. She has three children. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing and selling rice and vegetables to the local dealers. She has been involved in this business for thirty years. She is able to make an income of USD 2.00 per day, on average.
Recently, some parts of her house have deteriorated and they need to be fixed to provide a suitable living for the household. Due to lack of funds, she has applied for a KIVA loan via HKL to pay for her house renovation. She and her family will be thankful to the lenders for helping to fund the loan in order to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to pay for house renovations.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine,46, is a married woman with six children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Josephine has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines.She has been in this business for 20 years. 

Josephine requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy coconut wine and soft drinks. In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy coconut wine and soft drinks.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 40 years old, married and has seven children. Four of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Amalia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetables farm.

Amalia has been farming vegetables for 25 years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Amalia would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetables farm.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rebecca is 37 years old, and one child is in school.

Rebecca has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Rebecca requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber for her business.

Rebecca has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber

loans.name: Cresencio

texts.es:
Cresencio tiene 63 años de edad, está casado y tiene dos hijos que viven con él, uno de ellos estudia bachillerato y el otro le ayuda en las actividades agrícolas.

Cresencio es agricultor, desde su infancia se dedica a esta actividad, decidió trabajar en esto pues no podía continuar con sus estudios por la situación económica, sus hijos le ayudan en el trabajo siempre que pueden.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca que está preñada, pues se la están vendiendo a buen precio y él quiere aprovechar la oportunidad.

Su sueño es que su hijo siga estudiando, y que su hijo mayor también pueda superarse.
texts.en:
Cresencio is 63 years old, married, and has two children who live with him.  One child is in college and the other helps out with the agricultural work.  Cresencio is a farmer, and has made a living this way since his childhood.  He decided to work in this field since he could not continue school due to their financial situation.  His children help out with his work whenever they can.

He needs the loan in order to buy a pregnant cow because they are being sold for a good price and he wants to take advantage of the opportunity.  His dream is for his one son to continue studying and for his older son to be able to improve himself as well.

loans.use: to buy a pregnant cow.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman lives in Kapan, in the Syuniq region, with his parents. He works at a local metal processing factory and also provides taxi services.
Arman works hard to earn a good income for his family. The car that he currently drives as a taxi is using excessive oil. Arman has applied for this loan to install a new fuel system to save on costs.
Arman's loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to install a new fuel system in his taxi.

loans.name: Mikheil

texts.en: Mikheil is a 46-year-old married man. He lives with his wife in Gurjaani, in the Kakheti region of East Georgia. Mikhiel trades fruits and vegetables at the local market. His wife stays home. He is very experienced in this field and decided to expand his business and trade cheese as well. The start up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 300 USD. With the received credit he will purchase a stock of various cheeses and will resell them with a price markup. Mikheil is very motivated to increase his family´s income and awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of cheeses.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a fighter, a woman who works daily for the benefit of her family to give them a better future and a better quality of life. When she was denied a job opportunity, she was not deterred and sought alternatives to be and feel useful. It is this feeling that prompted her to start her farming 10 years ago. 

She hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya, an area that has one of the best weather patterns on earth that favors farming. Elizabeth is the proud mother of lovely children whom she adores and always protects. Elizabeth’s upbringing was very challenging, and because of this, she promised herself that she would work hard to get out of poverty. That is why she started farming. 

Through farming, she has been able to earn a decent income. Elizabeth is the breadwinner of her family, and this really pushes her to work hard so that her children will have a bright future and her parents will have a comfortable life. 

Elizabeth is seeking a loan to start horticultural farming so that she can use the excess space on her land. She dreams of buying more land and increasing her horticultural farming. Accessing funds is very difficult for a woman in Africa, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, Elizabeth is optimistic that her dream will be realized and her life will completely change. Through the income from horticultural farming, Elizabeth will assure her children of a bright future and will be able to pay tuition fees for her siblings who depend on her. 

Through your loan, the promise of supporting small-scale farmers will be achieved.

loans.use: to start horticultural farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace a moto rickshaw's body for her son.

loans.name: Hajira

texts.en:
Hajira is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a chef by profession; he provides services for cooking food for marriage ceremonies, parties and fun-fair programs. He cooks delicious Pakistani food such as biryani, qorma, roast chicken and fish, and for sweet dishes, he prepares firni and kheer. He is a very famous chef of his town and most of the people like him to cook food for their ceremonies. 

With his chef services he provides crockery as well. Due to continuous usage, most of the crockery has been broken or scratched. For keeping his business constant, he wants to buy new crockery for his chef business. Due to his household expenses, he does not have a sufficient amount to buy the crockery. Therefore, Hajira requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy new crockery.

Hajira is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan for this honorable favor.

loans.use: to buy crockery for her husband's cooking work

loans.name: Rosa Liliam

texts.es:
Liliam, de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está casada y su esposo trabaja en una herrería, tiene dos hijos, que están estudiando.

Liliam, al igual que su esposo, se dedica a la herrería (Elaboración de herramientas agrícolas, machetes).-  Ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace muchos años y la aprendió de su esposo.- Liliam, viaja una distancia de 400 metros para vender sus productos.

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de machetes, ya que se acerca la temporada agrícola.- En estos meses Liliam, aumenta su producción, porque sabe que la demanda es alta.

El sueño de Liliam, es algún día poder hacer su vivienda de ladrillo, ya que actualmente es de barro; con el préstamo podrá aumentar sus ingresos y de esta manera reinvertir sus ganancias en su mismo negocio.
texts.en:
Liliam, 39, studied up to the second grade. She is married and her husband is a blacksmith. They have two children, who go to school. Liliam, like her husband, is also a blacksmith (she makes tools for agriculture, such as machetes). She has been doing this for many years, and walks 400 meters [1,300 feet] to sell her products.

She will use this loan to buy raw materials to make machetes, now that the harvesting season is coming. During these months, Liliam increases her production, because she knows the demand will be high.

Her dream is to build a brick house one day. The one she has today is made of clay. With this loan, her income will increase and she will be able to reinvest the profits in her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make machetes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy welding rods, soldering rods and iron rods for manufacturing iron accessories for her son's business.

loans.name: Fiza

texts.en:
Fiza is active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a 50-year-old woman. She lives with her five children and husband in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her son has been running a mobile shop for past fifteen years. He sells new mobiles and mobile accessories such as chargers, batteries, hand-frees, blue tooth devices, etc., in his shop. 

He speaks with an even tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of his customers. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up a very good relation with his customers. 

Fiza requested for loan, so that her son would be able to buy more stock of new mobiles as well as accessories such as batteries, chargers, hand-frees, and blue tooth devices to increase his business.

Fiza is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more mobiles and accessories for her son's mobile shop

loans.name: Hmaw Ei Village Group-2

texts.en:
This community is located in the Hmaw Ei Village of the Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region and group 2 consists of five CBO (Community Based Organization) members overseeing a group of twenty-four village customers. The loan will help some group members to purchase high-quality feeds, costing $200 that feed 100 ducks for a month, while other group members will use the funds to purchase ducks. Raising ducks has become one of the main income sources in these villages.

Hmaw Ei Village has a population of over four hundred, many of whom either focus on livestock raising, farming, or both. Of those farming, some families plant seasonal or yearly fruits and vegetables such as betel, coconuts and bananas. These vegetables are sold to nearby markets or villages. For additional income, the villagers also raise non-duck livestock such as pigs and chickens.

Pictured above are the CBO members from Hmaw Ei Group 2, named Thein, Aye, Khin, Aye M and Soe. Thein, first from right in the photo, is forty years old and married with four children. He and his wife are proud of their children, one is a secondary student, one will start primary school next year, and the remaining two children are older and help the family on the farm. Thein and his family have been raising livestock for the past three years. In addition to ducks, the family also raises pigs as a source of savings. The funds from Kiva will help Thein's family purchase ducks that will boost the family's income from more duck eggs and greater proceeds from sales of full-grown ducks.

loans.use: to help the Hmaw Ei Group-2 members purchase ducks as well as high-quality feed.

loans.name: Sauy

texts.en: Sauy is a 36-year-old widowed factory worker with three children in her care. She lives in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Sauy has worked in the factory since 2011. Among the three children, the oldest is working in the factory, and the next two attend school. Together, they can earn approximately $10 each day. Sauy would like to build a toilet for the family, but she does not have enough savings to buy bricks and cement. With this loan, the family will build a toilet, which will improve their living conditions. In the future, Sauy hopes to build a proper house and help her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy bricks and cement to build a toilet

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing to later sell.

loans.name: Ana Laura

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 24 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y estudia Quimica en la escuela industrial.
Ella es inteligente, dulce, sencilla, responsable y trabajadora. Sus estudios lo realiza en una escuela industrial ubicada en la zona de ‘Achachicala’ lugar caracterizado por sus orígenes; campesino aymaras que pelearon por la liberación del yugo español y se asentaron en ese lugar como trinchera, se encuentra sobre una ladera de la ciudad, donde las calles son pendientes y empinadas. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 6-18 grados centígrados y a una altura promedio de 3820 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Ana es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa suelto, ojos obscuros,  complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que ya no habla, habla español para estudiar y estudia el idioma inglés como segunda lengua. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres, que es propia y está construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina y cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, electricidad, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Ella estudia la carrera de Química en una escuela industrial y estará capacitada para intervenir científicamente en todos aquellos asuntos vinculados con la materia y sus transformaciones; estas transformaciones pueden deberse a cambios energéticos o a cambios en la composición del sistema en cuestión. “estudio Química en un instituto y trabajo como ayudante de cocina en un café muy conocido, ambas ocupaciones se adueñan de todo mi tiempo, y necesito una computadora portátil para terminar mi carrera profesional…” comenta. Su sueño es salir profesional y trabajar en un laboratorio reconocido, ella desea realizar la compra de una computadora portátil para terminar su carrera profesional. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que estudia y trabaja.
Es por esos motivos que Ana solicita un préstamo para la compra de una computadora portátil para terminar su carrera profesional y trabajar en un laboratorio.
texts.en:
Ana is 24 years old, single without children, and she's studying chemistry. She is intelligent, sweet, unassuming, responsible, and she works hard.

She studies at a technical school located in the "Achachicala" zone, which is known for its origins: Aymará farmers entrenched the zone and settled there when they were fighting for independence from the Spanish rule. This zone is on a city slope of steep, high streets, at an average altitude of 3820 meters above sea level. It is an area of cold, dry climate with daytime temperatures ranging from six to 18 degrees centigrade.

Ana has dark complexion, long black hair that she wears loose, dark eyes, and she is slender in size. Her mother language is Aymará which she no longer speaks. She speaks Spanish for her studies and is studying English as a second language. 

She lives in her parents' home. They own their house, which is built of brick with a corrugated iron roof. The house has drinking water, electricity, residential gas, and sewer system services.

Her career studies in chemistry are training her to work scientifically in issues relating to matter and its transformations that can be due to energetic changes or systematic composition changes.

"I study chemistry at an institute, and I work as a kitchen helper in a popular cafe. Both of these activities take up all my time, and I need a laptop to finish my career studies..", she comments.

Her dream is to obtain her degree and get a job with a recognized laboratory. She wants to buy a laptop to finish school and this is why she is requesting the loan. 

This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the five years that she has been studying and working.

loans.use: to buy a laptop so that she can complete her career studies and get a job at a laboratory.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 42 years old and has four children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Sally requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Sally has been in this business for 16 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Sally would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is a 38-year-old married man from a small village in the Khelvachauri district. He lives with his wife and parents. 

The family runs agribusiness. In particular, they grow nut and mandarin trees and sell the harvest locally as well as nearby villages. 

Gela decided to generate additional income  and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 3,000 GEL. 

With the received credit he will purchase a car and will start taxi business. He will serve local people as a taxi driver and will be able to increase family income.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Tusimame Group

texts.fr: Madame Lutonde est une femme ambitieuse présidente du  groupe  de crédit Tusimame.  Elle reçu un appui financier de la part de son époux en 1985 qui lui permis de se lancer dans le petit commerce.  Agée de 57 ans, elle est mariée à un journaliste et  mère de 8 enfants qui  vont  tous  à  l’école.  Elle sollicite un nouveau crédit  pour  renforcer son stock en 5 douzaines des assiettes en porcelaine.  Au delà de la mévente qui s’observe en ce période de janvier, son objectif est  de renforcer son système d'éargne afin de scolariser convenablement ses enfants et rehabiliter sa maison.  Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima  pour son appui.
texts.en: Mrs. Lutonde is an enterprising person and the leader of the Tusimame borrowers’ group. She has received financial support from her husband, which enabled her to launch a vending business. She is 57 years old, married to a journalist, and has eight children, all of whom are in school. She is seeking this new loan to replenish her stock and buy five dozens of china dinner plates. In view of a dip in sales in January, she would like to bolster her savings in order to be able to provide for her children’s education in due fashion and renovate her house. She thanks Hekima for its assistance.

loans.use: to restock by buying five dozens of china plates.

loans.name: Iftiman

texts.en: Iftiman is 48 years old and the father of two children ages 10 and 12. His wife works in a clinic to help support the family. He is a master mechanic who fixes bicycles and scooters and has been working in this field for more than 10 years. He is very professional and is very well known in his area with a very good reputation and many customers. Iftiman works in his workshop that is part of his home all day. He loves his profession and takes pride in his work. He is requesting a loan for the first time in order to purchase some mechanic's tools in order to continue his business and provide quality products and services to his customers. He is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for the support towards his goal, which is to expand his business and eventually sell vehicles and scooters.

loans.use: to purchase mechanic's tools

loans.name: Jacob's Group

texts.en: Jacob is 29 years old and is often described as a very resourceful person. As a group leader, Jacob is representing his group of 16 farmers in Webuye District in Kenya. He is excited to be joining One Acre Fund for the first time this year. The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Jacob's desire to have access to the best seed prices. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to buy a cow. Jacob and his group will receive a total of 11 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 8 acres.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Thae Kone Ka Lay Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located in Thae Kone Ka Lay Village, Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region and consists of 31 village customers, overseen by 5 CBO (Community Based Organization) members. This loan will enable some group members to purchase high-quality feed (costing $30 a week feed for 100 ducks) that will boost their income from more duck eggs. Other members will use the funds to purchase both ducks and ducklings. 

Thae Kone Ka Lay village has over 350 households with an estimated population of over 1,000. Most of the men from Thae Kone Ka Lay Village are livestock raisers and farmers.  Farmers plant rice paddy and seasonal vegetables and fruits. In addition to ducks, many Thae Kone Ka Lay villagers raise pigs, chickens, and water buffalo. Pigs are mainly used as a source of savings, water buffalo are used to cultivate land, while chickens are used to boost income (similar to ducks).

Pictured above are CBO members from Thae Kone Ka Lay, named Khin, Hla N, Hla, Khin A and Toe. Khin (in the middle of the photo) is fifty-six years old and married. Khin has six children, five of which work in Yangon, while the youngest is a student.  Khin has a crop farm and over 100 ducks.  Khin has been raising ducks for 15 years.  Proximity's loan will help Khin to purchase better duck feed that will improve duck nourishment, boosting the family's income from more duck eggs, less disease, and more proceeds from duck sales.

loans.use: members purchase more ducks and high-quality feed

borrowers.first_name: Thae Kone Ka Lay Village Group

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seafood, shoes and rubber gloves for her seafood business.

loans.name: Edvard

texts.en:
Edvard is a constructor from Stepanavan town. He lives with his retired mother and wife and is the only worker in the family. 

Edvard has been providing construction services to local people for ten years. Currently, to be able to purchase the rotary hammer drill he needs for providing construction work, Edvard has applied for this loan. 

His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for the rotary hammer drill he needs for providing construction work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase beverages, coffee, sugar, milk, detergent soap, food seasonings, and canned goods.

loans.name: Norma Karen

texts.es:
Norma es una mujer de 28 años de edad, divorciada, tiene un hijo varón de 6 meses y una hija mujer de 10 años, y su negocio es la atención de una tienda de barrio con alimentos de primera necesidad.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, de buena actitud, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Buenos Aires’ un espacio urbano donde la cultura se vive intensamente todo el año, Su mayor riqueza patrimonial no sólo son sus innumerables edificios, o su paisaje natural, sino la cultura viva o intangible como las tradiciones, costumbres, fiestas, entradas folklóricas, religiosidad que se expresan por medio de sus habitantes durante todo el ciclo festivo, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 2-18 grados centígrados.
Norma es de tez morena, cabello castaño largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, ojos obscuros, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela y el menor es un bebé que se encuentra a su cuidado, viven en una casa alquilada, construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la atención de una tienda de barrio con alimentos de primera necesidad como; azúcar, pan, harina, arroz, fideo y otros. “comencé mi negocio realizando la venta de películas en DVD, luego amplié mi negocio y abrí una tienda de barrio…” comenta. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y mejorar su publicidad, ella desea realizar la compra de un refrigerador para la venta de productos perecederos, como leche, yogurt, carnes frías y otros. Esta es la primeras secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de manera independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Norma solicita un préstamo para la compra de un refrigerador para vender alimentos perecederos y aumentar su volumen de ventas
texts.en:
Norma is a 28-year-old woman who is divorced, has a 6-month-old son and a 10-year-old daughter, and whose business is tending to a neighborhood store for staple foods.  She is a good mother, has a good attitude, and is independent, responsible, and hard-working.  She carries out her business in the "Buenos Aires" area in an urban space where the culture is vivid all year long.  Its greatest cultural wealth is not only its countless buildings, or its natural landscape, but its living or intangible culture like traditions, customs, fiestas, folkloric items, and piety that is expressed through its inhabitants during the entire holiday season.  It is also known for its cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day from 12-18 degrees centigrade.

Norma has a dark complexion and long brown hair that she wears tied back in a ponytail.  She has dark eyes, and is physically strong.  Her native language is the Aymará that she speaks among family, but she speaks Spanish for everyday use and at work.  She shares her life with her children; the oldest is in school and the youngest is a baby still under her care.  They live in a rental house that is made from brick and has a corrugated metal roof.  It has potable water, electricity, gas, and sewage.  Her job is tending to a neighborhood store for staple foods like sugar, bread, flour, rice, and noodles, among other items.  

"I started my business by selling DVD movies.  Later I expanded my business and opened a neighborhood store..." she says.

Her dream is to grow her business and improve her advertising.  She wishes to purchase a refrigerator in order to sell perishable items like milk, yogurt, frozen meat, and other things.  This is her first cycle of loans with the institution in the two years that she has carried out this business independently.  It is for these reasons that Norma asks for a loan to buy a refrigerator in order to sell perishable food items and increase her sales volume.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator in order to sell perishable food items and to increase her sales volume.

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.en:
Zarrina is a conscientious woman. She was born in 1990. She is living in a rural area. She is married. She has two children. Her husband is an emigrant. 

Zarrina is a responsible, hardworking, and confident person. She is a seller. She has a grocery store where she sells nutrition products. She has been busy with this kind of business for about a year. She attracts many clients around. 

Zarrina wants to increase her activity. She requested financial support from Kiva project to buy grocery products. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy grocery products

loans.name: Bakbu

texts.ru: Бакбу, 59 лет, вдова, сыновья взрослые и самостоятельные. У Бакбу среднее образование, она на пенсии. Также много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Бакбу на сегодняшний день имеется 30 овец. На участке мерою 1,16 Га она выращивает фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль Бакбу составляет около 8,000 сом (KGS). Этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса и увеличения прибыли, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 20 овец. Доходы от кредита Бакбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и улучшение благосостояния семьи.
texts.en: Bakbu is 59, widowed, and has an independent adult son. She has a secondary education and is retired. She has been raising livestock and planting crops for many years. Thanks to Bakbu's hard work, she currently has 30 sheep and plants beans to sell on a 1.16 hectare plot of land, earning around 8,000 som (KGS) per month. This amount of money is nowhere near enough to live decently. She applied for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank in order to expand her business and increase her profits by buying 20 sheep. She plans to use the profits to continue developing her business and improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 20 sheep in order to help bolster her income

loans.name: Jorge Alcivar

texts.es: Jorge  es un joven trabajador de 23 años de edad, el vive con una hermana y se dedica a trabajar al jornal y es un año que empezó con su negocio de crianza de pollos, Jorge tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad,  Jorge necesita el dinero del crédito para comprar pollos que los tiene en un espacio que hay en la casa donde vive, la aspiración de Jorge es de comprar mas pollos y así mejorar su negocio  y seguir trabajando para el bienestar de su hijo.
texts.en: Jorge is a young, hardworking man at 23 years old. He lives with his sister and has a 3 year-old son. He works as a day labourer and started his business of raising chickens one year ago. He needs the money from the loan to buy chickens that he would keep in a space in his home. Jorge's dream is to buy more chickens to help him improve his business and carry on working hard to ensure the wellbeing of son.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Jaime Leonel

texts.es:
Jaime de 41 años de edad, estudió solo 1° grado, esta casado y vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, los cuales todos van a la escuela mientras que su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.


Jaime se dedica a cuidar ganados, trabaja para un señor de su comunidad que tiene gran cantidad de ganado; él toda su vida ha trabajado con vacas desde muy pequeño, ademas el posee tres vacas de las cuales obtiene leche y sus derivados para el consumo de su familia.



El crédito lo solicita para comprar cemento, hierro, arena y también para pagar la mano de obra y asi construir su casa, ya que por el momento solo tiene los bloques.



Su sueño es ver terminada su casa para iniciar una nueva vida con su esposa e hijos.
texts.en:
Jaime is 41 years old and has a first-grade education. He is married and lives with his wife and three children. Jaime’s children are in school; his wife looks after the home.

Jaime makes a living looking after cattle. He works for a man in his community who owns a large number of cattle. Jaime has worked with cows since a very young age. He also owns three cows that he keeps to have their milk and derived products for his family to consume.

Jaime is applying for a loan in order to buy cement, iron and sand, and to pay labourers and thus build his house. For the moment, Jaime only has bricks to start this work.

Jaime’s dream is to finish building his house in order to start a new life with his wife and children.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron and sand, and to pay labourers and thus build his house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase construction materials as cement, bricks, sands and other materials to expand the house through building extra rooms.

loans.name: Victoria's Group

texts.en:
Victoria is 45 years old and has 6 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Victoria has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Victoria also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Victoria's Group will be able to receive a total of 3 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Zeyad

texts.en:
Zeyad is a 35-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and four kids in a simple, humble house. 

Zeyad works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Zeyad would like to improve the family living conditions, so he took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for his house; this will enable him to provide clean water for his family.

Zeyad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his house

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San, 62, lives in Kampong Speu Province of Cambodia. 

To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located in her community. So far, she has been in this type of business for almost forty years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 3.00 a day. 

Currently, she would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of traveling. 

She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Pok

texts.en:
POK, 33 year old, lives in a rural area of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has three children. 

She is a garment factory worker and earns, on average, an income of USD 5.00 a day. So far, she has been in this career for two years. Her husband, Meit, 33, is a construction worker with an earning of USD 11.00 a day, on average. 

POK would like to apply for a Kiva loan via HKL and she is going to use this loan to buy jewelry. POK thinks that now the price of gold seems to be decreasing. Thus, it is a good time for her to buy jewelry at a low price and keep it to sell when its price increases. 

She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to re-sell

loans.name: Dúo Celeste De San Mateo Group

texts.es:
Dúo Celeste de San Mateo
Este dúo está formado por doña Mayra Alcira, ella tiene 38 años de edad, y se dedica a la crianza de animales como cerdos, gallinas criollas y conejos, desde ya hace muchos años, en un terrenito ubicado en san Mateo Milpas Altas, ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de marranos, concentrado y compra de gallinas, su deseo es criarlos y vacunarlos para que crezcan bien, para así poder destazarlos y venderlos ella misma,espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
“Celeste de San Mateo” duo

This duo has Mayra Alcira as one of its members. She is 38 years old and makes a living raising animals, such as pigs, hens and rabbits. She has been doing this for many years on land in San Mateo Milpas Altas.

Mayra is applying for a loan in order to buy pigs, hens and feed. She wants to raise the animals and vaccinate them to keep them healthy. She can then slaughter and sell them herself. Mayra hopes that you can help her with this loan.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Azel

texts.en:
Azel is 29 years old and married, and she has two children.

Azel is in the agriculture business in the Philippines. Azel requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Azel has been in this business for 6 years now, and she has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marvi

texts.en:
Marvi works hard to support her family. Marvi is a married woman and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Marvi requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and pay for maintenance for her motorcycle.

Marvi has been in this business for 9 years now, and also earns additional income from fishing.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for maintenance for her motorcycle

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean works hard to support her family. Jean is a widow, with one child, and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Jean requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her customers.

She has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a widowed woman, 62 years old, with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Helen has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Helen has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Roselyne's Group

texts.en:
Roselyne is a 56-year-old proud mother of six children. She is a group leader, often described as a very reliable person, and is representing her group of 13 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Roselyne has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Roselyne described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, Roselyne’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 15 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Annabel is 35 years old, and has three children who are still in school.

Annabel has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing net and fishing equipment.

Annabel has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and fishing equipment

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen de 38 años de edad, solo estudio hasta el 5 grado de educación básica, actualmente está acompañada y tiene dos hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando, su compañero de vida se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos. 


Carmen tiene 12 años en la venta de tortillas y frutas picadas, ella vende todos los días, se levanta a las 4 de la mañana a  coser el maíz para llevarlo al molino y así comenzar a las 7 de la mañana a elaborar las tortillas, desde pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar y menciona que le gusta el comercio, su puesto de trabajo está a 500 metros de su vivienda.  


Ella necesita mucho de este crédito para comprar maíz para la elaboración de las tortillas y más frutas para venderla picada.


Ella quiere seguir trabajando y que a sus hijos no les falte nada, que se preparen académicamente, que aprendan a trabajar y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carmen is 38 years old. She only went to school up until 5th grade. Now she is married and has two children that go to school. Her life partner makes a living growing basic grains.  

Carmen has been selling tortillas and chopped fruit everyday for 12 years. She gets up at 4 in the morning to cook and then grind the corn so that she can start making the tortillas at 7. From when she was small, her parents taught her to work and she describes how she likes business. Her workplace is 500 metres away from her home.  

She really needs this loan to buy corn in order to make tortillas and more fruit to later sell chopped up.

She wants to carry on working so that her children are not deprived of anything, and so that they are well educated and learn to work. She also wants to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy corn in order to make tortillas and more fruit to later sell chopped up.

loans.name: Maria Iliana

texts.es: Maria Ileana gracias al esfuerzo que ha puesto en su negocio desde hace 30 años ha dado frutos para ella y su familia. Se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y cuenta con el apoyo de su única hija en todo lo que necesita. Dentro de las expectativas de esta mujer luchadora esta hacer crecer el negocio y convertirlo en una tienda de ropa nueva. Maria Ileana para seguir creciendo solicita un crédito para comprar pacas de ropa usada. De esta manera lograra abastecer su inventario y ofrecerles mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Iliana has put forth many efforts in her business for the last 30 years and it is paying off for her and her family. She makes a living selling used clothing and the support of her only daughter is all that she needs. Within the expectations of this tenacious woman is to grow the business and convert it to a store selling new clothes.

In order to continue growing, Maria Iliana is requesting a loan to buy bales of used clothing. In this way she can stock up on her inventory and offer a better variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Jefferson Polibio

texts.es: Polibio  es un joven soltero de 19 años de edad, Polibio se  dedica a la crianza y comercialización de chanchos y también  trabaja de chofer, Polibio  vive con sus padres y en esta casa hay chancheras donde puede criar sus animales, por este motivo Polibio necesita el crédito para invertirlo en la comprar de chanchos, la aspiración de este joven es mejorar su negocio y asi salir adelante con su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Polibio is 19 years old and makes a living raising and selling pigs. He also works as a driver. Polibio lives with his parents. At home, there is a pig farm to raise his animals. 

Polibio needs this loan in order to buy pigs. Polibio aspires to improving his business and moving forward with his family and improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Ayşe

texts.en:
Ayse is married with one child and has been a hairdresser for ten years. She spent five years as an apprentice before opening her own shop, which did not do well because of the rising costs for small business owners. She has had to move cities and open another shop.

Slowly she is making it work, but would like to use the credit to buy products for her shop so that she can make a profit doing salon services and sales. She would like to use the profit to make a better life for her family.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Ayşe hanım evli bir çocuk annesi, on yıldır kuaför. Kuaförlüğe beş yıl başkalarının dükkanında çırak olarak başlıyor. Para biriktiriyor ve kuaför dükkanı açıyor, işleri ilk açtığı yıllar da iyi gitmiyor ve şehir değiştiriyor. Tekrar yeni bir şehir ve yeni bir dükkan açıyor. İşler yavaş yavaş olmaya devam ediyor. Aldığı kredi ile dükkana kuaför malzemesi alıyor. Hizmet ve satış yaparak para kazanmayı planlıyor. Ailesine güzel bir gelecek hazırlamayı planlıyor.

loans.use: to buy products for her shop.

loans.name: Xhejlane

texts.en:
Xhejlane is 38 years old and has one son who is 8 years old. Her husband is a salesman, but receives a very low salary. In order to assist her family, she has been running her own handicraft business for more than 10 years now and is busy all day long with the client demands. Usually she makes things for weddings and other celebrations for women, and is especially busy in the spring and summer seasons. She is very happy and pleased to be able to do her work and be home with her child, but even happier that she is able to contribute to the family. 

She is now requesting a loan in order to purchase more materials for her work so she can be prepared for the upcoming busy season. 

She is very happy and grateful to the Kiva lenders and their support.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her work so she can be prepared for the upcoming busy season
